Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: snsliz
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was friendly, regular room with king bed on second floor provided a nice park view of plumeria and hibiscus. We were across from beach and in the center of Kihei. Many restaurants within walking distance. Hotel pool and extras like the bikes, water in room, pool/beach towels and being able to rent beach chairs in gift shop made our short stay wonderful. We were only in Kihei for 4 days for a wedding and chose hotel accomodations for that reason. Thank you Maui Coast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice accommodations”
Reviews.Author: JDC121
Reviews.Content: I found this place after an exhaustive online search for hotels near the beach for less than $300 a night. I was traveling with a friend, and we wanted to be near bars and restaurants, and the Maui Coast Hotel did not disappoint. The room was quite nice, comparable to something like a Hampton Inn or a Doubletree. Staff were generally pretty friendly, and they didn't seem to mind that we brought our own beers to the hot tub area. One thing worth noting is that the pool / hot tub area tends to attract a lot of locals who live nearby. In fact, the majority of the people we met there told us they lived nearby, and that the hotel doesn't mind them being there because they buy drinks from the pool bar. I didn't get too upset about this, but the hotel charges guests a $17.50 per day "resort fee" which includes use of, among other things, the pool and hot tubs. Locals don't pay the resort fee. Most of the folks we met were very friendly, but we got a sense that some try to rip off tourists; they'll strike up a lively conversation and then casually ask your name and what room you're staying in. With that information, one could charge drinks to your room from the pool bar or the adjacent restaurant. So just be careful what information you give people. The hotel allows guests to use their (very nice) Trek mountain bikes. Since you probably won't read the fine print on the waiver you have to fill out, make sure you get the bikes back by dusk. They don't like when you keep them out later. Finally, bring your own soap and shampoo. The stuff they provide in the bathrooms looks fancy but it's useless.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: gilyb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best ever!! The staff are all lovely and nothing is too much trouble, always happy and smiling. Its very clean, pool bar is great and happy hour everyday from 3-6!!! The rooms are big and very comfortable, laundry rooms on each floor. Location is brilliant as you are in the center for all resturants and across the road from the beaches and can go for walks Try Cafe O'Lei, and Spices the food there is amazing but be careful the portions are very big but you can split it at a small cost! Loved this hotel can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “$17.50 per day Resort Fee? Really??!!”
Reviews.Author: Chompypf
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying that we were able to stay at the Maui Coast Hotel in Kihei because of a great online package deal with airfare and car rental included. And, I will say that this is a VERY nice hotel. Our room was large, clean, comfortable and updated. The cleaning staff knew our names and always asked us if we needed anything even if we did not want service that day. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. The premises were well-maintained and the atmosphere quiet. But, I will complain about the $17.50/day resort fee. What?! You heard me right. This fee was advertised in the very fine print in our package information and I didn't notice it prior to purchasing the package. I'm not sure I would have changed my mind on purchasing the package had I seen it in advance, but now that I've been there, it will be something I keep in mind for future visits to Maui. What do you get for your $17.50/day resort fee? Use of the pool (uh, shouldn't that be included in the room price), towels to use at the pool or the beach, access to the tennis courts with equipment, bike rental with safety equipment, and free shuttle to Kihei and Wailea. What your $17.50/day resort fee does NOT include: cooler, beach chair, umbrella and boogie board rentals. You can rent coolers from the hotel's gift shop for $5.00/day and beach chairs for $2.50/chair/day. We did not inquire about boogie boards or umbrellas. For $17.50/day, I would think that the resort fee could include borrowing at least coolers and chairs. For the length of our stay on Maui, our resort fees added another $200 to our bill. Disappointing. As far as the room, it was very nice. We had a king-sized bed, a sofa, dresser, closet, room safe, porch, flat-screen TV, small refrigerator, microwave and coffee machine. This allowed us to go to the local Safeway (about 5 minutes away by car) and purchase some food for breakfast and lunch. The bed was very comfortable and, I have to admit, the pillows were the BEST EVER and my husband and I both want to purchase some! We had plenty of space to spread out and unpack for the 6 days we were on Maui. The bathroom was updated and clean upon arrival. We had plenty of soap, shampoo, conditioner, lotion and mouthwash for our stay. A hair dryer was provided. This is the first property I've stayed at where a magnifying mirror is provided! If you have read any of my other reviews, you've noticed that this is a complaint in my recent hotel reviews. I was THRILLED by the amenity. Thank you Maui Coast for getting it right! The towels were fluffy and absorbent, even the ones you borrowed for the pool or beach. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant in an attempt to keep costs down. Drink prices at the pool were what you would expect at a large hotel. My iced tea cost $4 for a small plastic cup but there were free refills (and it was the best iced tea that I had during my Hawaiian vacation). We were walking distance from a very nice beach. Drive time to Old Lahaina was about 40 minutes one way. There are plenty of amenities within walking distance or a short drive of the hotel. Drive time to Haleakala is about 2 hours one way. Would I stay here again? Definitely! Would I recommend this property to friends and family? Absolutely! Will I continue to grumble about the resort fee? Yes because I feel you are not getting your money's worth. Maui Coast Hotel should consider expanding amenities included in that fee to cooler and beach chair rental. I'd suggest dropping the free shuttle only because most vacationers rent a car on Maui but I get the feeling that there are a lot of business travelers that stay at Maui Coast so they probably like the shuttle (but, they are also on expense, so a small fee for the shuttle wouldn't be that big of a deal).

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to start our vacation.”
Reviews.Author: Bc2go
Reviews.Content: Only spent one night but it has been very nice. Clean, quiet and comfortable. Staff has been helpful. The location a lows you to take walks along the beach and parks. I am sure we will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: climbingup
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at the Maui coast in Jan 2012. The hotel was clean and comfortable with a very friendly staff. Location was perfect for both the days of relaxing on the beach and the days spent exploring the island. I would certainly suggest this hotel to anyone looking for a hotel in the middle of it all..if you want a nice quiet beach vacation and nothing more, then I would suggest going further up Kaanapali way. There are lots of restaurants within walking distance (or a short couple minute drive) and the beach is only about a 5 minute walk from the check-in desk. This hotel isn't situated on the beach, but you only have to cross the road and walk a few minutes to find a spot. Activites are plentiful in Maui...I would suggest the drive to Hana to anyone. There are many oneway bridges, but the road is paved and as long as you're careful you shouldn't have any issues. For any divers out there, I would suggest considering diving in the shark tank at the Maui Aquarium. They only accept 4 divers a day, 3 days a week. I was able to book the day before I dove and was the only person that day. You start with a backstage tour for you and your friends/family. We were able to touch full grown jelly fish, see the process of raising the creatures that later make it into the main tanks...then the instructor and I spent 45 minutes in the shark tank with about 20 sharks inclduing hammerheads, reef sharks and a tiger shark. Best of all, we were able to hand feed giant stingrays that acted like stray dogs begging for food. I can't stress enough how amazing an experience this was...and I'm not an experienced diver, just a novice. (You must be certified). There are also many beautiful (private and busy) beaches up and down both coasts. If you like quieter, we found that the northern tip had the largest areas with the fewest people. I will be returning to Maui and will consider staying at the Maui Coast again

Reviews.Title: “Excellet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tugger_12
Reviews.Content: We left a horrible hotel to stay here. What a great decision we made. The staff and accomodations were fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: MX1977
Reviews.Content: We were almost going to the Kaanapali Beach Hotel, and we ended up at the Maui Coast at the last minute as our travel agent considered it was better located, in relation to access to other Maui attractions. We got a one Bedroom Suite, and I have to tell you it was huge. We are a family of four (2 and 6 yo girls). The bed on the main bedroom was super sized, and there was a sofa bed on the living room, where our girls could sleep more than comfortably. The hotel is situated right across Kamaole Beach Park I. This was the first beach we visited in Maui (a couple of minutes walk) and it was really nice. Very calm ocean. The pool area is not huge, but really nice. You have a restaurant (Tradewinds Poolside CafÃ©) by the pool which I very much recommend, and did not find expensive at all. Good selection of food and happy hour for drinks in the afternoon. And most of all super friendly staff. The hotel Staff was friendly enough, but ended up with the impression of the whole hotel as being impersonal. However, I have to say we were very comfortable. Check in was super fast, and when we had to check out, as our flight left for LAX at night, we stored our luggage with the front desk and used the pool for the rest of the day, which was great. Too bad, that there was no place to take a shower and change clothes before heading to the airport, but it was not a big deal. We used the pool restrooms. As nearby attractions and places you have some shops and restaurants, down by S. Kihei Road (including a Denny's), and there's a mall really close in Wailea, but I can't comment as we have not experienced them. Parking was never an issue (at least to find a spot), but spaces are really small. There was complimentary water with the room, which we received half the days of our stay. Regarding noise from the hallways, and the parking lot, we never had a problem. We rested wonderfully, as the bed (besides from being big) was super comfortable. The bathroom was very big too with a modern look. Nice set of amenities. Super clean and maintenance of the premises was excelent. Our room had a microwave oven and a coffee maker (with complimentary coffee provided daily). There was also a mini fridge. With all that, plus a trip to Wal Mart and KMart (from which I recommend the later) we had a breakfast solution. Our room faced the parking lot, so there was no sea view for us, but again, we did not spend much time at the room. Not being a hotel with direct access to the beach, I can't imagine how good an ocean view can be. All in all, a great place to stay. For the price we paid we received a huge room, which I presume was bigger than the one we would have gotten at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel. I would also recommend that area as a nice place to stay in Maui. Mx

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel near the busy section of Kihei”
Reviews.Author: JLFERG
Reviews.Content: The Maui Coast Hotel is an oasis near the busyness of restaurants and shops in Kihei. The rooms are what you'd expect at a high end hotel--comfortable beds with lots of pillows, granite sinks and Gilchrist and Soames bath amenities, free Kona coffee in the rooms, wi-fi access included in the resort fee, plus lots of other perks. The lobby is spacious and open air with plenty of cushiony seating. I was here on business for two nights so I didn't get to spend much time in Kihei or take advantage of the nearby beach. I'd stay here again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: EmilyInCalgary
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 10 day stay at the Maui Coast Hotel. I have to say I have never had such a hard time booking accommodation on any trip as there are so many options in Maui. It was just myself and my boyfriend and I knew we wouldnâ€™t make use of a kitchen in a condo, and the pools in most of the condos in Kihei looked dated, so we decided to book the Maui Coast hotel after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. We booked the Romance Package so had a car rental included and bottle of champagne when we arrived in our Junior Suite. The room was large and spacious- best things about the room were the huge bed, which was really comfortable and lovely plushy pillows and the strong shower. The room was clean and room service was good every day (another thing you do not get in a condo!). We didnâ€™t use the fitness centre, laundry or Spices restaurant (which was always busy). The pool area was lovely, lots of tropical plants and fairly quiet and relaxing (even though it was peak time in Maui) and clean and modern. There is happy hour every day with good prices and I recommend the Blue Hawaiian cocktails! We also made good use of the shuttle that is part of the resort fee charge- very handy to be taken anywhere in the area, although you can walk to plenty of shops and places to eat. All staff were very helpful and friendly, especially the shuttle drivers! The shop in the lobby is also pretty handy, selling everything you might need. The only negative that I can really say about the hotel is that they do not have a shower that you can use after check out (except the outdoor shower by the pool) and our flight was not until late at night- getting changed in the reception toilet was ok but not ideal. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel to couples. Kihei is a fairly busy resort during the day but nothing much going on at night time. We mainly used the beaches nearer Wailea as there are less crowded and larger than those by the hotel. Beautiful sunsets from the beach across from the hotel though. I would also highly recommend the 808 Deli- best sandwiches that I have had in a long time!

Reviews.Title: “"Very pleasant surprise"”
Reviews.Author: ShondaKharpe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Coast in Feb 2012 and found it to be delightful. It is clean, nicely laid out, not too overwhelmingly busy and the staff are lovely. Our room was so comfortable - I still miss the bed! The room was average sized but very clean and modern. The bar fridge and microwave were more than sufficient for our needs. We usually get a condo but decided to try a hotel room instead as we normally end up reheating leftovers or having fruit as opposed to cooking full meals. The pool is perfect sized for a hotel across the street from the beach. Enough cabanas and loungers for those who wanted them. It was full but rarely overcrowded. A perfect place for those who love Maui and are out all day but still need a peaceful, comfortable retreat at the end of the day as opposed to just any old place to rest your head. One minor complaint would be that some people not registered at the hotel were using the pool also. Given that there's a somewhat limited supply and a person is paying an extra $14 per day for resort fees, it would be nice if it were monitored a little bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Coast and our time on the Island of Maui”
Reviews.Author: carmela c
Reviews.Content: This was our first ever trip to Hawaii and we visited the amazing island of Maui. The maui coast hotel is a fairly nice property. The staff were very very friendly (manny at the front desk is very amusing, I especially like how he felt sorry for us when we told him we were from Winnipeg, Canada!! Hahah.. thanks Manny for all your assistance during our stay) The hotel room was clean and take it as you will, this city slicker hates messy messes and dirty places. This hotel room was clean.. we stayed in room 439 and it was really quite nice. The bed is so comfy and the furniture is updated and modern. The only complaint I have is the bathroom is really tiny so be careful. the bathroom ceilings could use updating too. but all in all it was fine.. and besides, when you visit an extraordinary place like Maui, do you really stay in your hotel room the whole time??? I donâ€™t think so!! The beach is across the street which is fine because itâ€™s mauiâ€¦ITS HOT THERE.. so you donâ€™t mind the walk. The pool area is really busy but the staff are very friendly and anytime my husband and I ordered drinks, they delivered it very very quickly. SPICES restaurant- we ate valentines day dinner there and the food was phenomenal. I had the lobster with mashed potatoes and fresh crisp steamed veggies, my husband had the pasta alfredo topped with an abundance of seafood. (weâ€™re Italian, and we know what good pasta tastes like LOL, and rest assured, this was one delectable dish) the cocktails are amazing and the appetizers were very very tasty. The coconut shrimp and the calamari are to die for. Great job and great service at spices. Ask for a seat on the patio, its pretty out there. just beware of the ants on the columns.. not so pretty I must say. But all in all it was good. They have a state of the art weight and workout roomâ€¦ its amazing, take advantage of it early in the morning when nobody is there..good times. The hotel is equipped with a laundry room as well on the 4th floor which is nice and the its free, the only thing is you gotta pay for your laundry soap and itâ€™s 75 cents per load. CHEAP! The laundry room is an added bonus, you donâ€™t know how much sand remains on the bottom of that washing machines once youâ€™re done. Donâ€™t bring any of that home!! Great staff, great service and the location is right on south kihei which is the main strip along the coast in the town of Kihei. Its close to shopping and great restaurants, cafÃ© oâ€™lei being one of them..fantastic! We will definitely stay there again. P.S. rent a car youâ€™ll need itâ€¦ visit this site http://www.discounthawaiicarrental.com/ we rented a compact car for $280.00 for 7 days! Also DRIVE THE ROAD TO HANAâ€¦it was the best thing we did. Itâ€™s a day adventure and it is well worth it. pick up the CD at the shell gas stationâ€¦itâ€™s 20 bucks. You can pay the excursion bus to take you on the Hana tour, but itâ€™s like $250.00 per person. If you drive the highway yourself, you are bound to drive right behind one or more of the excursion tour buses, so just stop on the highway were they stop! Its not rocket science. Also, donâ€™t waste your time with the submarine excursion, if you go to the maui ocean center youâ€™ll see WAY more.. and it will only cost ya 45 bucks a person there, the sub will run you about 170 per person. Also, take a trek to big beach past the town of Wailea, its so awesome there but be carefull as the waves are strong and the tide comes in quickly. you must also do a luau! Theyâ€™re fun and they feed you and you can drink all you want all night. we also enjoyed a sunset dinner cruise whic was nice, and we also did a whale watch.. that was boring cause we saw nothing. also enjoy the road side farmers markets too, fresh pineapple and coconuts...so delish. if you drive the road to hana, you can purchase an abondance of fresh fruit for literally pennies. enjoy your trip. We certainly did!!

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel, good location, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn H
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Maui Coast. As long as you're not expecting the Ritz-Carlton, you will be happy. Nice, spacious and clean rooms (we stayed in a suite, which was perfect for kids who wanted to nap). Staff was the friendliest we've encountered almost anywhere, including stays at larger resorts and luxury hotels. The location was perfect - right across from the beach and within walking distance of numerous restaurants. The only downside was the parking lot view, but I'm sure we could have paid a little more for the other view. Our friends were staying at a small hotel in Wailea and our hotel was definitely better and more convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but double beds!”
Reviews.Author: NonRIUTraveller
Reviews.Content: we booked a room with a king bed 7 months before our arrival date. We arrived at the hotel too early so left our stuff at the hotel and went out to see the sites. We arrived back at the hotel around 10pm only to find that king beds were no longer available. We ended up with 2 double beds. Disappointing that we booked 7 months in advance, arrived at the hotel early and didn't get what we booked. The hotel was clean and the rooms were nice and after all, it's Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Property in Kihei”
Reviews.Author: dvlvnv
Reviews.Content: We booked this property in Kihei because of the TripAdvisor reviews, and we were not disappointed. Granted, it is not the Fairmont, but the rooms we had were clean and updated. We booked both the regular room and a junior suite for our family. The regular room was adequate, although the bathroom was small and the tub had no grab bar. The suite had more floor space, a wet bar and a larger bathroom. The staff was very polite and cheerful. The pool was on the small side, but in good condition. We enjoyed it because most people went to the beach across the street. I appreciated the computers that were available at no extra charge so I could check emails. We did have a rental car, but there were plenty of dining options within walking distance. We did use the bicycles that were included with the resort fee, and that was fun. Parking and a daily newspaper were also included.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Good Location in South Maui”
Reviews.Author: WanderingYank
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Maui Coast. They added the $17.50 Resort Fee since our last visit. I guess this is progress?!? Nice hotel in a good South Maui location. Nice updated rooms. Get one on the south (non-parking lot) side........it's quieter. Small but well-lit bathrooms. The only downside to our visit was spotty housekeeping. Not everything done that should have sometimes. Friendly front-desk staff. A good choice in South Maui.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Ending to our Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Susan&David
Reviews.Content: This was our last island of a 4 island-hopping trip and it was wonderful. Each island is different and Maui was a combination of many of the island features. The Maui Coast Hotel was exceptionally clean, convenient and well located. Our room had plenty of room and a very comfortable bed. It was interesting that our room and our friends' were similar but not identical. Our bathroom was quite small and we had a couch, and they had a bigger bathroom and no couch. We were both on the second floor that is really the ground level. Our room was ideal for cards or eating in. Our patio had 2 chairs and a little table so we could sit outside or bring the chairs in and use around the table so we could seat 4. Our room was quiet and the little frig and micro were useful. Like everyone has said, the laundry was free and we never had any difficulty finding it available. The lobby was spacious and well appointed with a nice gift shop and friendly and helpful staff. I love the open lobbies that we found on our trip. The location was convenient and we spent a couple of fun mornings at the beach across the road. Towels were provided and the second day I asked for two towels-one to sit on and one to dry with and was quickly given them. Very accommodating. I do wish that they had beach chairs to borrow too, but that's just a wish! The pool and hot tub were nice and the landscaping beautiful. We had dinner one night at the hotel restaurant and enjoyed Guido and our meal. I think they had a good and reasonably priced breakfast available each morning too, but we ate in our room, enjoying the coffee that was provided. If we return to Maui, we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Karen M
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Maui Coast Hotel. The hotel is set back from the main road and is quiet and private. The grounds and pool areas are beautifully landscaped. The rooms are clean and well appointed with in suite coffee maker, microwave and fridge. There is free laundry and wifi. We upgraded to a junior suite and really appreciated the extra space. The staff were all very friendly and accommodating. An excellent sandy beach is a short walk from the hotel. The hotel offers freshly laundered towels for use on the beach. There are many restaurants and shops within walking distance or you can use the bicycles available for guests. We were most pleased with our choice of hotel and would wholeheartedly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TS T
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. I've stayed at the Maui Coast Hotel twice now and will gladly return. Beautiful hotel and lovely staff. You have enough good restaurants nearby and fun shops. Be sure to take advantage of the amenities (tennis courts, bicycles, pool, laundry). It's a quick walk to the beach; and a pretty, clean beach with soft sand is a plus. The only downside to the South Shore is strong winds, which could stir up your allergies - fast. Be sure to bring allergy nose spray to help.

Reviews.Title: “A most excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: BayWarrior
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a most wonderful experience. I booked 2 rooms (one for myself and wife and the other for my sister) and both rooms were ready upon arrival. Both rooms were adjacent as requested. We were greeted by a friendly staff at the front desk, and whenever you walked by the desk, whether it be in the wee hours of the morning or late at night the staff was always friendly and cheerful. Our rooms on the 4th floor were clean, had a small balcony and the wireless signal was very strong. The hotel was set back about a half block from the road so there are really no ocean front rooms, but that did not diminish our stay there of 5 nights. We ate dinner at their restaurant the first night and the food was really good and the specials were priced reasonably. Not too far either up or down the road we were able to find other restaurants and stores. The hotel is about a block from an ocean beach which was very peaceful and serene. The hotel provides towels 24 hours a day. The pool on site was clean and you could spend your time either in the sun or shade around the pool. The hot tube is only a few steps from the pool but is isolated from the pool and you can also spend time in the shade or sun as you wish. Your drink or food needs are tended by personnel that walk the area quite frequently to take care of the guests. As part of the resort fee, we were able to do our wash and dry it for no charge (except for the detergent which was 75 cents). This was great for us as our vacation had us on the road for 17 days, so we only had to pack 8 days worth of clothes which saved us $$$ on airline baggage fees (we had 5 separate flights) and hauling an extra suitcase. Should I ever return to Maui, this is where I will be staying!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Maui Experience”
Reviews.Author: Pair-of-Pelicans
Reviews.Content: Great first experience in Maui! We went to attend a wedding that took place on Charley Young Beach across the street and a block down from this hotel. All of the staff at the front desk were awesome and genuine! I would like to make special mention of Rudy, Front Desk Supervisor. I called to the front desk asking if they had a couple of plastic spoons only to have Rudy not only send spoons but forks, knives, bowls and plates! Talk about going above and beyond! Tiffany at the Concierge desk was also friendly and helpful. Our hotel room was on the second floor room 239 and it was awesome! The bed, sheets and pillows were so awesome that we inquired their make and model to which Kathi gave us said information. The room came equipped with bar fridge, microwave and coffee maker. I would recommend picking up groceries at Costco, Walmart and/or Kmart all located just minutes from Kahului Airport. The liquor is inexpensive at Costco and Walmart. We ate breakfast at Spices Restaurant which cost the two of us $35. It was a very nice stay as you could not hear any noise from the other patrons in this hotel. The side that our hotel room was on received the sun on our lanai which was also beautiful even if it didn't have an ocean view as the tree and surrounding greenery was amazing. Pool loungers were always available. Can hardly wait to head ack to Maui!

Reviews.Title: “First Rate”
Reviews.Author: BillySchlupp
Reviews.Content: The Maui Coast Hotel is a fantastic property. It is not an "over the top impersonable over-priced mega resort". I was, and continue to be treated as a very valued customer. Rooms are great. Beds are the most comfortable You will ever sleep in. Location is perfect! You are NOT stuck way down in Wailea or Makena, (and subject to being gouged price wise on food, drinks, activities etc). If You want a warm, quaint,, comfortable, affordable, and relaxing experience, I highly recommend that You call the Maui Coast Hotel first. You can thank Me later.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: AlyssaAriana
Reviews.Content: The atmosphere on this side of the island was very calm and inviting! The hotel was great and very close to restaurants and bars!

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean room with strange layout”
Reviews.Author: worddict
Reviews.Content: Why would a microwave be in the closet where clothes are supposed to be hung? Well, that's the the way it is here. In all, a clean room, with a small desk. Hate the resort fee that supposedly gives you bus rides, newspapers, internet access, parking etc. How about just including that and dropping the resort fee? I'd rank this average with the stupid resort fee. But then everything in Maui is expensive, so I'll still give it a good.

Reviews.Title: “Kihei convenience for over 12 times”
Reviews.Author: goldenboy
Reviews.Content: It was nice tor hear "welcome back" from Rudy desk supervisor although this was the first time we havn't received a room update. They Now have king beds, since their update, rather than the 2 queens that we prefer which are very firm with lots of pillows which are uncomfortably hard. There is entertainment by the pool from 6 to 8: none of which is resembling Hawaiian which we missed. They are getting very cheap, no paper or pan by the phone. A gingerale at the bar was $3.50 with a lot of ice and not much drink for my tummy. The bar food is extremely skimpy and over prices for what is on the plate. The hot tubs are very nice for those with arthritis or miss being in hot water at home.

Reviews.Title: “Very Hospitable”
Reviews.Author: relrel
Reviews.Content: Used tripadvisor reviews when we booked and weren't disappointed. Very friendly staff, nice rooms, pool was a nice private layout. Short walk to nice large beach, would definitely stay here again if we go back. Lots of eateries within ten minute walk. Parking spaces are very tight but that seems the same on the whole Island.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Cohen94
Reviews.Content: I'm glad we followed the recommendation of a friend. The Maui Coast was a great deal. From top to bottom, they met all of my expectations. The restaraunt was great for late night dining and the pool was a nice reteat from the ocean that is right across the street. I received a nice upgrade when we checked in. Good people, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: jsettemeyer
Reviews.Content: it was great! The price is a little high for my taste but you certainly get a lot. You do have to pay a daily resort fee but I didn't talk to a single person in Maui that didn't have to pay one their hotel, and it was usually more. Great location, helpful staff, great rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Get rid of the resort fee”
Reviews.Author: bcgraph
Reviews.Content: The only reason we stayed at the Maui Coast hotel was because there was a free night promotion. In fact, I would have stayed away from the hotel because of the resort fee. There's nothing more irritating than flying to Hawaii, having to pay for a 25$ fee to check your luggage at the counter, a fee for a pillow, a fee for a blanket, having to pay for your meal, then arriving at your hotel and having to pay for a resort fee. It didn't start too well when we arrived late. The room we were given was awful. It was right by the entrance (with obviously lots of people going in and out, close to the elevators and the pop machines and there must have been more than a dozen condos that could see what was going on in our room. So we asked to change and had another room. It was better, but frankly, you're not going to have any kind of view at the Maui Coast hotel: The hotel is perpendicular to the road away from the ocean. The most irritating thing we went through was the room cleaning. It's not acceptable to come back at 3:30pm and realize that the room hasn't been done. We told the cleaning lady not to bother the first time but the second time, we had to go and wait in the lobby until it was done. Not cool when you are paying a resort fee. I believe you can ask them to make the room earlier but you have to ask them every day. The last major problem was with the safe. The safe is unusable. It's in the closet and getting it open will definitely make your blood pressure rise. But the unacceptable thing about it is that it's ridiculously small. I travel a lot and I'm always able to place most of my camera gear in the safe. Not in this one. In fact, my digital camera could not fit in it. On the positive side, the hotel is very well maintained with very nice rooms with great quality furniture and the staff is really, really friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: BC_Snowflake
Reviews.Content: As soon as we opened the door to our room, we immediately felt relaxed. Very comfortable bed, larger then usual towels in the bathroom, and I liked the "in shower" shampoo, etc. My husband liked having a couch to watch tv on (when he watched it). Free bottled water was appreciated daily in our fridge. Air conditioner was not noisy. Pool area is lovely, and with two hot tubs, there was always space. Towels for pool area are huge. The staff is excellent and treats everyone like an honored guest. Close to the beach and some excellent restaurants and shopping. Parking can be a bit tight when parking lot is full, but do-able. Music every night at the pool side. Great cleaning staff as well. Take advantage of all the resort fee offers. We weren't able to. Wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: roperoo
Reviews.Content: I married my good lady wife on the 4th June 2011 - it was a great day!! And a couple of days later we boarded a plane at Heathrow and took to the skies, 11 hours later we touched down in Los Angeles - we waved at Arnie and immidiately boarded another plane headed for Maui... Rewind 6 months to the planning of our honeymoon... We knew we wanted to go to Hawaii and we knew we wanted to go to Maui and have a relaxing, dream honeymoon. We spent hours on Trip Advisor trying to find the perfect hotel and boy were we happy with our decision. Our 12 nights in a junior suite (booked through Travel Republic) were an absolute bargain. All of the staff were great, helpful and friendly. There was a free shuttle service that took you anywhere in a 3 mile radius. We were not charged any extra local fees. Our suite was excellent, nothing to complain about at all. We were given extra time in our room on the day of check out at no extra charge. I cannot praise this hotel enough. One day we will be back! 10/10.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: reesie0726
Reviews.Content: I was at a conference at the Grand Wailea but it was booked. This hotel ws convenient to Wailea. Across the street from the beach. Staff very friendly. Nice pool and hot tub. Free wifi and parking with the resort fee. For the price, excellent value. Helpful concierge to plan your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay at the Maui Coast”
Reviews.Author: nogus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Maui Coast Hotel on the first night of our honeymoon. We wanted a familiar place for our first night back on Maui, the rest of our stay was at the Four Season Wailea so we were really excited for that. We were greeted with a friendly aloha and a big smile from the gentleman that checked us in(unfortunately I cannot remember his name). He immediately wished us a happy honeymoon and congratulations on our wedding. He then informed us that he was able to upgrade us to a 1 bedroom suite for our nights stay. When we got to the room it was clean and rather large. There were 2 Lanais and we could see the ocean from our 6th floor room. I really liked the bed, and the bathroom was pretty large also. I went to the pool bar to meet my brother and have a few drinks. The drinks were good and the bartender was awesome, our tab for the drinks was not too expensive at all. Later I met up with my wife again and we had dinner at spices(that is there restaurant). The service was not the best and the food was okay but not the best and that is why I did not give the excellent rating on this review. I also did not have time to check check out the fitness center but the pool was really nice. One more comment on the wifi service.... Since we were on the top floor the only time i could get wifi in our room was when i was crouched in the corner of our bedroom which kind of sucked but the wifi was free!!! Maybe in the future they can put another antenna on the roof or something? I plan on staying at the Maui Coast again in the future with my wife. We had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ftwlonghorn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our second trip to Maui in as many years. We went to Maui on our honeymoon and absolutely fell in love with the island. We stayed at the Honua Kai on our first trip and while it was a great place to stay, we found that we were out exploring the island more than we were at the resort. On this trip we were simply looking for a nice, clean hotel to spend our nights. The Maui Coast fit the bill perfectly. It was simple, clean, comfortable and affordable. We also really enjoyed the hotel's location. Kihei is great and not as touristy as other parts of the island. It is very close to Wailea and some of the best snorkeling and beaches on the island. If you are like us and don't like spending your vacation lounging by the pool, but exploring all the amazing sights, then this hotel should work just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great time for much less!”
Reviews.Author: Switzguyz
Reviews.Content: The Coast is a fantastic hotel in a beautiful climate. It is very near the 'deluxe', more resorty area of Maui. It was too much fun to (for a few days) hop on the free bikes, throw in our flippers into the front baskets, and bike over to Wailea. We'd hang all day at the $1000/night hotels, only having to spend money on a really expensive lunch and Mai Tai. This made our $200/night with the 5th night free in a super clean - and 'off the ugly strip' part of Kihea seem like a steal! Very comfortable beds (we are uber picky), and my only complaint was the loud air conditioner. We overcame that (and maintained the 5 star for Maui Coast) by freezing the room during the day when we were gone - and then just opening the sliding door at night and turning off the air con. Nights were cool enough to be comfortable with the overhead fan on.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Karin B
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at the end of December at the Maui Coast Hotel and loved our stay. The location was great for seeing all of Maui. The concierge was extremely helpful and guided us to wonderful activities. The only drawback was the pillows. But they weren't any worse than any other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great trip”
Reviews.Author: Dude_az
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year on spring break- Im a teacher. We loved the hotel, location, staff and the room. We were afraid it would to far off the trail of things to do- not the case at all!

Reviews.Title: “Best value for the money”
Reviews.Author: DVEB
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel for the money we spent. We went for 3 nights from Dec. 30 to Jan.2). Courteous service. Clean rooms. Free bikes to roam around. Easy, close access to several beaches. Conveniently located close to Foodland (grocery store) and to several good restaurants (special mention for Cafe O'Lei). Free Internet access with blazing speed (not like the turtle dial-up speed that we had few days later in Grand Wailea resort).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, location and staff”
Reviews.Author: travelmichele
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on price and location and were not disappointed. We arrived early in the morning on January 1st (around 9:00ish) and asked if we could store our luggage until check in. The front desk (Edwin) gladly accommodating our request and said he would do his best to check us in early. We were offered to sit by the pool until our room was ready ... within an hour our room was ready. The room was very spacious and immaculate. We had two queen size beds - they were the most comfortable beds we've slept in! Every time we walked by the front desk we were greeted and acknowledged by the front desk - they were so accommodating and made us feel welcomed to the hotel and Kihei. What I really noticed about this hotel was that everything was kept so clean and tidy. All the staff seemed very happy to be working at the hotel. This hotel was close to everything ... especially the surfing. We were able to walk to our favourite restaurants and coffee spot. The hotel even offered a washer and dryer ... at no cost. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and I will come back on my next visit to Maui. This hotel was a refreshing change to a condo. Thanks Maui Coast Hotel for a great stay and vacation experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff - Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Sandra35091
Reviews.Content: We chose the Maui Coast Hotel because of the positive reviews it had. We were not disappointed. The room was excellent, although the bathroom was tiny -- the only drawback to the hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room had a microwave and refrigerator, which were very handy. The location could not be better -- right by the beach and a short drive from a lot of attractions on the coast. The free laundry was SO nice! It is a great hotel for singles, couples or families. The restaurant in front of the hotel was not good and is not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Paul00001
Reviews.Content: I liked that they had bikes vailable to the guests

Reviews.Title: “Good price and location”
Reviews.Author: p27159
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel we stayed in on our honeymoon, so there's a bit of sentiment as a result. This was a great hotel to use as a base to explore most of Maui, although we chose to check out right before we took the drive to Hana so we could stay up there and not have to make the round trip in one day (which is very do-able if you're so inclined though). The hotel was clean and in excellent condition. We had a partial ocean view room with a great view of the sunrise, and it was just a 2-block walk to get to the beach. We stayed here quite a few years ago (ignore ther Feb 2011 date the site made me put here), but judging by the recent reviews, the property hasn't changed much, and I wanted to add to the reviews already here. At the time we stayed here, I did an extensive search of properties in the general area, and found this one to be the best value, and I haven't seen anything to refute that. There's ample convenient parking on the property as well. I would highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort in Kihei”
Reviews.Author: roxygrl80
Reviews.Content: Great resort facilities - gym was well equipped, nice (but slightly small) pool with a bar next door which does decent food and drinks, nice tennis courts. Location is right in the middle of Kihei, very easy access to the beach. We'd walk to the beach each day for a run / swim and also hired paddle boards from a shop in the ABC shopping centre directly across the beach (much cheaper and way less crowded than the snorkel bobs and boss frogs for the same quality gear). Hotel rooms and bathrooms were excellent, generously sized, very clean, and equipped with free wifi. I only have one small complaint about the room which is the very noisy air conditioning unit! We also drove to Lahaina (40 mins) a couple of times to hit the bars as it has much better nightlife than Kihei. But overall, we loved our location in Kihei as it was great for all the day time activities and a good base for the drives to Hana and Haleakala, and we were very happy with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff, not worth $$”
Reviews.Author: hitravbug11
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights at Maui Cost on recommendation from a local, in fact, someone who lives up the street in Kihei. I soon discovered why... this hotel is not at all worth the price tag, but it is frequented by townies and locals. Upon checking in, the staff was so rude, for some reason the girl, Mariflor, just didn't like the look of me, and put me on the ground floor next to the extremely busy and noisy housekeeping linen/laundry room. Luckily, the housekeeping staff instructed me who to speak to to get a new room assignment. The rude staff member giggled when I returned minutes later, had a good laugh when I asked for her manager, but another front desk person helped me and put me in a nicer room. I also spent time by the pool. The pool staff are incredibly lazy and rude, it's more a scene for locals who come there and drink all day and night. In fact, the hotel pool bar is like a "scene" for the locals. OK, that's fine, but as the ones paying to stay there, it certainly didn't seem like a welcome place for the guests. Moreover, I watched as a bartender and waiter - who I could describe in finite detail - made a guest a drink she did not order with junk she didn't order from the bar -- I was standing right there waiting for my drink -- and were dying laughing about it. The waiter walked up to the guest and asked her if she liked it, apparently she said yes, and boy, did they think this was hilarious! Har har, right? Nice people. Not worth the money, there are many hotels throughout this part of Maui, throw a dart, pick any other one and you'll have a more enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel In An Excellent Location!!”
Reviews.Author: excelden
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying this offers some excellent value for the price. Every employee that works at this hotel are always at your service and so down to earth. During our eleven day stay, we did not run into one unhappy employee. Pool is on the small side, but is well kept with two hot tubs. Drinks poolside, are very reasonable and they are very generous when it comes to the mixed drinks. Happy hour or hours I should say (3-6pm) everyday a select number of drinks are only $4.00. The staff throughout the entire hotel really get to know you well. I would argue, you receive way better personal service than you do in ones of those 5 star resorts hands down! Free shuttle to local places, bikes to use anytime across the street from the beach and everything else you need within a short walk. I want to extend a special thanks to Rudy at the front desk, he went out of his way every time to accommodate my family during our stay. The pool bar staff was also amazing ... Thanks for the exceptional service Molly and David you both made our pool days amazing . There is no need to look any further, super clean well maintained recently renovated, with clean rooms and comfortable beds. The hotel was sold out during most of our stay and this was a very quiet hotel!

Reviews.Title: “All the amenities without the price tag”
Reviews.Author: twkozik
Reviews.Content: We spent a few nights here and were pleasantly surprised when we realized that this was not your run of the mill hotel. Beautiful lobby area, didn't eat in the restaurant, but it was nice to know it was available, the room was clean, pillows were perfect - often in hotels they're much too soft for my taste - and they, along with the bed, were simply heavenly and I slept awesome. Also, what was totally awesome and appreciated about the room was that they have a ceiling fan right over the bed so you can opt for that to give you air/cooling instead of air conditioning. It was refreshing and nice to not have the staleness of air conditioning blowing. Rooms were quiet. The staff was helpful and offered tips for our trip on the Road to Hana, which was also greatly appreciated since if you don't travel it at the right time (like in the dark) it can be quite harrowing, but it was incredible! (Highly recommend the trip, leave in the morning, you'll be back in the afternoon. Sights are incredible and the road itself is FUN - cliff side drives on the water, waterfalls...) The resort is conveniently located, so even though Kihei isn't a walking town (it's pretty big for an island town), you're in a walkable area. There is a public beach across the street, and the resort is located on the strip where there are lots of places to eat. We luckily ran across Cinnamon Roll Fair just a block or two down the road, Maui Tacos (which we thought were a mom and pop joint and sadly found out is a local chain, but still good), Maui Gelato, and lots of other places down in that area that we didn't try but looked good. The resort offers bicycles for guest use so if you don't rent a car, you can easily tootle around the area on bikes, which is great (no extra fee). It's also a very short drive (10 - 15 minutes) to Wailea, which is a gorgeous town with resorts like the 4 Seasons and the Grand Wailea and that's where you can find the nice beaches and coastal walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great property for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Keith B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice, clean, and it is in a great location in South Maui. My wife and I agree that this was the most comfy hotel bed ever. The only bad thing we have to say is that the bathroom could be bigger. It's just minutes from all the restaurants and shops in Kihei and across the street from a nice beach. The South Maui beaches were all very nice with calm surf (big beach was our fav). If you're coming to surf stay in West Maui (Lahaina).

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: hhinman
Reviews.Content: Staff was fabulous, room was very comfortable, location is good... Would definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Oli0612
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here one-night. Location: a few minutes walk to beach and local mall Rooms: big, clean Internet: free (included in resort fee $10) Parking: free (included in resort fee), lots of spaces Pool: very small We got upgraded to a junior suite. The room was very open, doesn't feel cramped at all. We had trouble figuring out the shower and ended up calling the technician to come up because we thought it was broken. Apparently nothing was wrong, it was just a tricky shower. This was one of the cheap but still modern hotels in Maui. If you are looking for a resort kind of hotel, then this is not for you. But if you plan on hanging out all day and then just coming back to a good place for the night and to sleep, then Maui Coast Hotel is definitely a choice.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with my choice of M.C.”
Reviews.Author: hod01
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week here with my wife and overall I was impressed. Initial impressions were good. The lobby area, rooms and building in general all feel pretty modern. The rooms are nice with a king bed, small couch, desk and drawers, large flat panel TV (with 'Lodgenet' PPV). I particularly liked having a fridge (and there's a microwave). Size wise the bathroom was very small, and for some odd reason we could hear the bathroom upstairs being.....'used' (but no noise from the adjacent rooms). Facilities wise the hotel has free laundry facilities (1 washer + dryer on alternate floors), free rental bikes (rusty chain's and only during daylight hours), free local shuttle, free beach towels, free wi-fi, 3 internet terminals, "free" parking, and "free" bottles of water every-day. There's also a work-out room, but I didn't use it (don't judge me - I ran/swam outside!!) I use "free" because you have to pay an $18/day facilities charge. There's a pretty nice pool area with 2 hot-tubs and a childrens pool. Personally I was a wee bit disappointed as the pool wasn't big enough to do laps in, but there was plenty of space for when we were there - which was low season. Not quite so sure in high season. There was a poolside bar with snacks, but we used it once and weren't impressed. We never used their "Spices" restaurant as we'd read poor reviews - the pool-bar food came from the same place. We thought the locations was great. It's on the southern-edge of Kihei. It is literally across the street from the excellent Kamaole I beach park. There was pretty much enough restaurants and bars within a 10 minute walk on Kihei Road, and Wilea and the rest of Kihei Road was a short drive away. Don't go if you're looking for an "on-the-beach" or a 4 or 5 star resort hotel. It's a pretty solid, good location, 3.5 star hotel (some of the airlines put up their flight crews here).

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: DebDizon
Reviews.Content: I will defintely stay at this hotel again. The rooms were clean, quite, the staff was friendly and the hotel was right across the street from the beach. We used the bikes almost everyday which was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Very covenient”
Reviews.Author: sindhuja_raman
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during Oct 2011, and this is a very ideal hotel located strategically to all places of interest in Maui. It is at a fair distance from the airport, and Haleakala National Park and even the road to Hana.. Most south beaches are at walking or driving distance (Wailea) from this place... It is one of the few not-too-expensive hotels in the island that actually has a microwave and that helps when you stay in Maui on a long vacation.. The only issue we had was that there were so few rooms facing the ocean and were given a room right at the back. But we booked quite late, so we really couldn't expect to be given an ocean facing room.. We did however enjoy our quiet stay there.. The cleaning staff is extremely friendly and go beyond their way to help you.. But the same cannot be said about the front desk staff, who was barely courteous and very curt in his replies to our queries..

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and area”
Reviews.Author: 98xjclassic
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Maui Coast for 5 nights last week. We were both really happy with our stay, most importantly to me was the location, right across the street from a great beach. The fact that there was wireless internet throughout the hotel and even pool area was great! We took advantage of the free bikes and tennis courts, they had loaner rackets and balls, great because we didnt bring our own. There is an ABC store a block away and lots of restaurants within walking distance too. Room, bed, tv were all excellent!! Would definitely stay there again!! Staff were great, seemed really laid back, didnt even mind us bringing our own drinks in plastic cups to the hottub at night either!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: FENTON64
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean. Bed was very comfortable with great sheets. Our room was on the 1st floor; balcony was rather small and on ground level so we did not use it. Staff was friendly. The hotel offered free internet and PCs that were for guest use, but you had to stand to use them. Pool was on the small size with a limited number of chairs, but they did have a bar at the pool area. Many restaurants within walking distance; the resort also had bikes for use but we didn't take advantage of them. The beach was a block down and then across the street. No chairs or umbrellas available at the beach. The hotel is located on a busy street but it sets back from the street and the pool area is enclosed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very fair price, hardly any cons!”
Reviews.Author: dustin h
Reviews.Content: For what you pay this place is great, VERY comfortable beds, great service, friendly staff. This location is also great every morning we crossed the street and snorkeled with loads of fish, turtles, octopus and the odd sting ray. Everything about this place we enjoyed even the tacky Hawaii feel in the very clean and comfortable rooms. Unlimited towels to use for the day etc. etc. etc. Cons...not many, they are a little lax on who uses the pool area and it is sometimes occupied by a few locals. The only real con was that the restaurant in the hotel was quite poor, avoid at all costs, but that's simple enough when you can walk good restaurants within a few blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in Kihea”
Reviews.Author: AFish1
Reviews.Content: This hotel has gone through a renovation recently, and the rooms are gorgeous. The staff has plenty of tenure here, making them great sources of information about the area. The poolside bar has a fun happy hour and the location of the hotel is excellent - close to restaurants, shopping, and right across the street from the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for Maui”
Reviews.Author: Quilmess76
Reviews.Content: South Kihei is an excellent location to discover Maui - mellow beach town with good infrastructure, close to the fancier resort of Wailea, and just 15 min away from the airport of Kahului. The hotel being recently renovated offered free internet, free parking, a nice pool and good large rooms. We even received an update at checkin, always appreciated. The 1br suite could have offered a larger bathroom but that is complaining on a high level. We enjoyed the stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Pay_It_Forward
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying here for a week in mid August 2011. There is nothing we could complaint about this hotel. The location is fantastic, close to the beach, local restaurants and shopping. The restaurant at the hotel is also good. Breakfast is a good value here. We booked a junior suite and there is only one minor issue. The view from our balcony is not the best (facing the parking lot), but during the daytime we were enjoying the Maui scenery anyway. The room has all the amenities we need. Just FYI, the shampoo and conditioner are stored in separate large bottles that are attached on the wall above the tub. There is also a small pool at the hotel, and it is a nice place to relax and suntan. If you are thinking about visiting Maui, I highly recommend renting a car. Kihei is a great place to enjoy a vacation, but you can see so much more if you have a vehicle. There are so many beautiful beaches all around the island and we could not have seen most of them without a car.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Spots to Stay in Kihei... Bar None!”
Reviews.Author: Rabalicious
Reviews.Content: The title says it all. We stayed here over the Thanksgiving holiday weekend, and this had to be one of the better hotels in Kihei. If you're budget conscience but don't want to stay in a dump... stay here. There is a $17.50/day resort fee that will be added to your bill (you've been warned) but it's still the best deal in Kihei. While we were there, I saw at least 3 buses of flight crews staying here. So if this place is good for the captains and their crews, it's good enough for you! The beach is right across the street. Access to the main highway is right around the corner. The pool was decent. They had live entertainment at the pool in the evenings we stayed. Parking was free. The WIFI worked for me just fine (and we were 5 flights up and halfway to the back of the hotel). And to top it off... it looked better than most of the dumpy condos that I saw on hotels.com in Kihei (yes, we drove past them to compare). Only downside I can think of has more to do with Kihei than the hotel. Kihei is more of a quiet sleepy town compared to Lahaina or some of the ritzier areas like Makeena. While it was PERFECT for me and my family, if you're a couple or a group of friends, this might be too LOW-KEY for your vacationing pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Good value.”
Reviews.Author: winterweasel
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is fairly nondescript.....but when you're in Maui......you're not going to spend time in your hotel! It's quiet and back from the road. The rooms are clean, comfortable and a decent size. The beds are awesome. Nice pool and bar area. The staff are very friendly and accommodating. There are beaches practically across the street......and restaurants and cafe's within walking distance. (Forget Kihei Caffe though......gross.) The breakfast at Spices on the property is good and the staff are efficient and friendly. I had room service also from Spices. The food was totally acceptable and arrived in a timely manner.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: ECHACHA
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very nice and the staff was very helpful except for the waiter at the pool bar he was horrible ! He dosent know anything about customer service! My husband and I went down to the pool to hear some of the live music and have a few drinks , needless to say we had to ask him to take our order because he was too busy talking about his property in another counrty and how he is getting ready to move there BIG THUMBS DOWN TO YOU !! (you know who you are!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay,”
Reviews.Author: Chulolaw
Reviews.Content: I liked the property, it was pleasant. The location is decent, middle of the island, easily accessible to airport (20 mins away) Lahaina is 20 mins away, and the nicer hotels are about 10 mins away. I think I would stay there next time- Although I would not return to Maui. Maui-beautiful, but too dead for me, I prefer Honolulu and the nightlife in Oahu. There are some bars at the triangle in Kihei- they were always empty regardless of what time I went, although it was Wed/Thursday. This hotel-across street from very nice beach. Restaurant-did not go. There are eateries in Kihei, but remember people wake up early and go to sleep early in Maui, so make sure you plan accordingly. There is a resort fee at this hotel 17.50/day for the use of their facilities. I think that is rediculous as their amenities should be free with the room and I know I did not use them. They do provide free laundry and free internet. Internet I think is an expected free amenity and whoever charges these days for it are just ripping you off (i.e. 4-5 star hotels-? is why we accept that nonsense when the lower starred hotels give you more amenities). Laundry-I did not need it but love the idea of having that if necessary, makes you pack less. Free parking, no free breakfast and the pool seemed nice-although im in Hawaii, I want beach not swimming pool. They give you free towels at the hotel. If I would go back to Maui, there are upscale hotels down the road forgot the city's name, but would probably go there. If you are going to spend all the money to go to Maui, might as well stay at the Hilton, Four Season or Wyndam.

Reviews.Title: “Location, room size, location and location... great hotel”
Reviews.Author: btandrmb
Reviews.Content: Spent 6N here and was very impressed with this hotel. The room was large, had a mini kitchen and a pleasant view of the sea. Large bathroom and decent sized balcony (lanai). We managed to obtain a great rate for a junior suite. Head out to the road and turn right, walk for 10 mins and you have food, shops, beach everything you need. OR. Turn left and walk for 8 minutes and you have food, shops beach, more of everything you need. This truely is a great hotel at a great location. Staff were friendly, rooms large and clean, comfy bed and to top it off, the room(s) have ceiling fans. Turn off the A/C, open the door and turn on the fan....perfect no more dry mouth in the morning.... :) Food tips, turn left and head to Cafe' 808 for cracking sandwitches and food. At dolphin plaza there is a Taco joint tucked out of view which had excellent tacos starting at $2 each as well as other mexican foods. Turn right and head down to Kiehi Cafe for brekky. Don't worry about the lines, they will find you a table to eat your ample sized breakfast. The bearded server inside is a madman, how he keeps up the pace all day is beyond me, but this place is worth a look. Back to the hotel - The only downer was when we were due to check out and asked for an extra hour so we could sit by the pool and head back to the room for a shower before we left. They asked for $20 for it. Not a lot of money but just left a little sour feeling. It's all about the extra little things the staff do that really top off a great stay and this was something that would have been nice. Our plane didn't depart until 3:45pm and we ended up spending the majority of that time sitting in the airport. Overall this was an excellent hotel and worth a look if staying in this area in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Super Value and Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: agcpa
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Maui Coast during Thanksgiving week for a wedding that was taking place at one of the Wailea resorts. Our rooms were very comfortable, the staff was very friendly, and the location in Kihei was great. We were able to walk to the beach (across the street) many restaurants, shops, and a supermarket were very close by. The one bedroom suite that we had was spacious, had a refrigerator, microwave, and coffee maker, and the two bottles of water provided without charge each day was a very nice touch. There were even enough outlets for plugging in laptop, phone chargers, etc. We would definitely stay there again on another trip to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “A Really Nice Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: amydd
Reviews.Content: I'll start off by saying that all of the recent reviews on this hotel are spot-on and reflect our experience as well. We stayed for 6 nights over the Thanksgiving holiday. The hotel felt full but not crowded and as noted by others, the staff was friendly and helpful. We enjoyed poolside lunches and drinks (which were quite good and reasonably priced) but didn't eat at the main restaurant. The live music each night was a nice treat. We booked a one bedroom suite which was perfect for our family (2 adults and 2 teenagers). When we first checked in we were assigned room 202 - I highly recommend avoiding this room! It was a one-bedroom suite, but small, loud, and situated so that the lanai was right above the elevator machine room, and rather than railing had a cement wall around it. Depressing! We asked for another room that evening and they said to check back in the morning. They called us before we even asked and were able to book us into room 533 which was perfect. The bathroom was twice the size and there was plenty of room for a rollaway bed. The suite also had a roomy fridge, microwave, and 2 bottles of water along with coffee were delivered to the room daily. It can be a bit of a hike from the back of the hotel (where 533 is, about half-way) to the front desk; we finally figured out that if you park around the back near the side door, the second elevator bank takes you to the half-way point of the hotel so you don't have to walk as far. Location is fantastic, as noted by others. We enjoyed walking to the beach for sunset each day and then easy stroll to several excellent restaurant choices (LOVED Cafe O'Lei and 808 Bistro!). Wailea and Makena are close by as well. It's a longer drive to Lahaina than I remembered - so if you're planning to go in for dinner go early and make a long evening out of it! There is an Expedia activities desk in the lobby and Tiffany was very helpful and didn't try to push or hard-sell on the snorkel trip we asked about. We didn't use the tennis courts or the available bikes, even though we had planned to do both! There are plenty of bikes and they looked to be in good condition. We booked the "romance package" (ha ha, with our kids) because it was a good deal that included a rental car - plus a nice bottle of wine and basket of goodies in the room upon arrival. Beware that taxes for the car are not included so we still owed $80 when we returned the car, which we weren't expecting. Overall this hotel is a really good value. Not a big fancy resort, but it'scentrally located, clean, updated, and well cared for. We would definitely return and/or recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome and perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: Ambrose82
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Coast for 3 nights on a quick trip to Maui for a wedding. We were upgraded to a suite because our room wasn't ready which was fab. Close to good eats, beaches, and the pool was quiet and relaxing with good deals on cocktails and food. We'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place,Great price”
Reviews.Author: albertafamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Coast Hotel for the first 4 nights of a ten day stay on Maui. I booked a month and a half ahead of our stay and got a great rate of a regular room at $139 a night online direct with the Hotel website.Three weeks before we left the rate had jumped to $259 a night, so book early if you can. We checked in and thought we were getting a regular room but when we entered we dicovered they had upgraded us to a junior suite without even mentioning it to us,very nice of them considering the hotel was full.The junior suite has much more room to move around in,even though it was just myself,my wife and teenage son, the extra room was nice.The room was well appointed,clean and comfortable. The cleaning staff we saw every day when we were coming and going were always friendly. The only thing that was a bit strange was our room was cleaned early one day,middle of the day one day and very late around 4:00pm two days. No big deal but we always liked our room cleaned in the morning when we left for our daily dose of this fantastic island.We never used the pool but it looked ok,maybe a bit smallish for the size of this property.We instead walked a half block down the street and crossed the road to a nice beach every day while in Kihei.They have three computers in the lobby by the elevators that were handy to use and we also appreciated that they had washers and dryers on the second and sixth floors,which we used before changing hotels as we moved to Kaanapali beach for the second half of our trip. All in all this hotel was a "very good" place to stay and I would not hesitate to stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Microwave Included!”
Reviews.Author: workanai
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went here for our one year anniversary and this was the perfect hotel! It is located in Kihei which is pretty close to the other attraction cities--5 minutes away from Wailea, 30 minutes away from Lahaina, 25-30 minutes away from Kahului. We loved the staff! They were so helpful and friendly. Also, the room seemed to be updated with new furniture and decor. It was super clean. The bed felt like a cloud. And lastly, the room included a microwave! This was a huge plus considering we had to get a doggy bag at all of the places we ate at. It was very, very useful and didn't make us feel wasteful when we went out and ate. The hotel is right across the beach and is short walk from Kihei Caffe, a great breakfast spot. It also has a pretty nice pool and jacuzzi. The only regret is that we didn't stay for longer!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Tati97
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Maui Hotel when I got married, in Kihei, and I could not believe how friendly the staff was. They made us feel super welcomed, and we had a great time. Our room faced the ocean, and the view was absolutely beautiful. The room was clean and spacious, and we didn't even have a fancy suite. I love this place and can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place”
Reviews.Author: Melly80
Reviews.Content: We've been at the Maui Coast for 5 days, we have the large suite. The Hotel is very nice, clean, the room was beautiful, large, the bed was big and very confortable, the place very quite e very close to the beach. Also, since we were on our honeymoon, the give us a bottle of wine, a very nice present that make us feel very very special.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: thats-kandy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 10/15 â€“ 10-21 and loved it. It is in a great location and the staff were all very friendly. We travel a lot and have always stayed at big named hotels so I was a bit reluctant to book this place. However, I was very pleased by the cleanliness of this hotel. The bed was very comfortable and the size of the room itself is pretty big. The only complaint I had was that the bathroom was super small. There is no way you can fit two adults in that one room. The parking spaces are super small as well and if you have anything bigger than a super compact car, youâ€™ll have trouble getting in and out. We had an economy sized car and spent a long time trying to park it each night. You canâ€™t beat the location. It is across the street from a big beach, about 15 minutes from the airport and centrally located to a lot of restaurants which makes for easy picking at dinner time. Try â€œMaui Thaiâ€� down the street if you are into Thai food. It is quite good and reasonably priced considering this is Maui. Overall this hotel was a very good value. Weâ€™d definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel. Great location”
Reviews.Author: Bucajack
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 9 nights here. Very nice hotel in a great location. About a 30 minute drive from the airport. 5-10 minutes from Wailea and about 15 from Makena. Kapalua is about 1 hour away. We stayed in a newly renovated Junior Suite. Very nice room with a view of the car park! Although we could see the West Maui Mts. in the distance. Most rooms won't have an ocean view since the hotel is situated accross the road from the beach and back a bit. Front desk staff were very helpful as were the Expedia Local Experts (concierge) in the lobby. Hotel has a complimentary shuttle to Wailea that runs until 9pm. You can get the number and call it to pick you up. Some very nice places to eat around the hotel too. My only problem with the hotel is that it has nowhere to shower or change after checkout. We had to checkout by noon but were not flying until 9pm so we wanted to spend the day on the beach. Having to fly for 11 hours without a shower would have been quite uncomfortable. The staff at the front desk suggested using the pool shower and changing in the bathroom. I really feel that the hotel should provide a small courtesy room for guests in this position. Also bear in mind that there is a $17.50 per day "Resort Fee". This covers parking, internet in rooms, papers in the lobby, shuttle, towels for use by the pool/beach and numerous other things. This is common for hotels in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “ANOTHER GOOD STAY AT THE MAUI COAST”
Reviews.Author: HOTELLMEMORE
Reviews.Content: I am a repeat customer to this good 3 stars hotel where I have been staying 5 times since 2002. I must say that, thanks to overall good management and maintenance, timely remodeling and consistency in providing very good service to guests this property remains my favorite when staying on South Maui. The free WiFi internet access from every room is now a real plus as well as is free parking. However, donâ€™t be fooled: these perks and others are not really free so to speak and come with a mandatory USD17.50 + tax daily resort fee, something unique and contagious within Hawaiiâ€™s resorts that is simply extorsion to me. The deluxe minisuite room I was given was clean, quiet and smelled good with each and every items serviceable and was in line with my bookingâ€™s requests. I was therefore disappointed by the somewhat noisy window mounted not split A/C unit that made me use airplaneâ€™s earplugs in order to be less disturbed by the loud rumbling and vibrations. The flat panel TV set is hooked on a wall facing the sofa. However, since this TV is not moveable watching programs from your bed is not comfortable since you only get a limited side view. Housekeeping though well performed was taking place randomly from 9:am to 4pm thus being done most of the time when you donâ€™t expect it. Many times we came back from the beach around 3:30 PM to discover that our room was not ready forcing us to go down to the pool for an extra hour before being able to take a much needed shower in our room. However, these CONs will not prevent me from staying another time at this property next year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but.....”
Reviews.Author: ScoobyTennessee
Reviews.Content: The overall price including the mandatory resort fee was comparable for the area and amenities. It is not quite as nice as an average Marriott on the mainland, but nice. I have a Select Comfort at home, but these Serta beds they have are as good as advertised. You are across the street from the beach, but it's a short walk. The pool is nice with a 1 foot deep baby pool. This was great as we were travelling with our 17-month-old. The customer service was very good. The rooms have mostly been updated, but the carpets probably haven't been shampooed in years. Our socks were black on the bottom just from walking in our room. The carpet is old and needs to be replaced. The lobby area was not air conditioned nor was our room when we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “loved my stay”
Reviews.Author: melanie m
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, not jaw dropping but clean, comfortable and well laid out. The man who was checked us in was very friendly and accommodating. He sent a bottle of champagne to our room because we were getting married on Maui. I thought that was a very nice touch. My room was a suite with a very comfortable king bed and large bath tub. It had a small sofa that pulled out, a small coffee maker, mini fridge and 2 flat screen TVs. The pool was small but well maintained, clean and open. We did not have to fuss with room keys or any of that nonsense. The bartenders were super nice, and laid back. My daughter got stung by a bee on the cheek a few minutes after we got there and they were very helpful and made me a little ice pack for her.
