The beach was close enough to walk but not much else was. That was ok since we didn't spend much time in the hotel. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great all-around accomodation!”
Reviews.Author: chefNic75
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff, great location, and discount for a longer stay. We had a terrific time here and will go again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Maui hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MrsPicky72
Reviews.Content: We just celebrated our 10th wedding anniversary in Maui and stayed three nights at the Maui Coast Hotel (Sept. 15-17, 2011) in Room 433. I researched many hotels in the area and this one kept coming up with positive reviews - and now we know why. We had a fast and smooth check in and check out and had no problems with our bill at the end. We were even upgraded to a one bedroom suite for free since it was our anniversary which was a super nice surprise! Our room was gorgeous! It was super clean and all the furniture is fairly new. The king size bed was the comfiest bed we've ever slept on and it is one of the things that separates good rooms from great ones. The linens were clean and super soft and we had tons of clean pillows. Working in healthcare I'm a fanatic about cleanliness and bugs - and this was the cleanest hotel we stayed at in Maui (it was our third on this trip). The tub did not drain properly but this was a problem in every hotel and I imagine it has something to do with everyone's sand and suntan oil. We also loved the fact that we had two air conditioners (one in the living room and one in the bedroom) plus a fan over the bed so it was very easy to cool off after a long hot day. The free in-room safe was very shallow. It met our needs but it wouldn't fit a laptop or anything. We had large flatscreen TVs in the living room and bedroom but they blocked all the connections so you couldn't hook up your iPod. But we did have free wifi in the room which is more important to us. Parking is included in the $17.50 per day resort fee but beware of the extremely tight parking spaces (don't rent a big vehicle or you might have trouble finding parking spots at the end of the day). I'd complain about the resort fee but all the hotels do it so I'll save my breath. We had a nice little lanai with two chairs and a table. Our view was of another building and a garden pathway but we could see the ocean in the distance between the other buildings. We didn't spend much time in the room so the view didn't bother us at all. Although this hotel is not on a beach, it is located right across the street from Kamaole Beach Park. It is also located close to lots of shops and restaurants. We enjoyed some seriously good sushi at Sansei Seafood Restaurant - highly recommend the "panko crusted ahi in wasabi butter sauce" appetizer. The sauce was so good we even dipped our edamame in it. The Expedia staff were helpful in booking some excursions from the lobby but they called every day leaving messages introducing themselves even though we already went down and met them. They need to keep track of who they call. We booked a kayak/snorkel tour at Makena Landing with Maui Kayaks and had an amazing time (I'll write a separate review)! We also took in an evening at Ulalena with the optional VIP dinner at Ruth's Chris Steak House in Lahaina which was also awesome and one of the best steaks we've ever had! This was also an ideal location if you want to drive up to the top of Haleakala Summit (which we did) and La Perrouse Bay (which we did as well)! We would absolutely stay at this hotel again and would highly recommend it to our friends and families! You definitely get your money's worth here and we didn't even take in the pool, tennis courts or other facilities here. You won't regret staying here one bit. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “What a find..”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeJulie
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week in Maui and stayed at the Maui Coast Hotel. All of are expectations were met. Excellent location,close to restraunts and beaches. Very clean and comfortable, Staff was friendly,easy check in and out. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Grand Wailea”
Reviews.Author: eileendoylecrane
Reviews.Content: Wonderful property! Loved the church, the pools, the beach, the waterfalls, the room, the amenities, the flowers. Went in June 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: KyGirl_9
Reviews.Content: Maui Coast hotel was great. It met all of our needs.The location was great, quick walk to the beach. Room was modern and the beds were very comfortable! We did request a king bed and were put in a room with two doubles, but we had an ocean view so we didn't mind. The mini fridge and microwave were great, we were able to eat most of our breakfasts and lunches at the room, or pack them and have a picnic at the beach. We only used the pool one day for a couple of hours when we were sandblasted off the beach, it was small but nicely landscaped so you didn't feel like you were in the middle of the parking lot, and the poolside service was great. We only used the hotel for sleeping and getting ready basically, we left early in the morning and arrived back after sunset for bed. If you want to lay around the pool all day and be pampered I would suggest checking out one of the resorts in Wailea. There is a resort fee of $17.50 per day plus tax, we were aware of this going in and even with the fee the price was unbeatable. We would definitely stay here again and we can't wait to return to Maui

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Enjoyed My Stay”
Reviews.Author: esjen
Reviews.Content: I just returned a couple of days ago from a week-long vacation in Maui, and I stayed at the Maui Coast Hotel. I stayed in a junior suite on the 7th (top) floor. It was a spacious, comfortable room and very clean. The bathroom was large with plenty of toiletries (shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, shower cap, etc.) The king sized mattress was very comfortable, and the floor overall was pretty quiet. The microwave and mini fridge allowed me to keep a few groceries to eat in from time to time. There is a Safeway grocery store about 10-15 minutes away from the hotel; be sure to get a Safeway club card to get the best prices (club card is free). From the patio, beyond the top of the other buildings, I could see the ocean, but I didnâ€™t book this hotel for an ocean view. I wanted quality at an affordable price, and the Maui Coast provided that. The staff was very friendly and helpful; housekeeping even called my room on days when I put out the â€œDo Not Disturbâ€� sign to make sure I wanted my room skipped for cleaning. Other amenities include a computer area with 3 pcâ€™s for customersâ€™ use. There is a restaurant on the property, and the food is good (but the room service is expensive). Overall, I really enjoyed my stay at the Maui Coast Hotel, and I would not hesitate to stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: BrazilBackpack
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights this October. Location is very good, close to nice restaurants and some convenience stores and gas stations. Check in was a breeze. The hotel grounds are well maintained and the rooms are very spacious and clean, with a minifridge, coffee maker, safe, LCD TV and an awesome mattress. Wifi in the room (included in the mandatory resort fee: US$ 17.5 per day) and 3 computers at the lobby if you didn't bring your laptop. A large parking lot, no problems to find a spot to park the rental car (that you definitely will need to explore Maui). I did not experience the beach that is at the other side of the road, in front of the hotel, so can't comment on this one.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding (experienced traveler)”
Reviews.Author: rholliday
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I have been vacationing to Maui for the past twenty years. We just returned from celebrating our 25 year anniversary. A friend recommended Maui Coast Hotel and we took him up on his suggestion. Wow what a wonderful place that I wish we would have discovered twenty years ago. Nice upscale place without the upscale rates. Nicely tucked away from traffic, this gem offers everything. Nice clean updated rooms with flat panel T.V's, beautiful grounds, wonderful staff, a swimming pool that doesn't want to make you leave the grounds, really great happy hours for cost effective indulging, nice restaurants. I left the windows down in the rental car along with my camera one night and returned the following morning to discover it was still there. We noticed security at all times. Forgot to mention the bed was the best we ever slept in. Great shopping and beaches just a hop away. We did some paddle boarding (1st time ever) and saw a bunch of turtles. I can't say enough good things and can't wait to return with our daughters. They are going to love it. Thanks for the great experience Maui Coast. Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “The worst service we've ever had at a Coast Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vivalavida123
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicer than expected but the staff are very unfriendly ESPECIALLY Manny at the front desk. My husband is a platinum member of Coast and stays at their hotels minimum 100 days out of the year so he's a pretty good judge of customer service or lack of in this hotel. Manny is hostile and defensive to guests, (we saw how he talked to other guests at the desk.) On the upside it it is good value, clean and updated rooms. Just don't expect that warm friendly feeling from the staff. My husband will be switching hotels after this stay as we felt the service or lack of was so bad.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Coast Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vandalboz
Reviews.Content: Good location in Kihei, central to most everything. Jr suite is great for golf buddy trip. Rooms are spaceious and clean. Staff is very attentive to any requests.

Reviews.Title: “A clean, comfortable, well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: linda h
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very good location, close to all amenties. Its rooms are clean and beds extremely comfortable, maid service daily with fresh towels. Our room was on the 7th floor and had a great sea view.The pool is rather small but it has two jacuzzi pools which are a bonus. Most of the staff are very friendly,Patty( barman ) is a credit to the hotel. Ate breakfast in restaurant only once, food was superb but service far too slow. We didnt have to pay the resort fee which other reviews have mentioned as we booked through a broker rather than the hotel itself. Car park did get busy, even out of season, but always managed to get a space. Wasnt able to extend out checkout time as hotel was fully booked which was a little inconvenient as we didnt fly out until late evening. It would of been helpful if they had an area reserved with showering facilties so we could of made the most of our last day. All in all a very pleasant stay and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for our purpose”
Reviews.Author: akw46845
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights here and it was just fine for our purposes. We wanted just a place to sleep at night and not pay resort prices; as our first 3 days in Maui we wanted to explore up-country and the volcano and not really be beachy. That came later in the week at a real beach resort. Our room was clean, pleasant if not overly hawaiian in decoration. The staff were all very friendly; Happy hour 3-5 at the pool bar was worth heading home for - in Maui a $4 cocktail is hard to find (limited choice on these though). Great location to explore Kihei for a day or two. Close to Wailea as well without paying Wailea prices. Beach close, good, calm, short walk brought you to lots of vendors offering surfing lessons etc... Note on resort fee. If you book hotel through a tour company you can get it lower than the fees quoted in reviews below.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1Debz
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, very friendly and helpful staff, also lovely clean room. Courtesy coach available to take us out for dinner to Wailea, bikes available which we took advantage of to tiki tour around the area. Beautiful pool and poolside bar and restaurant. Beach only a few minutes walk down the road. Great setting and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: annie8848
Reviews.Content: We had a two room suite which worked well for my husband and I and our grown daughter. Comfortable bed. Fridge, microwave on a wet bar. Flat screen TV in each room. Didn't look as large a room as in their pictures, but was big enough. Not quite as fancy a room as the Fairmont Kei Lani Hotel where our friends stayed, but at a quarter of the cost was well worth it. It was only a short walk across the street to the beach and it was a lovely beach, not crowded and had a great area for snorkeling. We saw more fish there than at Makena Landing that was recommended for snorkeling, and calmer seas. Great sunsets there also. We were on the top floor-7th--and had a great view of the ocean and Molokini. Seemed like you would have to be on 7 to have a view, not sure. We were in 745. Staff was very friendly. Good restaurants near by. Pool had bar and food service. Next block had snorkeling equipment for 1.50 per day or with prescriptions goggles for 10. per day as well as beach chairs. Get all the beach towels you want from the check in desk at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: BaySFtraveler
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at Maui Coast and loved it. We stayed in a 1 bed suite with a separate living area. Some positives: friendly staff, clean interior, microwave and refrigerator, comfy bed, bicycles, close to Kamaole Beach. One issue was that the refrigerator ice box had thawed out into the water pan and spilled when I moved the pan. Other than that, everything was great. Some things to know before staying at Maui Coast: 1. Not ocean front but the beach is across the street to the left (Kamaole Beach, less than 5 minute walk). According to the lifeguards at the beach, Kamaole Beach is one of the most calm beaches on Maui, mainly early in the morning. 2. Be ready for the Resort Fee (about $18/night) as mentioned in other reviews. However, it included a list of things such as the in room safe and parking to name a few. For us the bicycles made it worth it. 3. The shower amenities (shampoo, conditioner, shower gel) were in a large dispenser in the shower instead of small bottles. For us this was nice because we didn't have to worry about running out. A bar soap was also provided. All in all, the stay was pleasant and economical when compared to the large resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Dan S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Coast Hotel on our honeymoon, and it was a good experience overall. We thought the staff was friendly and helpful, for the most part. The location of this hotel along the coast in Kihei is excellent, though I should note that the hotel is not oceanfront, but rather is across a busy street from the ocean. Therefore, if you are going to Hawaii in order to have a few late night walks along the beach in front of a resort, this is not possible at Maui Coast Hotel. However, through the Expedia concierge at Maui Coast Hotel, we booked tickets for the show of Cirque de Polynesia at a different resort, and at that resort, we did in fact have an opportunity to walk along the beach at night, after the show. Also, we walked along the ocean after going to a luau at the Marriott in Wailea. On the plus side, we definitely enjoyed the updated/renovated room, especially the rather large mini-fridge, microwave, and coffee-maker. The king-size bed was quite comfortable, and the furniture was fun and updated. Also, when we asked for the Hotel to waive the resort activity fee, which seemed a bit exorbitant, the first clerk did waive the fee, since we were staying at the hotel for 9 nights. However, it took a little while to convince the clerk to waive the fee, and he did so only after I gave him a truly grumpy and angry look and told him that we understood that the fee was waived for other people who stayed for longer than a week. On the negative side, the room door's lock appeared to be flimsy. Also, the pool is much smaller than it looks on the hotel's website, and the pool was really crowded on windy days and on the weekend, with the exception of Sunday night. We were mainly swimming in the ocean, so it didn't matter too much that there were no open chairs around the pool for about 70% of the time the pool was open in the afternoon and evening. Moreover, the pool attendant was quite grumpy and, in fact, volunteered to me that his day would have been a lot better if he was not working. I thought that was a little rude, given that this was a vacation for us, and we work the rest of the time. Additionally, we were told by the first clerk that we could be moved to a different room when the hotel was less busy, but we later checked to see if we could do this, and the hotel staff was not accommodating. We were not given a different room. Overall, we loved the central location of the property, since it is located between Wailea and Lahaina, though much closer to Wailea. And we certainly loved that the beach was only a short walk away, and the beach near the hotel is one of the most swimmable beaches in Maui. The hotel is also close to a huge variety of reasonably-priced restaurants, coffee places, and stores. We would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a reasonably-priced alternative to the bigger resorts--which tend to have less ideal locations but perhaps better views from the rooms. The best part of the Maui Coast Hotel is its location, followed by the comfortable and updated rooms. However, as a warning, if you want to swim in a deluxe resort-style pool, this is not the hotel for you. That being said, all of the outdoor activities that can be enjoyed in Maui are accessible with a rental car and staying at Maui Coast Hotel, and the beach and ocean are just a short walk from the hotel. We would stay there again, since we prefer to save on the hotel and spend on activities, such as sailing, snorkeling, jetskiing, dining at luaus, seeing shows, and taking a trip to the nearby Island of Lanai.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: lss_11
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with huge and new rooms. Very comfortable beds. Swimming pool and jacuzzi are great and quiet after dinner listening to the live music that's on everyday. Service could have been more polite though.

Reviews.Title: “Very Peaceful hotel...”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsTrain
Reviews.Content: We travelled over to Maui from Oahu, so this hotel bought a welcome peacefulness from the noise of Waikiki! The hotel has undergone a major refurbishment and it is clear to see and nicely kept. Beautiful, clean rooms awaiting all of us, although our room which was a double was fine but if you have a twin room the bathroom is very very small indeed! Bear this in mind when booking! Check in was pain free, however we were celebrating our 1st Wedding Anniversary whilst there and this was not acknowledged by any kind of hospitality! The beach isn't too far away at all, but be aware there are no areas of shade so those with children or fairer skin need to be prepared. The pool is nice and it seemed to be gently heated to take the usual chill out of the water, but sunbeds can be limited. Whilst we were there one family tended to monopolise it and had there towels on the same sunbeds day in day out, this was the only area we saw a difference in staffing attitudes as this 'loud' family liked the bar and I assume tipped therefore gaining them residence around the pool! The hotel is not centrally located, so you do have to walk a bit further for shops and restaurants. The nearest ones been about a 7-10 minute walk, be aware that it can go very dark quickly and the lighting is not the best when walking to said shops and restaurants. Maui is a beautiful island and must be explored and enjoyed, we hired a car and took the Hana highway which is breathtakingly beautiful. We hired from the local Avis in Kihei, they were very good! We didn't eat at the Spices restaurant, but did at the pool bar it was ok nothing special but edible. However there is a great deli called the 808 it's probably a good 15 to 20 minute walk depending on your pace (quicker if you a speedy gonzales!!) and boy they do amaaaaazing food to either take out or eat in.... Very reasonable too! The Resort Fee is mandatory and does seem to be one of the sticking points for me for this hotel, you seem to pay for a lot of things you don't tend to use! And the prices are already increased to reflect the refurbishment: as we booked in Feb 2011 and my Mum who accompanied us on our holiday paid Â£50.00 more per night!! That is a lot of additional money!! My only other complaint about this hotel was on our last day, we stayed in Room 252 of which there was a meeting room next door. There was no bother until the last day when at approx 8.00am we were both woken up to the sounds of hysterical laughter, banging, shouting, chanting you name it, it was going on... It continued, so I called the front desk as we thought it was some kind of kids party (I know at 8.00am?? But that's what it sounded like!!) and asked if they could look into what was going on. She called back and informed me we could move rooms???!!!!! I said why should we move rooms, you need to ask them to move rooms!! So she said she would find out more and called back again to say it was "wrapping up in 10 mins" and can I offer you free breakfast by way of an apology!!! Errr no I'd like to go to sleep please! Then as the noise reduced and we heard the door open, out troop a load of staff members!!! So if you get a room near a meeting room avoid like the plague and ask to moved room before unpacking!!! Other than that nice hotel, is it worth the money? I am sure there are worse, but I am certain there are also better....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Roluke
Reviews.Content: Great hotel across the street from beach. The location of the hotel is great. If you go either right or left you hit great parks/beaches. I liked the location to the right of the hotel as it had a nice paved walkway along the ocean. The rooms are comfortable and are updated. The pool was nice and full service. At night there was entertainment too. This was a great choice for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, nice and quiet!”
Reviews.Author: TripsGaloreVancouver
Reviews.Content: The facilities of this hotel were great, the hotel rooms seemed to be recently renovated, although the bathroom was partially done. They did the vanity and the sink for the bathroom but i believe the toilet and bathtub were still the original. The bed was very comfortable and the grounds were very quiet. The downside i found was paying for the daily hotel rate on top of the nightly room rate because that hotel fee was supposed to include all facilities including the gym, towels and the parking space. We didn't use the gym at all during our one week stay so it seemed like we had to pay for something we didn't want or need to. Other than that everything was quite pleasant and we would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “OGG - Maui Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: planedrs
Reviews.Content: I found that the Maui Coast Hotel is Nice and while it is not Directly located on the BEACH its no big deal; because its directly behind the ocean. what I like about the room and hotel is that it is very quiet and you can relax after a long day on business. again this Hotel provides you with the Basic amenities i.e. Shampoo, Lotion, Coffee (Hawaiian Style), ironing board ETC... what I loved most about the location is that theirs plenty of place to stop an eat, as well local pubs to mingle with Locals for the hollies to hang with. This place is about 35 miles from the airport and the drive is beautiful - if you rent a car is STRONGLY recommend that you take a few hour drive around the island and get lost because the scenery is breathe taking. The only CON I have against this place is that they charge for late check outs at $20 HR. which I find wrong being that most flight don't arrive to OGG (Maui) until 3pm or so. so the hotel could accommodate a FREE late check out. Shoot its already costly as it is. I would recommend hotel for both the Business Traveler and Vacation Goer. take a nice Run along the the coast the neighborhood is beautiful and surround by pricey real-estate. I have enclose some pics of my room and local views hope this help in selecting your lodging.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time and we are going back again and again”
Reviews.Author: debra1001
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at th Maui Coast three different times. Last February (2011) we took our grown son and family. We had separate rooms/side by side. They were so kind and arrnanged this for us. Absolutely wonderful from the front desk to the cleaning staff to the cafe to the poolside service. We were there in Feb. for a month and loved every minute. We have booked to go "again" this coming February 2012. The beach is right across the street and shopping is close by. Spices restaurant is great for breakfast, but with so many restaurants close by - try them out. We have not had a terrible meal anywhere in Maui. The Maui Coast is simply affordable and very comfortable and very clean and soooo wonderful. Love it and cudos to the great staff. After returning 3 years in a row, one gets to know the staff and the same persons are there year after year. That has to say something for this "wonderful" hotel"....Deb

Reviews.Title: “Great for families, nice pool”
Reviews.Author: heiric
Reviews.Content: From the open air lobby to the 1" toddlers pool, this hotel has everything. We were staying with friends and decided to get a place with a pool as the beach is no place for a 14 month old. :) Sand everywhere! Not being able to afford Wailea or the hotels near Lahanie we settled for Kihea. Glad we did. We had a great 3 night stay and would be back. The front desk was gracious and the pool bar staff fun and accommodating. One knock, we had a ground floor room and our little guy crawling around got dirty knees and hands in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: sdskyguy
Reviews.Content: This hotel far exceeded our expectations went there with a lady friend hotel to extend our week stay, hotel was very nice, extremely clean with very helpful employees. Centrally located in Kihei, it has a nice poo and pool l bar with live music on the weekend at least. FYI there is a resort fee a little high and mandatory at $17.50 a day., but included a lot of nice things,newspaper,wifi internet , use of bicycles, pool towels etc.. Good hotel for a stay in Kihei. Hint: Superb restaurant close by is Sarento's on the beach, dazzling beachside location, incredible food and impeccable service but very pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Nicho123
Reviews.Content: We booked a Junior Suite at a great rate through Worldwide Holidays. It was a big room with a king size bed, a sitting/tv area and also had a sink/fridge space. My only complaint about the room was that it had a bit of a horrible dank smell which was a bit gross. We didn't complain about it though or asked to be moved, just a general observation. The air-conditioner was not terribly effective and was noisy. We did mention that to reception when we checked out and the gentleman did say that they could have done something about it if we'd said something during our stay, so that was good to know (we're generally not the complaining type, unless something is pretty bad). The hotel had a laundry room on three separate floors. The one on our floor had two washers and two dryers and a machine to buy soap powder. There was no charge to use the dryer. We were happy with the location which was right across the road and there were various restaurants in close proximity.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for a clean/modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: misskis
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for the price. It was centrally located with lots of shops, restaurants, beaches close by. We had a rental car which I would say is almost a must. Rooms are very clean and beds are comfy. The mini kitchen is also really nice. I agree that the resort fee is a bit of a rip off, they don't re-stock water etc... But not a huge deal. Pool towels are free and we brought them to the beach every day so we didn't buy beach towels. I wish they would lend out umbrellas and beach chairs as well! We used the lanai a lot for having a drink or a bite to eat. The view is non-existent but they have done a nice job of creating a garden to look onto. The only downside is that the pool is open to the public at no charge. On a number of days there were rowdy locals ( including a kid who threw up in the pool 4 times) and no one seemed to care. 3 days out of five there were not enough beach chairs and they were full of people not paying to stay. You also can't bring your own food/drink to the pool because of this. We would go every day at 5pm after the beach for happy hour and that was the only time it bothered us. Other then that you should be at the beach anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, pleasant and great location”
Reviews.Author: Pete4567867
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one week of our honeymoon and thought it was an excellent hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful and our room was a good size with good air con. We booked through an agency so I am not sure how the resort fee worked out but we found the computers in the lobby for free internet access (I believe this was covered by that daily fee) to be really handy. The other place we stayed charged by the minute and that was pretty annoying. The expedia desk was great for sorting out our daytrips and the staff there were really good. All of the trips we booked through them were excellent. There is an ABC store just down the road for food and water (and it had pretty much everything else) plus a couple of pretty decent restaurants. We recommend Pupu. (out of the main entrance turn right, it is about 20 minutes walk) The lady running this place was really nice and the fish we had was extremely fresh and tasty. Breakfast in the spices restaurant (part of the hotel I think) was also very good, plus there is a very cool poolside bar with live music in the evenings. If you turn right out of the main entrance and walk 5 minutes there is a row of shops where there is a really nice ice cream parlour - well worth a visit! There are 3 beaches across the road all of which are excellent with nice sand. It got quite windy in the middle of the day but sunset on the beach was fantastic. We would recommend this hotel. Pete and Helen

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel; excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: AMluv2Travel
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice; the rooms were very clean. The customer service we received from the front desk staff was excellent. We had to report a problem on our first night, due to very noisy neighbors, and they responded immediately. Unfortunately, the neighbors didn't want to cooperate so they offered to give us a different room. We took them up on the offer and they upgraded our room, at no extra charge. We didn't have any problems during the rest of our stay (no noise, etc.). The rooms have microwaves/fridges, which is a huge plus. They also have shampoo, conditioner and soap dispensers in the showers -- we really liked that! The location was excellent - a very short walk to the beach and 15-20 minutes to the airport. It's on a main road, so it has easy access to shopping, dining, beaches, etc. The only negative thing, and it is minor, is that since they charge a resort fee, they say that covers bottled water; however, they only give you two small bottles of water on the first night. When they clean the rooms they don't bring more water (unless we should have asked for it). We were told that the resort fee does include use of bicycles and use of the washer and dryer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic--and we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: MsPatty1
Reviews.Content: Our vacation stay at Maui Coast was Fantastic! The room was nicely furnished and the hotel staff was extremely friendly and accomodating. I have not one complaint , nor can I say anything but good things about our stay. Everything was Perfect! My only advice to management is keep doing what your are doing and I am looking forward to my next visit which will be December if all goes as planned--Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “The best bed I slept in over my month long trip in the US”
Reviews.Author: Hayley O
Reviews.Content: The staff were so helpful and very friendly. The rooms spacious, very clean and the beds were so comfy, it was hard to get out of them! The only thing missing was a great view, but for the price you can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, tiny bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: Npfran
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located on the main drag in Kihei, which is a good thing. The biggest complaint I had was the size of the bathroom. I had read a review on Trip Advisor about the size of the bath, but I figured how small could it be? Tiny is an understatement. In order to get into the shower, I had to close the door. If my husband had come, we would have had to go solo in the bathroom. If you go to the Maui Coast and are with your significant other, make sure to start early for an evening out because it's solo getting ready if you need the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall, though housekeeping could use a bit of help!”
Reviews.Author: PninaG
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Maui Coast hotel during our honeymoon, an we couldn't have been happier! Our room, a one bedroom suite, was well appointed and comfortable, with two separate balconies and a nice living room. The grounds were well-kept and the pool was amazing! The front desk staff were friendly and helpful, and the location was great, especially since it is removed from the more touristy areas of the island-this area of Kihei seemed to cater mostly to condo owners and apartment renters, and it had a nice, quiet vibe. The hotel is right across from the beach and is a quick drive (or bike ride-they have lots of bikes you can borrow!) to local restaurants and shopping centers, which is very convenient. My only mild complaint is the housekeeping service, which seemed a bit spotty. On our first day there, the maid left a dirty rag on our sink, which I moved to the floor and was then removed. Then, on any given day, our room might have been cleaned at 4pm the earliest, and certain things like tissues and toilet paper were not replenished-the front desk gave us their box of tissues for my poor husband who had a cold! That's really my only complaint because otherwise everything else at the Maui Coast was top notch-we'd definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay in Kihei!”
Reviews.Author: HiSunshine_10
Reviews.Content: HIGHLY recommend this hotel. I couldn't believe the low price for a hotel in Kihei and was wondering if it would indeed be as nice as the hotel photos...well it was! I would compare it to Embassy Suites quality, or even better. My husband thought it was cleaner. Penny in Reservations and Lance and Chris at the Front Desk were outstanding - so friendly and helpful! The Fitness Center is awesome - 20+ machines, free weights, TVs, water, towels, everything you could want! The hotel should put a photo of it on their website. We didn't go to the pool but it was always crowded and the live music at sunset was wonderful. The loaner bicycles were also fun and convenient. We stayed at the Grand Wailea after and it was not as relaxing and centrally located - we should have stayed at the Maui Coast the whole time. Ono Gelato and Da Kitchen are 2 great places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Good affordable room, a short hop jump and skip to wailea and 25 minutes to lahaina”
Reviews.Author: Ellzar
Reviews.Content: Pretty good accommodations. - pool was clean and right sized for size of hotel. Service was quick and attentive at poolside bar - rooms were wellsized and clean - parking was fantastic and accessible to our 6 floor room - bikes for rent but didn't use them Cons - rooms weren't always Made to our satisfaction - toiletries not alway refreshed

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: verason
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are destination photographers and have traveled quite extensively. The Maui Coast hotel was booked by our clients, so we had no idea of what we were getting into. We were totally happy with this hotel. They had live music by the poolside, the room was clean and cozy and the staff was friendly and very helpful. Oh, and did I mention that the beach was across the street, and the ever present ABC store is 1 block away? Is this the Fairmont or Four Seasons, no, but neither is the price. We will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: NicsiBruxelles
Reviews.Content: Globally a fair choice in Maui. Ideally located in one of the best areas, close to beaches and services + not far away from more unspoiled areas. Rooms are ok and reception very helpful. They give you all you need for the beach and even bycicles to stroll araound. Overall a good quality/price ratio. Howevere in Hawaii it is usually better to go for condos: more space and usually same or even better services.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: misstrace
Reviews.Content: We stayed here based on Tripadvisor reviews and weren't disappointed. The hotel staff were helpful and friendly. Our junior suite was roomy, comfortable, and clean. We enjoyed the free laundry facilities at the hotel. While our view wasn't spectacular, we could see the ocean and Haleakala from our balcony. The beach was a short walk from the hotel. The next time we vacation in south Maui we will return to the Maui Coast Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation at it's best”
Reviews.Author: Macale86
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Maui with our two boys, aged 10 and11. The hotel impressed even them. It was very clean and the staff was very friendly, courteous and knowledgeable. They answered all of our questions and were helpful in helping us plan events for the day. The gift shop in the lobby rents beach chairs etc if you didn't bring any. The rooms are spacious. The food portions in the hotel are fairly large. Hotel is in a great location in Kihei, within walking distance of restaurants, beaches and shopping. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “great room, great drinks, and good access to everything”
Reviews.Author: galobranco
Reviews.Content: we loved the place for the price. Room was large and nicely furnished with balcony (not much view but didn't spend time in the room). Breakfast wasn't too bad although the Kihei Cafe down the road blows it out of the water and is open mad early if you are hitting the volcano or whatever. we rented a jeep and tooled around the island the whole time. If you want to sit at one resort this might not be your choice maybe pick something beachside in Makena or up north.

Reviews.Title: “Read some reviews and was worried, but it was great”
Reviews.Author: mefo
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Maui and the Maui Coast Hotel. I have stayed there 3 times in the past, but the reviews on Tripadvisor worried me. We stayed 2 nights and the hotel was very clean and the staff was courteous/helpful. It's not the Westin or Four Season, but the pool is good and the price is right. The Kehei beach is one block away. It's not Big Beach, but there were sand flees or something that 'chewed' on us at Big Beach. The best thing about Kehei are the stores and central location for everything on the island.

Reviews.Title: “In the cut but close”
Reviews.Author: fabulisa3
Reviews.Content: The Maui Coast Hotel is a strip of property squeezed between a ditch and another property. You won't be spending time in your room, because there's little to see- the parking lot. The balconies are as tight as the parking spaces. The service, beds, and other accomodations were very nice. The Kihei beach and awesome sunsets are just across the street. From the airport, the hotel was easy to find, convenient to move around town, and venture out- not far from Lahaina or Paia. There are very good eateries/bars within walking distance. Saw a couple airline crews checking in/out.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Coast Hotel”
Reviews.Author: buttereyes
Reviews.Content: What a great find! We loved the location of this hotel--right across the street from Kamaole Beach III (which, by the way, boasts much calmer waters to swim in than around the Kaanapali area). The Maui Coast Hotel might not be smack dab on the beach, but your wallet will be much skinnier if you plan to stay in a hotel that is. The lobby and our room were extremely clean and cute, and the staff couldn't have been friendlier. We did not have a great view from our room, but we were still able to enjoy coffee in the morning from our balcony (it's a definite plus to have a balcony in Hawaii to hang out wet clothes to dry). There is also free, live entertainment at the hotel pool nightly. It was a little cheesy at times, but nothing a couple yummy "fru-fru" drink from the pool bar couldn't fix! The pool bar also serves food, which I highly recommend for a lunch or two. The mahi-mahi sandwiches we had there were amazing and very affordable. And if you're lucky, the "adopted" kitty that hangs out by the pool might come by to greet you as well. We had debated on Wailea or Kihei before the trip, and we couldn't be happier that we chose Kihei. The crowds of more touristy cities were absent, allowing us to share the beach each day with only a small handful of people (less than 20 on each of the days we were there).

Reviews.Title: “Great Economical Choice”
Reviews.Author: SDKaliKid
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently attended a wedding in Maui and decided to stay at the Maui Coast Hotel. The rooms have been recently renovated and are quite nice. Beds are really comfortable, room has air-conditioning, and water pressure in shower is decent. Pool area is kind of small but is nicely landscaped and live entertainment is provided nightly poolside. Only issue we had is that our t.v. (which is a High Def widescreen) had issues when attempting to play a movie that we ordered. However, the staff was nice enough to reverse the charges for the movie. Location of the hotel is quite residential, however, there is beach access less than a 1/4 mile from the hotel offering various types of activities such as surfing lessons, etc. Hotel food is not the best nor is the service but is available if you do not feel like going out to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well run, high quality without the excess ritz.”
Reviews.Author: vrmgi
Reviews.Content: OK, so you just want a nice clean hotel in expensive Maui, with just the basic amenities, close to the beach, and you don't need the ritzy attached golf course, the beach right outside your door, the spa, or all the extra resort features. Maui Coast Hotel is the hotel for you! It is just across the street from the beach, and it is well run and clean. The beds are really comfortable, the sheets and pillows are high quality and smell fresh and clean. It is in a quiet area. The hotel has a nice swimming pool. I got a special internet special deal which came with wi-fi and other extras, but still had to pay the resort fee. Oh well, that's my only gripe. Otherwise, it's an excellent value and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre, nothing luxury”
Reviews.Author: Shinmiri
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed here during June for 5 days. Here are some pros and cons that we summarized: Pros: - Very clean and all the furniture are new . - Bed and sofa are very comfortable - The restaurant in the resort is very seasonably priced and quantity + quality are both good for breakfast. Cons: - Bathroom is tiny! There is no way 2 persons can use it at the same time. - The views from rooms are horrible in this hotel. Most of the rooms are facing parking lot. We were staying at the 2nd floor. From our balcony, we could see nothing but random cars parking in front of us. We didn't even go on the balcony once because of this. - Room service is terrible. At one of the days we stayed there, a maid entered our room without knocking or saying anything before she opened the door. It kind of freaked us out. We asked her to return 30 minutes later. The second time she's back she finally knocked.... - The room is very clean but it seems they have ants problem. I saw ants on my note pad, on the table all the time. Overall, it's a decent place to "sleep" but I would not recommend this place if you are looking for a luxury getaway. I would not personally return here. Next time I come to Maui I will choose a hotel that is ocean front.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Fabzulous
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here our first 4 nights of our honeymoon. It was a perfect hotel for us in every way. We actually wished we had stayed in this hotel longer before changing locations. What we loved about this hotel: 1. The rooms were large and we had our own deck. 2. We had our own fridge, microwave, and coffeemaker in our room. 3. We could use the washer and dryers (located on the even floors) for free. 4. They provided beach/pool towels. 5. Happy hour at the bar from 3-6pm and a live band at the pool from 6-9pm. 6. The hotel is in walking distance to many eateries, shops and beaches. 7. If you wanted to go somewhere within 3 miles, the hotel shuttle would drive you there. 8. The pool wasn't large, but it was never crowded. 9. Bikes are offered to use at no charge if you would like. 10. Extremely comfortable beds. 11. Provided cotton balls, Q-tips, shampoo, conditioner, and body wash in the bathroom. The only thing I can think of that we didn't like about this hotel was the small parking spaces, but you'll find this all over the island.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Formiga
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending a friend's wedding. Loved the pool, loved having breakfast at the restaurant, huge portions I couldn't finish. Our room was really nice and comfy, the hotel is maintained really well. The AC worked really well, we liked our little patio. We took advantage of their tennis courts, over all a really relaxing stay. Great price for the quality!

Reviews.Title: “excellent service, location and value”
Reviews.Author: taiyaAK
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at the Maui Coast, and felt inspired to write a review. The room is meticulously clean, the hotel is conveniently located, the staff is friendly and helpful and the concierge (Tiffany) is knowledgeable and accommodating. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Wowie! Loooooved it!”
Reviews.Author: hntirona
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel! Prior to booking, we were a bit hesitant at first being that there were a few negative reviews and we unsure of the location (one of my friends had stayed at more of the resort type of areas -- i.e. Wilea -- and when we had asked about Kihei, she didn't seem to know where this place was!). However, during our stay we realized that the location was perfect! -- we were close to the highways, shopping areas, and local food favorites (Kihei Caffe was delicioso!)! We didn't want to stay in areas that were too "touristy," so the location of the hotel suited us well :) We booked for the Junior Suite at the Maui Coast, and the room was fabulous! The room was air conditioned, had a mini-fridge, microwave and coffeemaker, very clean and it was a perfect size for the two of us. The beds were very comfy -- wonderful for naps after a long day and getting that beauty rest! There is also complimentary wi-fi in the rooms which we loved -- allowed us to watch movies and search for things to do in Maui! The whole staff at the hotel was very welcoming and friendly. They always greeted us with a smile and were very accommodating with requests. At one point, I actually felt bad for the evening front desk (my apologies...I don't remember his name) because I kept asking for forks at least once every night...ugh! Upon leaving Maui Coast Hotel, I was very sad to leave the hotel (and Maui!), but at least I know where to return to if (and hopefully...fingers crossed!) I go back to Maui :)

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Maui Coast Hotel and will definitely be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: Canucks02
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent 6 nights at the Maui Coast Hotel in Kihei. We had also spent 2 nights at the Lotus hotel on Waikiki beach and 4 nights at the Westin Resort & Spa on Kaanapali (see my reviews on those hotels as well). The Maui Coast Hotel was by far our favorite hotel!!! We were upgraded to a 1 bedroom king suite which suited our needs perfectly. It had a huge bathroom with large jetted tub, a bar area with sink and mini fridge, a sofa, a table with 2 chairs and a deck with 2 chairs. There were flat screen TV's mounted on both the wall in the living area and the wall of the bedroom. The bed and bedding were high quality and super comfortable and there was both a ceiling fan and air conditioning option in the bedroom and separate air conditioning in the living room. The room was spacious and beautiful with quality fixtures, including what appeared to be quartz countertops in the bathroom and bar...not sure if they actually were, but they were beautiful all the same! The hotel had a great pool with pool bar. It wasn't a large pool but was great for a quick dip to cool down. There is happy hour from 3-6 every night and music entertainment from 6-9. The hotel also has bicycles that you can sign out for the day to bike to all the nearby beaches, restaurants and shops, which we borrowed practically every day! The hotel is right across the street from the most beautiful beach in Kihei being Kamaole Beach I. My favorite night of our trip was when we biked to Kamaole Beach III and bbq'd fresh fish, fruit & vegetables on the beach bbq while watching the sunset and sipping champagne. All in all we absolutely loved the Maui Coast hotel and its location and would definitely go back. We definitely preferred the Kihei side of the island to Kaanapali. We are a fun loving, kid-free couple in our late 20's and Kihei was definitely more our style! Not as expensive or pretentious as Kaanapali, totally laid back and totally fun.

Reviews.Title: “Ripped off at checkout”
Reviews.Author: billd10
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a repeat trip. We stayed there a few years ago and it is a nice hotel in a good location. I booked the hotel through Expedia and got a package deal including a rental car. My receipt included free parking. Upon checkout, I was surprised to find a $17.50/day plus tax resort fee charged to my credit card. To begin with, this is not a resort. No golf course, private beach, tennis court or anything one would not expect in a nice Hampton Inn. I called Expedia and they "updated" my itinerary after I had paid by including a $15.00 resort fee. This seems like fraud to me as the original booking did not include it.

Reviews.Title: “A little luxury for our budget vacation”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelelmundo
Reviews.Content: We were happy we chose to stay at the Maui Coast Hotel. While Kihei has great beaches & great prices, there's nothing fancy about the town or most of the available accommodations. But the Maui Coast Hotel is like a little bit of luxury in the middle of condo-land. The grounds are pretty, the rooms very comfortable (great bed!), the staff is friendly (especially Heather at the poolside bar & grill), and the price is just right. The hotel is conveniently located across the street from a beautiful beach and is within walking distance to a strip-mall with shops & low-key restaurants. You can also take advantage of the free shuttle (part of the mandatory $17.50 daily resort fee) anywhere in Kihei & Wailea. Areas for improvement: While the bathroom is modern, it is very cramped & needs an exhaust fan. Also, the room could use better lighting. When we pulled the curtains (for privacy) or at night, the room felt pretty dark. Lastly, while the resort is supposedly 100% smoke free, guests are allowed to smoke 20 feet from the building in the parking lot. This was disappointing as we had to walk by smokers every time we went to our car.

Reviews.Title: “Summer getaway”
Reviews.Author: MangoSlicePdx
Reviews.Content: I loved the value for what we got. I have noticed a steady increase from when we went, but it is still pretty good value. The rental bikes were a great thing for the hotel to offer, it was a joy riding to the local shops. You will want a rental car though to go to places like old Lahaina, but otherwise it was a great area to stay more "local". Heads up on the parking at the hotel - it gets packed VERY early. There are a few different doors you can go to, but there are not enough if you get stuck in the back. Make sure to go to the local restaurants and what they call the "bar" area - I dont see bar area cause its still super family friendly, BUT there are great cheaper food places. The breakfast shop off the main road (you cant miss it, it is always busy) . I ended up actually saving money when we went... HORRAY! There are 2 local Sushi places also in the Kihei area, bit pricey but amazingly good - I say well worth it! Make sure to get the flash friend macadamia nut ice cream log with caramel sauce if you come across it. (YUM! YUM!) Also for the souvenir/gift giving idea, go to the swap meet at the community college. GREAT deals, and great prices. Found the same items in Cancun and shops in Hawaii (things like carved wood turtles, etc.) with the same quality, but most everything was twice as expensive at these other place (especially in the hotel zone in Lahaina region) . Avoid the dinner boat, the pictures are misleading and it was horrible food. Beautiful views, but still not worth it. Make sure to the the road to Hana and ask about the banana bread stands. You'll wanna leave early - the road gets busy fast with tourists and the good bread will run out. The 3rd bread stand we came across is the BEST! its on a little off road. Watch out though for the locals driving on the roads. The lanes merge into 1 lane bridges and they are usually corner bridges and they are unforgiving speed demons. I will have to say I preferred driving in LA with a huge truck - these people are rude as hell and dont care if you get run off the road. Worst part it there are drop off rocky cliffs - soooo yea... teeth grinding. Snorkeling is fantastic up in Lahaina, there is this black round rock which has great snorkeling. We saw huge turtles! current is a bit strong, but the paid adventure boats drop people off right there for $80 bucks. We rented snorkel gear for $20 bucks with a purchase of a water proof camera and swam to the same spot. (Heck yes!) Any local shop will get you a map to find great spots.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: mWrite
Reviews.Content: If you are planning a beach vacation, you could consider some other hotels in Maui, as this hotel does not have own beach nor direct beach access. You have to walk some 3-400 meters and across the road to access the beach. Then to positive points. In my opinion hotel has good location, centrally at Maui for active tourist. You can easily drive to Lahaina for dining or Haleakala sunrise. From arrival point of view, airport is quite close also. Rooms are good in standard and clean. Best in the room was though balcony, after active day it was a pleasure to sit outside and have a glass of... About the staff I can not tell much, interaction was normal check-in/out formalities. Kihee itself isn't in my opinion "action" location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rkw057
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Maui Coast Hotel for almost 2 weeks, and I would recommend this hotel to anyone. The rooms were clean and modern, the beds were comfy and it was very spacious - we stayed in the one bedroom suite. The bathroom was large and very clean. The staff was helpful and friendly. The pool was private and very tropical, and most importantly, not very crowded - unlike some of the other hotels we saw that were right on the beach. The concierge, Tiffany, was very helpful and helped us book all of our excursions. Another one of the perks was the shuttle that would take you to the local restaurants and then pick you up as well. When we go back, we would absolutely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Happytravellers88
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel for a week. The location is great and so is the value. The hotel staff are accommodating and friendly. The beds are the absolutely best hotel beds that I've ever slept in. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone. Tiffiney, the concierge is very knowledgeable and will be able to help you out with any excursions that you might want to make.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed Beyond expectations”
Reviews.Author: MrsLeggett
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? Before choosing a hotel to stay in while in Maui for 7 days, I did A LOT of research, reading every review I could. I read the reviews of all the popular resort hotels and they were mostly 50/50. I ran across this hotel and found that about 90% of the reviews, especially after their renovations, had nothing but great things to say. So, since it was a lot cheaper than the resort hotels and I wanted to be centrally located, and spend most of my money on exploring what Maui had to offer I went with Maui Coast Hotel. My husband and I were both pleasantly surprised. All of the positive reviews were right on point. Kihei, where the hotel is located, isn't full of the glits and glam like the resorts but it is located in a very quiet and quaint town which we loved. The hotel itself was immaculately clean, and I am VERY germophobic. The decor of the rooms were beautifully done and the bathroom was really nice. We reserved a basic King sized room but Chris, the very friendly and awesome supervisor, whom we actually made our reservations over the phone with a month prior, upgraded us to a one-bedroom king and had wine and a little note waiting for us in the room because we were celebrating our 6th wedding anniversary. The hotel is 100% non-smoking which was an extreme plus for us and it offered a lot of free stuff; free bicycle rentals, free internet access in the hotel rooms and downstairs in the lovely open air lobby, free pool/beach towels, and free usage of the washers and dryers, which were very convenient for us. All of the staff members were awesome and very helpful. The rooms were very spacious with two lanais in the suite which included a refrigerator and microwave and two televisions. The bed wasn't as comfortable as it could have been but I slept very well every night. The hotel isn't centrally air conditioned so each room as it's own a/c which didn't bother me at all since everything was brand new. I wouldn't recommend eating in the hotel restaurant because it's pretty pricey and there are so many lovely eating places around the area. We particularly loved Stella Blues Cafe for breakfast, lunch and dinner! I can't say enough great things about this hotel but if you're the type that only wants to sit out by the pool and sun bathe and nothing else then I would suggest you stay at The Grand Wailea Hotel Resort & Spa south of Kihei in Wailea, but if you want to save some money but not sacrifice comfort and want to explore this beautiful island I would definitely suggest you stay at the Maui Coast Hotel in Kihei, Maui!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place with excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: Maverik09
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our trip to Maui and absolutely loved this hotel. The rooms were excellent, other than the bathroom being a touch on the small side, but by far not enough to drag it down. The pool area and 2 restaurants were excellent, although we never used the pool, the area looked in top shape. We were barely 200 yards from hotel to ocean and less than 1/2 mile to some very good local places to eat. All in all this stay was wonderful and I would definitely stay here again and recommend anyone else stay here. Also, forgot to mention, it was by far the most comfortable bed and pillows I've ever slept on.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel for an amazing price”
Reviews.Author: Ellestl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Maui Coast last week and we loved it. I normally don't write reviews but wanted to make sure to aknowledge the great value this hotel provides. The rooms are spacious and clean, the restaurant is great and best of all they have an awesome gym. My husband won a trip at the Fairmont Kea Lani through work and we liked staying at the Coast much better. The food prices werent too outrageous and the food was actually much better. I

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, considering it wasnt a brand name”
Reviews.Author: twinklelina78
Reviews.Content: I am a hotel snob. So when i went to maui, i wanted to stay in a branded hotel like the westin. However spending 300+ a night with taxes, considering i would only be there to "sleep" didnt justify. Hotel was close to the beach. I prefer hotels like this as opposed to one that is on the beach, they tend to end up bring more cleaner :) The hotel was clean, no smell, great bed, TV, Lovely pool with 2 hot tubs. There was live entertainment in the evenings by the pool, which was great to listen to. The down side: the hotel spices, that it is connected with, was misleading when it came to their "$5.00" breakfast 7-9am. it was only 4 dishes, and for a vegetarian that there was only oatmeal.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME HOTEL, Best hotel bed, hands down”
Reviews.Author: jtah86
Reviews.Content: Spacious room, huge (for a hotel) tv, large and STOCKED bathroom, and finally...the best bed I've had at a hotel. This hotel was $145 a night + 17.50 resort fee. I took advantage of the resort fee by using the shuttle, laundry room and internet (free wireless). This was a steal especially in the area it was in. The hotel was friendly and provided great recommendations for beaches and dining. The best decision I made was staying here

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, will definately stay again”
Reviews.Author: oilersfanAlberta
Reviews.Content: I follow trip advisor frequently when we are travelling to see different peoples take on the environment and surrounding amenities. I read may positive thoughts and everything was true. The staff were amazing- from the front desk,to the housekeeping and an extra special thanks to Tiffaney. She arranged ours tours and suggested restaurants--Pizza Madness was very good---and is a wealth of information. Heather our waitress by the pool--good memory and very cheerful. We loved Kihei for our very first visit of 9 days, and will definately go back and stay at the Maui Coast again. Close to the beach, restaurants and quaint shopping spots. Nice laid back atmosphere, and centrally located for driving to other areas on the island. Places we liked to eat-Peggy Sue's, Kihei Caffe for breakfast (tons of food). Note Sansei Sushi has 1/2 price specials (eg-Sun and Mon between 5-6:00pm any orders place in this time is 1/2 price. ) Very good and other 1/2 price times available for later in the day.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: tigerxen
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here through a WestJet Vacations package and were very pleased with the hotel in all respects. The front desk folks were very helpful, welcoming and courteous, and all the staff were wonderful to us. Tiffany Weller, the lead concierge for Expedia at the hotel, was tremendously helpful in booking excursions and a fantastic spa day for us, but most importantly she assisted when I urgently needed an eye physician after an accident. Tiffany called ahead and got me in to see a terrific optometrist immediately. The doctor checked me thoroughly and set my mind at ease for the rest of the trip, all thanks to Tiffany! All hotels can be great when things go well, but this showed me that the staff here will go an extra mile to take care of their guests, especially when things don't go quite as planned. :-) We met some people from Europe who stay here frequently and love the place. They described the recent renovations as lovely and all-encompassing, particularly in the pool area. We found the pool a lovely oasis and spent a day or so enjoying it. The hotel is also across the street from one of the major beaches so we spent hours enjoying the ocean without having to drive anywhere at all. The hotel staff keep the grounds and hotel very, very clean and were kind and friendly as well. Would definitely recommend this place to all!

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel in a perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: carol1947
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights, after spending 6 nights in a rather shabby room at Ohana West in Waikiki. What a contrast this was - heavenly comfortable beds; no sirens splitting the night; free self-operated laundry room; beautiful beach 5 minutes walk; bus stop 5 minutes walk (buy a day ticket for $2 & go anywhere you want); good sized pool with poolside cafe/bar; restaurant; free internet in the lobby; friendly staff; 3 small shopping centres within 10 minutes walk; free fitness centre; lots of options to dine locally. I could go on & on..... We booked through Worldwide Holidays online, & didn't have to pay the 'resort fee' of $17.50 per night, so this made our stay very moderately priced. This is VERY definitely the hotel we would stay at again, if we get as far as Hawaii again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Ninergrl5
Reviews.Content: I just recently stayed at the Maui Coast Hotel for my friend's 40th birthday. We had an amazing time at the Maui Coast Hotel. When I got back to Maui I want to bring my husband and make sure that we stay with MCH. The overall feel of MCH was peaceful, clean and relaxing. All the employees that we talked to or had questions for were so friendly and helpful. The location is perfect! You aren't right on the beach, but you are just a few minute walk away. The restaurant Spices...Loved it! Very good food and service. MCH is wonderful! I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “awesome,clean ,great location,no worries,”
Reviews.Author: DANIONE
Reviews.Content: Very freindly staff. stayed in a 1 bedroom king bed suite with sofa bed. tvs great bathroom was very roomy. The pool was nice the kids loved it. Very short walk to the beach with lifegaurds.Hotel resturants have great food. Pricey but you get alot of food. happy hour rocks.local music was great.Kids liked the fat black and white cat by the pool bar.We enjoyed our stay. I do recommend eating at BEACH BUMS.Its located by the Maui Ocean Center.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL!!!! :)”
Reviews.Author: 2Places
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay!! :) Rooms were clean and new! The staff was extremely nice and friendly!! The pool cafe had live music every night and great food! Great guest amenities - tennis, bikes, shuttle, pool, fitness center, laundry, computers w/ internet in lobby. Rooms had microwaves and fridges.Easy parking! Great location! Overall just a wonderful stay! Highly recommended! :)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Service and Hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: AuroraMooney
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 nights and enjoyed every moment while we were here. Every single employee we encountered exemplified courtesy, respect and professionalism. From the moment we arrived, to our departure, the stay was seamless. The room was appointed to perfection with the appropriate amenities, TVs were wonderful, free wi-fi was speedy and efficient, AND housekeepers were attentive, detailed and thorough. Quiet rooms, beds, linens, toiletries, soaking tub, work station and lighting were all first class. Especially appreciated were ample electrical plugs for all of the computers/phones, etc. that we brought with us. And, there are washer/dryer units for guest use! It was so nice to be able to launder our sandy beach clothes each evening. We believe this is the best value on the island!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complain about, can't go wrong.”
Reviews.Author: tickleberry
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in March 2011. Great location as it was right across street from beaches but right near a highway access road, and walking distance to lots of restaurants and shopping. Quiet. Balcony had a nice view of ocean and volcano on the top floor. Free parking was nice and usually got a spot RIGHT outside door. Pool was a little small but not overly busy (so close to beach anyway). $17.50US resort fee per night was lame. Bed was super comfortable. Microwave and mini-fridge was nice. Bathroom was very small, toilet was in the way of everything. But updated and clean otherwise. Didn't see the staff much, but when we did they were nice and friendly. And they didn't get uppity about signing out pool towels and taking them off the resort to the beach. Just a real nice solid hotel and everything about it was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic place to stay--great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: fromcanada77
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was great. I don't have one complaint after staying there 8 nights. Right from check-in to check-out the staff was courteous and helpful.The parking was free. The room was well-cleaned everyday. The beds were amazingly comfortable. From the large HD tv to the enjoyable lanai, the room setup was super comfortable. Bike rental was easy and there was always a bike free. The beach (Charley Young) was our favourite is basically right across the street. Each day we got fresh beach towels from the reception. Poolside live music seemed to be daily around 5 pm. Kihei is a quaint village/town and everything seemed relaxed yet well-run.

Reviews.Title: “this is the best place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LindaAtlanta
Reviews.Content: If you don't need a snooty hotel, this is the place for you. We stayed in the junior suite for our 2nd time - comfortable bed, soft sheets, soft towels, plenty of beach towels, free wi-fi, etc. Plus in a great location - walk to restaurants, shops & beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, comfy room, good location.”
Reviews.Author: vagabondsChicago
Reviews.Content: Really nice. Convenient to almost all. Had a car rental & did not even need one. Have bikes for use if desired. Even walked to the beach across the street that is not too busy!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good location.”
Reviews.Author: Shuk1
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for 8 nights. We enjoyed the hotel. The hotel has somewhat a resort feel, even though it is not a resort. Our room was comfortable, the bed was nice and soft, clean room. The room was attended (cleaned) every day , although the service staff did not put the "free bottles" of water as advertised, but it was not big deal.. we bought our own water anyway. We noticed the Airline crews stay in this hotel as well.. so it must be a plus too. The hotel also has an EXPEDIA specialist who are ready to book your activities in the island. The check in was nice and fast. Hotel charges the daily room fee which includes your beach towels, the room WIFI, Bike rentals, and access to the tennis court. Hotel has a small pool which adjacent to a bar. There is a live music every night. We noticed that pool gets crowded with non-guests at times, but pool "traffic" dies down to the evening hours as majority is in the bar. The Kamaole beach is across the street. The grocery store such as FOODLAND, and Walgreens type store such as ABC Store are in the walking distance. The location is in the center of KIHEI.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shadow8
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 4 nights in Oahu and 4 nights in Maui. While in Maui we stayed at the Maui Coast. This hotel is amazing!!! It was pretty much gutted a couple years ago and was totally redone. The staff was very friendly. We were upgraded from a jr suite to a one bedroom suite. The wireless internet speed wasn't real great but our rooms were a long ways from the offices. The internet always worked but it was slow at times. I'm guessing if you had a room right towards the front you'd have better reception. I was also told by other guests that the reception on the lanais was good. We will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Maui”
Reviews.Author: calgarycan
Reviews.Content: Maui Coast Hotel offers great value for Maui. We stayed there for 4 nights in February and would highly recommend it. Keep in mind that it's a hotel, not a resort so don't expect a fancy pool etc. It was clean and quite, and the staff were very accomodating. It's just a 2 minute walk to the beach and there are good restuarants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location in a clean, comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: VacationingGrammie
Reviews.Content: Well appointed hotel. Everything was clean and beds were quite comfy. Bathrooms well kept. It was nice to have a small fridge and microwave in the room. Pool area was well maintained. Quick two minute walk to the beach. Rooms were quiet -- no disturbance from other guests. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Clean, Comfortable- but not a resort”
Reviews.Author: UndrH2O
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Maui Coast hotel for two nights total, but at separate times during our trip to Maui. It was close the attractions we were going to spend time at, and we were looking for a place close to the beach to launch our adventure from. The Maui Coast Hotel was great. Very comfortable rooms, some nice amenities (including free bottles of water in your room), flat screen television, free parking, etc. There was a daily resort fee that likely covered all of these things. The resort fee seems standard on Maui. The Maui Coast hotel offers many great amenities, but I maintain it is not a resort. There is a small pool, hot tub, and poolside restaurant, but not much in terms of poolside entertainment (as you would expect to see in a resort), and it lacked a resort feel. I didn't notice that there was a spa of any sort (though I could have missed it). Stations that would have been "manned" at a resort were often empty (example: it was nearly impossible to get a towel near the pool, the station was always empty). There was a concierge, but we didn't take advantage of the service. It felt like a hotel. The public beach across the street was a great beginning to our stay in Hawaii. The hotel was within walking distance to many shops and restaurants. We felt comfortable walking at night and seeing the sights. Although we had a couple of drinks at the poolside bar, we did not go to the restaurant associated with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay if you plan to explore the island!”
Reviews.Author: quebectraveller_8
Reviews.Content: We arrived in a tropical storm with roads closed, rain and winds but after that night, nothing but sun all week! The hotel is great! Clean comfortable and service is excellent from the front desk to everyone else. Kihei is a nice city, not too pricy and has a local feel. You are very close to the beautiful city of Wailea and not toofar from Kaanapali. You have to explore the island. We rented a jeep and did not regret it. Buy the Maui Lonely Planet guide it was our bible for the week and we did not regret it. Here is my list of things not to be missed: Pipiwai Trail (Kipahulu), Wailea and the ocean beach walk trail, Ferraro's restaurant, Mulligans on the blue (Celtic Tigers Band), Kapalua area near the Ritz Carlton (beachside walk trail), Makena, Napili beach, Cafe O Lei restaurant, Lahaina, Kaanapali (Hula Grill), Maui Ocean Center, Kanaha beach near the airport (hard to find but really cool. So many others but with the Lonely planet guide you will have the rest there. So Maui Coast was perfect, don't hesitate. Best stay for the price!

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: SunderlandPgj
Reviews.Content: take no notice to any negative reviews this hotel is the tops it has the freindliest staff and a perfect location we're planning on coming back next year..........and they gave us a free upgrade to a suite i cant praise them enough

Reviews.Title: “Great place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jocelyn01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Coast Hotel in January 2011 for 2 weeks and I would truly say it was excellent , staff was very friendly and helpful. They have a shuttle service for a three mile radius of the hotel ,which came in handy at night when you went out for supper, they deliver and picked you up, as long as it's by 9pm.They also had bicycles you can take during the day for no charge. Rooms were very clean and maid service was consistent.There is a restaurant on the property I don't recommend it as it is very pricey $3 for a cup of coffee OUCH. Pool bar had live entertainment nightly bar maids were very good and friendly.Happy hour between 3pm and 6pm. take advantage of hour hour as it can get pricey.I do recommend that you download coupons for restaurants if you decide to eat out as it can reek havoc on you wallet. All sad and done I would highly recommend this hotel. If you rent a car take note parking spaces are very small even for compact cars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JoyRudolph
Reviews.Content: My family took our first trip to Hawaii last year and we stayed at the maui Coast. I was uneasy about staying at a condo due to all of the reviews I read about bugs and cleanliness. I was greatly impressed when we arrived at the hotel. Its a very georgous place and directly across the street from the best beach in Kihei. When we go again this year we will probably stay at a condo because its easier with the kids, but I highly recommend to anyone traveling to stay at the Maui Resort, I have no compalints and would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for Cost”
Reviews.Author: luv2vacation4ever
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location for getting to various locations on the island. There are many great aspects to this hotel. The most important thing to remember is that this is not a resort, this is a hotel. So, certain amenities are not available. HOTEL Hotel lobby is beautiful and open. Nicely appointed furniture, very clean, and easy to access driveway and parking. Hotel fees are $17.50 a day per room. I saw on Expedia that it said $15.00, but that's incorrect as of January 2011. Hotel Service Associates: Absolutely professional. Wonderful customer service and always friendly. Pool: Very clean. Small, but nice and usually enough chairs available. 2 spa options and 1 pool. Nice pool bar with eating tables. Bathroom was very clean. The only issue was that there were people from outside of the hotel that were allowed to use the pool because the security on the grounds doesnâ€™t have directions from management to not allow non-guests to use the pool. We saw one particular situation where a guest was upset over a non-guestâ€™s behavior. ***Be aware, not everyone at the pool and bar are paying patrons to the hotel.*** Bike Rentals: you can rent 10 speed and beach cruisers for free (this is included in the $17.50 per day).
