Rooms: Very clean. Odd numbered rooms have a great views of the mountains and the ocean. Our room had a beautiful sunrise and sunset view. We had a remodeled suit which was large, had a mini kitchenette area, 2 flat screen televisions, couch in the living room, king bed in the bedroom, and 2 sliding doors. Large bathroom with great water pressure. Bathroom has a mirror that does not fog up while taking a shower. It leaves the middle area on the mirror unfogged which was great! Bathtub side was a bit high (especially if you're short), so watch your shins. Parking: Ample parking. Well lit and safe. Cafe O'le was a great lunch spot and close to the hotel after you get off the plane and wait for your room. Maui Coffee was excellent and close to the hotel. 4 Seasons Hotel has great restaurants. Ferraro's was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, super quiet and well maintained hotel”
Reviews.Author: sreason7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 nights. Somehow, we lucked into a room on the seventh floor, which had a great view of the ocean. This is one of the quietest hotels I've ever stayed at. If you want a good night's sleep each night, this is the place to be. We stayed in a junior suite which was very spacious and nice, with a super comfortable king sized bed. Having a refrigerator and microwave in the room was great. Staff are wonderful as well. Enjoyed the free entertainment at the pool. The restaurant, Spices, is a need of a major makeover--very tired looking, but the food was fine. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Amanda253
Reviews.Content: We booked into this hotel for two nights because it was unavailable for longer. The staff were helpful and friendly, providing us with information about all the beaches and shops down the coast. After walking the beaches to â€œThe Shops at Waileaâ€�, we made use of the shuttle van service back to the hotel. The shuttle van driver (Maui born and raised) was super nice providing fun conversation and restaurant recommendations on the way back. During our short time there we made good use of the bikes, pools and especially the nearby beach. The room was modern, clean and had a microwave, fridge and coffee maker which are always handy while on vacation. The only complaint is the air conditioner, which was pretty noisy and made ear plugs a must for sleeping. Our maids could have possibly the sweetest ever and actually seemed genuinely saddened when we told them that we were heading north to Kaanapali. We can highly recommend walking a few blocks north for breakfast at the Kihei Cafe and surprisingly good coffee at Lava Java.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing”
Reviews.Author: Claribell
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Maui Coast for 4 nights in November 2010. Hotel looked like it had recently been refurbished so the decor was modern and clean. Ate on-site a couple of times and the food was plentiful and good value. Staff at this hotel are excellent, could not fault them or the hotel. Superb!

Reviews.Title: “Why a Resort Fee???Nicke and Diming the Guests!”
Reviews.Author: brodie52
Reviews.Content: The Maui Coast hotel is a nice Hotel about three city blocks inland from the beach.....At about 85 dollars a night it is a bargain...but then you discover there is a mandatory Resort Fee. Now I have seen some of the "resort hotels" they have her in Maui and by comparison the Coast is not a resort. It is a good bargain priced hotel. But the hotel insists on charging an addition 17.50 a night for the use of items hotels ordinarily include. These items include, use of the pool, pool towels, fitness centre, shuttle bus, bikes, newspapers in the lobby, internet connection in th rooms, free local calls, laundry facilities, use of tennis courts and an in room safe...The safe/newspapers in lobby,internet and pool are usually standard hotel amenities so is the fitness centre. I agree they could charge for bike rental the shuttle and parking....but really we didn't use these "resort" amenities except for parking (you need a car to get here) and neither will you. (There is a big warm ocean across the street 3 blocks away) If you want to stay at a resort stay at a real resort not a pretend resort nicle and diming the guests.....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Great location”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTraveller111
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel to anyone that doesn't want to spend 400$ plus a night to stay in a fancy resort. The Maui Coast is a great hotel, in a great location. The hotel includes free WiFi and towels and free bike rentals! The hotel is across the street from a great beach, and a short drive from wailea and makena. We booked this hotel using last minute.com and paid about 168.00 CDN a night. Great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed this time around”
Reviews.Author: midwesterner56
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed during previous stays but this time around was different. We couldn't get two beds (don't care for sofa beds), were only allowed an hour for late checkout and had to wait several times for our room to be cleaned even though we were gone for 5-7 hours at a time. Will look much harder for another place to stay in the future. They won't allow you to change the TV channel in the workout room. They hit you with a $17.50 resort fee (higher than originally agreed to). Positives: Fantastic location. Short walk to restaurants, shops and beaches. Kihei is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: BostonTarheel
Reviews.Content: Having read mixed reviews, I was somewhat anxious about what we would experience on arrival in Maui for a 40th anniversary trip. Overall, we were delighted with every aspect of our stay, from the friendly reception, well-appointed room/suite and overall state of repair of the property. The pool and whirlpool were small but adequate. The tasty and reasonably-priced breakfasts at the open-air restaurant were delightful surprise, and a great way to start each day. We noticed that local businessmen were regulars at the restaurant during the breakfast hour, which is a good indicator of excellent food, value and service, all of which we experienced. The location was within easy walking distance of a lovely beach/public park. And we were on the Kihei strip, thus within blocks of great restaurants. However, our room was away from street noise and very quiet. A nice touch was complementary champagne in our room on arrival, after letting the outstanding/ friendly front desk staff know the purpose of our trip. Given the length of our stay, we requested (and were granted) a waiver of the $15 resort fee. Overall, I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: JustynaY
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Maui Coast Hotel during December of 2009. The hotel is in a pretty good location, you can walk 5 minutes down to the beach. Everything was very clean, service was also amazing - we were provided with beach towels which was a huge help. They also provide a free wifi and there's plenty of parking on the property. It seems like the hotel was recently remodeled which gave a very fresh and neat feeling. We didn't get to use the hot tub - there seem to be a lot of people there all the time, but it seemed like it was a lot of fun. The price was definitely great for the value that we got!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Quaint”
Reviews.Author: emee39
Reviews.Content: Kihei is a nice low key hotel with comfortable beds...that's all that matters, right? The staff was friendly and helpful. It's a non-smoking hotel, but what's weird is that our room had a slight smell of smoke. Maybe it was a neighbor breaking the rules? Or just old funk that stuck to the carpet? Who knows. It didn't bother us too much anyway so we didn't complain. I liked the location because it wasn't too touristy and lots of just local eats around us. The beach across the street was great too!

Reviews.Title: “Nice amenities, nice room, close to the beach”
Reviews.Author: ventsurlonde
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in during memorial weekend as part of the vacation package. We choose this place since it was one of the lowest priced hotel in Kihei. Our first impression was the nice open air reception and the tiki torch entrance, the front desk was helpful & efficient. We stayed at a junior suit on the second floor. The room was spacious, nice modern decor & the mattress was very comfy. We saw the picture on the website and glad we went for the junior suite. I think the standard room is only half the size of the junior suite, And since I had lots of kitesurfing equipment I needed the room to place all my stuffs. The bathroom is also modern and spacious. Nice balcony for fresh air. The only downside is that the balcony overlook into the parking lot so its not very private. The hotel is across street and one door down from the beach. It was nice and convenient to go to the beach. The cleaning staffs were wonderful & friendly. I brought in lots of sand & dirty each time after a kitesurfing, and return from the beach, the cleaning staffs tirelessly cleaned up all my messes and carefully with my equipment and board. She keeps our room freshly clean everyone, which was wonderful. The Spice restaurant however wasn't that great, food were overpriced & blend. But the staff was attentive & friendly. But overall, we didn't had any amazing meal in Kihei. The pool has a nice night scene. But also quite and secluded especially in the jacuzzi area after live music hour is over. I would say this hotel is a winner, exceed my expectation in every level.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location and a friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: BigFish78
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Maui Coast Hotel for two nights in mid-December in Kihei at the start of a week long vacation to Maui. This was a very nice play to stay and had some very huge positives to it. It has an outstanding location -- nearly just across the street from the beach. Its a quick walk to the beach, or to the nearby ABC store, or a short drive to restaurants and shopping in Kihei. The hotel also had a very comfortable bed, and the poolside bar with nightly entertainment and great happy hour specials was wonderful! The staff was exceptionally friendly! Alohas from all the cleaning staff each day, and the front desk quickly attended to our requests with a smile. There were just a few negatives - the bathroom was very small. When you swing open the door, it quite literally comes to rest agains the shower and you really have to close the door if you plan to use the bathroom - not just out of privacy's sake, but really out of necessity. The other negative was the A/C unit. We kept it on full blast, and it stayed cold in the immediate vicinity of the unit, but on the other side of the room (where the bed is), the AC seemed to do almost nothing. Thankfully they had a ceiling fan too, which we ran all the time at full speed and this helped. The hotel charges a $15 a day resort fee, which does include free bike rentals. My only complaint with it was that it includes a bottle of water only on the day you arrive. I think if it were every day that would be a nice touch. It's just a bottle of water after all. All in all, this was a very nice place to stay. We enjoyed our nights there and the pool bar and great location were outstanding...and the staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Small bathroom and loud a/c, but good quality otherwise”
Reviews.Author: MaxConcrete
Reviews.Content: We had a a two-bed unit (#255). The room was small, and the bathroom was very small. In fact, there was barely enough space to get into the bathroom since it had an inward-opening door and there was just enough space for a person to stand to allow the door to close. The air conditioner in our room was very loud. Otherwise, the room was nice. It had high-quality bedding, high-quality towels, nice furniture and a flat-screen TV. I especially liked the electricity outlets at the bottom of the light units, providing plenty of outlets to recharge all electronics. The staff was friendly. The pool is basic compared to some of the larger resorts. There is a bar/cabana next to the pool. I did not go to the beach, but it is a somewhat long walk due to the length of the Maui Coast Hotel and the street crossing. The hotel is on the main Kihei strip, with plenty of restaurants and stores within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thom S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an outstanding value. Very nice accomdations and convienent location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cshager
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Coast for 3 days while waiting for the condo that we rented to have a vacancy. We decided to stay in Keihi because we wanted to experience the Keihi area. The Maui Coast was just as expected. The room was large and had nice linens, microwave, and refrigerator. We were pleasantly surprised. The only negative thing was that the balcony was super tiny and was close to a very noisey exhaust fan. Need less to say, we did not use it. The noise was loud, but we didn't hear it while the television was on, and it provided a dull white noise at night. So, if you get a regular room, don't expect much of a view or relaxation on the balcony. The pool area was very nice with a good size pool, two hot tubs, and a pool bar with music at night. We enjoyed the area mostly evenings with a happy hour coctail. We used the bikes once. They are nice Trek bikes, but some could use some maintenance. So, choose carefully. There really aren't that many places to ride because of hills and congestion, but we took them for a ride south. Most people used them to go to the store. We are breakfast twice at the hotel restaurant. They had a $5 special with several choices. It was fine. The coffe was SUPER! We would return again for a short visit, but this area is not our favorite. However it is less expensive than most areason Maui. Yes, there is a $15 daily resort fee that is annoying!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: bubbajoel26
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great close to the beach across the street and just down the street from some good dinner and breakfast spots. Warning DO NOT eat at the Spices Grill on the property, had too be the worst service I have ever had anywere, tried it twice and both times we were very disapointed.

Reviews.Title: “We had no complaints, everyone that worked there were so helpful”
Reviews.Author: Hylandpyne
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Hawaii and couldn't of been better. I almost hate to tell anyone how great it was as now they will want to stay at the Maui Coast Hotel. Everyone that worked there were so helpful, couldn't of asked for more!! Close to groccery stores, restrauants and best of all close to the Kamoale Beach. The weather was perfect everyday and the trip around the island which left at 7 in the morning and took all day was well worth the money. The driver was very informative about the history of the island. That winding road to Hana was the best trip with all the waterfalls and awesome scenery of the coast. The stop to the Seven Sacred Pools is a must stop. Take a dip in the warm waters and jump off the cliffs. We stopped at the Hana ranch for lunch, was most welcoming. I loved it all. To finish it off we stopped at the Winery for a wine tasting, could of stayed there longer. That was the only thing that I would of liked to have a longer stay there to check out the surroundings. Maui is so diverse, so by taking a tour of the island is a must do. Next time I would rent a car and do it all over again and maybe stay at one of the B&B's for a night. I felt so safe in the area that I stayed, much more so than Mexico. The beaches are cleaner and no hassels from Vendors anywhere. The walkway in Wailea was beautiful but I wouldn't want to stay there. I'm sure it is nice but too touristy for me. The Wailea Mall is a great shopping place. The ladies in Chico's and Blue gGnger are so helpful but not pushy

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Kihei!”
Reviews.Author: lrhodes907
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at the Maui Coast for our honeymoon. We were more than pleased with our stay! The hotel is in a great location, has a great pool w/ two hot tubs and poolside bar, and the most comfortable beds! We stayed in the Deluxe room which was sufficient for us. We got plenty of towels whenever needed and you can even get towels for the pool or beach from the front desk. Just make sure to return them or they will charge you. The location is in walking distance to beaches, restaurants and shops, however we did have a rental. Yes the parking spaces were small but that seems to be the rule and not the exception on the island, so consider it good practice! :) We spent most of the time out on the island but when we were at the hotel, we were by the pool. They have happy hour drink specials everyday between 3-6 and live entertainment each night by the pool from 6-9. We ate at Spices twice, the onsite restaurant, once for breakfast and again for dessert. When we went there for dessert, it took 20 minutes which was unexpected since they weren't really busy and my husband's Creme Brulee was like soup. They did take it off our bill but we felt we were being ignored when we were ready to pay, had to wait 5 minutes when our server was in plain site standing in the entrance to the kitchen. Breakfast was fine and the food from Tradewinds(poolside bar) was pretty good, which also comes from Spices. It's possible they were just having an off night?? Definitely check out Cafe O Lei, Stella Blues and Fred's Mexican Cafe. We also had an amazing dinner at Humu Humu in the Grand Wailea resort, which I would totally recommend but make a reservation! They had a pre-fixe menu for $39 which was a great deal for a fancier restaurant and it was very romantic!!! All in all, the hotel was great! The staff was friendly, accomodating and full of smiles. We would totally recommend this hotel to everyone and would love to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: zuzana74
Reviews.Content: Maui Coast Hotel is a really lovely place to stay. We spent our honeymoon there, suite was very spacious, we had the most amazing and comfortable bed, great room service, incredible friendly and helpful staff. The only downside is that if you want to overlap your stay for few hours because your flight time, you have to pay almost full day charge. So its best you have your flight in the morning unless you dont mind paying extra or staying outdoors for the day like us. But overall its a really great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Kihei”
Reviews.Author: Copperdesk63
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for the price in Kihei. If you don't want to stay at a condo they have great prices with a wonderful pool, good outside bar and nice gym facility. They also have a very clean rooms. I would suggest you go up to the suite for the best value. I also want to mention the two best people I met on Maui. Manny and David made us feel great from the first time we walked through the door and they deserve five stars all by themselves.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: KoiLady
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome!! There were 4 of us staying at the hotel, we had 2 junior suites and they were beautiful. Big compfy king size bed, big room, quiet, clean, new...everything was good. I didn't have a problem walking across the street to the beach. Most of the resorts we stay at in Mexico are huge and you have a longer walk to the beach even though it's beach front. It was a little annoying to go next door to use the pool but we went everyday and didn't find it overly noisy with kids. We found chairs without any problem. Our pool was finished the day we left (Oct 26) and it was fantastic!! Looked really nice, loved having a bar available. You'll be happy at this hotel, it's very nice and i'd stay there again...and again. Just make sure you eat at the 808 Bistro for dinner...it is FANTASTIC!!! We went scuba diving with the Scuba Shack which was also very good! Oh...and we flew with WestJet and our package paid the $15 fee, so we didn't have that. Plus we had an SUV and never had a problem parking or any damage to the truck...was nice to have free parking. In Oahu, we paid $18 a day at our hotel, sure adds up!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, with a few caveats”
Reviews.Author: Twiggy1954
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the reasonable prices, reviews on Trip Advisor, and location. Since the prices were reasonable (for Maui), we opted for a two room suite, which was quite comfortable. All of the positive things we read about the hotel were true--there is a fine beach across the street, for example, and the hotel restaurant was pretty good. There are washing machines available on some floors. The concierge was helpful, although you may get slightly better prices if you do your own research and book your own activities, getting your advice from other people. We would definitely stay here again, but there are a few things you should know. First, individual room air conditioners really struggle to keep up with the humidity and heat during the day. If you envision taking an afternoon nap when the sun is at its peak, you may have trouble with how warm and humid your room is. If you only plan to be in your room in the mornings and at night, you probably will be just fine. Second, the hotel pool was being repaired and the alternative solution provided was to use the World Mark pool next door. The World Mark is a timeshare and was really crowded. We checked a couple of times and there was no way I would have gotten in that pool with all the children splashing, yelling, and doing all the other yucky stuff kids do. It would have been nice for the hotel to offer some type of financial compensation, but they did not respond to my request that they do so. The Maui Coast pool should be fixed by the onset of winter crowds, but you might want to call for a status report or timeline before you book. Third, there is a resort fee added to your bill, so look at your room rate and then figure on paying about $15 more per room. Theoretically, the fee covers the cost of providing free shuttle service to nearby locations, bicycles and tennis raquets that you can borrow, pool towels, etc.. We did not use these services, but still found the hotel price to be reasonable enough even counting the fee. Finally, I want to weigh in on comments others have made about the parking lot being hazardous for your rental car. Some of the spaces are smaller than others. If you want to protect your car or have a big SUV or something, just pick one of the larger spaces. You might have to walk an extra 100 feet, but it's worth it if you worry about stuff like that.

Reviews.Title: “Felt very at home and great stay for a smaller hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spinellz55
Reviews.Content: My cousin was getting married at the Grand Wailea and it was only a 7 minute drive down the road. Local eats was walking distance; the hotel restaurant Spices was convenient for dinner when we checked in at 10:30pm when everything else was practically closed for the night. It's also great for the first morning breakfast when you just want to eat and not think about anything else yet. Walked across the street or down the block to lay on the beach if we didn't want to drive; hotel gave us free towels at the front desk. Hotel staff was wonderful, professional and kind. Pool is currently under construction but the hotel next door allows guests to use. We didn't need the pool anyway at anytime during our stay. Internet kiosks are available for free down at the lobby. Parking is free - you just have to give the license plate number to the front desk. However, it isn't as big and the spaces between are tight.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Breitling_2010
Reviews.Content: Good hotel and the stay was excellent. The room was clean and the staff were great. The only thing was that the pool and hottub were closed. Another pool was available at the Wyndham hotel next door, but they could have advised me before I arrived. The other thing is free internet would be preferable.

Reviews.Title: “Maui 2010”
Reviews.Author: wampumvt
Reviews.Content: We spent our first week in Maui here and would return. Check in was a breeze, the room excellent, beds very comfy, plenty of linens. The pool and hot tub were spotless, there was pool side entertainment at night along with a bar and restaurant. We were able to book all of our tours on sight, they were very helpful with the planning of our 2 weeks there. Highly recommend, but do shop around for the price, I found this place for $109.00 a night when most travel sights were charging a lot more, including the hotel site.

Reviews.Title: “Greatly exceeded our expectations and would be excited to stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: nancyhardagain
Reviews.Content: After all of the book reviews we had read about the Maui Coast being just average we were a little apprehensive to stay there. We ended up being absolutely blown away. The rooms we had were spacious, very nice, and had great views. The staff was very helpful and went out of their way to accomodate us. They have a convenient van service that will drive you to and from restaurants or shopping within the local area. You can also check out bikes to take out and explore, exercise, or grab something to eat. Overall, we had a great stay and would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location for Kihei”
Reviews.Author: outof714
Reviews.Content: Stayed with wife and 2 year old for 2 nights before heading up to Kaanapali. We wanted to stay in South Maui for a couple days. Hotel is clean and rooms are modern. We had a Junior Suite and it gave us a ton of room for a famiily of 3. Kamaole Beach 1 is just across the street and the gift shop even rented great chairs for 2.50 a day! We had some good meals at Kihei Caffe, Da Kitchen and a decent Burger and Poke at Oceans Bar. Lots of markets and shopping around the area with quick access to Wailea and Makena for the more higher end spectrum. Great AAA rate so check that out when booking. Pool was under renovation when we stayed so can't comment. We had breakfast at Spices one day which was really nice and resonable.

Reviews.Title: “THE ONLY HOTEL TO STAY IN KIHEI”
Reviews.Author: HOTELLMEMORE
Reviews.Content: I am a repeat guest of the Maui Coast Hotel where I have been staying four times during the last ten years. I appreciated its South Maui almost ocean front location, reasonable rates and comfortable rooms. Check-in at 10 PM was quick, polite and even efficient as I got the type of room I booked for : a non-smoking quiet high floor unit. I particularly appreciated the deep renovation process the property has been undergoing since it was somewhat needed in this high turnover hotel. However the daily USD15 mandatory resort fee they charge is EXTORSION !!! The font desk try to justify this levy by granting free access to the pool, tennis courts, parking lots and daily newspapers... only readable in the lobby. Will the next fee be a free use of your already paid guestroom bed? Beside this the hotel rates we got were reasonable compared to neighboring Wailea properties. I will probably stay here again when I come back to South KIHEI.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Great Value, Great Staff...”
Reviews.Author: Gem_81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Coast for our first 2 nights in Maui. We booked this hotel as it was great value for Maui (I looked around a lot and this was by far the best price in the area) and we had a 'luxury' hotel booked for the rest of our stay. When we arrived I can truly say I was not excepting such a great hotel. Check in was easy and our room on the 5th floor was huge with a separate living and sleeping area along with a modern clean bathroom. The pool was pretty small but definitely big enough for the amount of people that used it (getting a sun lounger wasn't a problem) the pool bar was great (only used it for drinks before we headed out for the evening but it was a good vibe) the gym was a good size and breakfast at the Spices restaurant at the hotel was decent. The hotel isn't directly on the beach but it is over the road which is very easy to cross (there is a crossing right outside the hotel) this really wasn't a problem for us and the beach was great. If you are going to Maui but don't want to pay over the top resort costs I would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value-Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: AAMEL
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel where we could be comfortable and a place our two adult children and their families (4 children between the ages of 6 and 11) would also enjoy. The Maui Coast was perfect. Our Deluxe Room had two queens beds and a sofa, plus a lanai. The families each had a Junior Suite with the same bed configurations, but more space in the sleeping area and bathroom. All the rooms seemed new and were very clean. The rate quoted does not include a $15/day activities fee, but we booked a package through Delta Vacations and it was included in that price. There is a fee for internet access in your room, but there are 3 free terminals in the lobby area. You can print your boarding passes for free. The lobby and pool area was great. Although the hotel was full and there were lots of children, it was very quiet. The Spices Restaurant on site was great for breakfast and lunch. The location offers easy access to other parts of the island and is only one block from a terrific beach. Restaurants are within walking distance too. If we ever went back to Maui, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: aloha35
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Maui Coast after getting bumped off our flight. Its not really close to airport, but we wanted to be near the beach as long as we were stuck. Turns out, this place is great! Half the price of the Sheraton we had just spent the past 4 days at, and the room was way nicer! Everything has been redone, new everything. The TV was huge! Short walk to beach. We never got to use the bikes, but I thought that was cool. Pool was crowded with kids, but nice. Nice pool bar with live music and a great happy hour. Walking distance to ABC and restaurants/bars/beach rental supplies. Loved the smells they pumped in. Staff was nice, friendly - again even better than the Sheraton on Kaanapali. I was very impressed - great property!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: rongvang
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, friendly staff...Room is very quiet at night. We get in trouble with the reservation (the booking company went bankruptcy), the staff at the hotel help us settle down with a discount rate and help us with the refund from the booking company. We would return to this hotel if we come back to Kihei...

Reviews.Title: “Found this awesome little hotel, thanks trip advisor!”
Reviews.Author: kwippy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a friend's wedding and I really enjoyed my time here. The staff was attentive and helped with storing my friend's wedding leis since they didn't fit in my mini-fridge. The hotel gym was very well equipped and the pool area was very nice. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: NZerin
Reviews.Content: Was extremely impressed with this well-priced hotel. Other say it was too far from the beach, which I don't understand. The beach is down the driveway and across the street. Fine by me. Really great pool area, great food and excellent service. They accidentally put us in a double room, but as soon as I told them, they sorted it out straight away and got us in a twin room. Very happy and would definitely return. The only reason I put 4 stars for the room is that the air con was really loud.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK, could improve on service”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel610
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for value and location. We like that it is close to the beach, shops and restaurants. The parking is tight, we were afraid our rental car would be scratched. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The hotel is not oceanfront so we did not get a view of the ocean. And the bathroom is small. Once you open the door, there is not enough room to get to the tub and toilet. Laundry is complimentary and they provide detergent for .75. I was not too impressed with the service. If you call the front desk/operator, the phone would ring for a long time. Also, I requested for utensils (plate, spoon and knife) so I can eat the fruit I bought. I was told I had to make a purchase at the restaurant. I think they should have gone the extra mile and provided me with these.

Reviews.Title: “Great times at the Coast hotel”
Reviews.Author: frankderf
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at this hotel in June of 2010. It was a great location, across from the beach and very close to many places to have fun. Leave the hotel on it's free to use bikes and explore the area. Make a right and about a mile away are some great bars and food venues. I would stay here every time I visited Maui,

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: nicknlinds
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Coast Hotel for our honeymoon in mid July. This place looked like the nicest place in the immediate area. The hotel was very clean and well maintained. It was pretty obvious that the hotel had recently been renovated. The bed was very comfortable. We had a small outdoor space that had a partial view of the ocean when you looked out and to the side. The service was great. Everyone was very friendly. We were provided a complimentary bottle of wine for our honeymoon. The only downside for us was the location. It was an ok location, but not the best. We felt like we were a southern California beach town. We were able to easily walk across the street and to the beach in just a couple minutes. Overall, we liked the hotel and would stay there again. The price can't be beat for what we got. May comparable places we looked at were in the $300s+ a night. Those locations may be better, but not the hotels themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Kihei”
Reviews.Author: mr_and_mrs_a_73
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon from July 5 to 12. We booked directly through Coast and got a good rate (with one night for free) into a standard room (we told them it was our honeymoon when booking) and got upgraded to a one bedroom suite. The suite was really nice - completely renovated - and had a wet bar and mini fridge in the living room area. The living had a flat screen TV as well as the bedroom. The bed was comfortable and the air conditioning worked great in both the bedroom and the living room. The patio was a bit small, but had two chairs and a table on it - we could see the ocean when looking over one side of the patio, but it generally wasn't an ocean view. The service at the front desk was great - they were friendly and helpful. There is a $15 per day resort fee (they mention this when you book), which covers things like the gym, the pool, the beach towels, parking, a shuttle (within 3 miles of the resort), etc. There are three computers in the lobby that you can use for free (good for checking e-mails and printing off flight confirmations), but you have to pay for Wifi in the room ($10 per day). The pool area is really nice and has two hot tubs and a kiddie pool area attached to the main pool. There were a lot of lounge chairs and umbrellas whenever we went to the pool, but this was July so there might be more of an issue with this during the winter months. There is a pool bar that has happy hour from 3 pm - 6 pm everyday and live music from 6 pm to 9 pm every night. There is a restaurant, Spices, on the property. We did not eat there after reading the reviews and only saw a few people in there on any given night. This hotel is well-located in Kihei, with the Kamaole I beach just across the street. The property isn't beach front, but it's a less than 5 minute walk to the beach. There are restaurants and shops within 5 - 10 minute walk in both directions. Kihei has a Southern California beach town feel to it, but it's definitely not the same resort vibe as Wailea or Kaanapali, but it's nice for the budget conscious traveler. All the major attractions on the Island are easily accessible from this location.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent find”
Reviews.Author: bkk_kd
Reviews.Content: This review is of a stay almost a year ago. Nevertheless, my wife and I feel that this hotel deserves a nod. I spent hours searching for an affordable, safe and comfortable hotel near Wailea. The Maui Coast offered a room and car deal that suited us. I wouldn't say we had low expectations, but we realized we weren't going to be staying in a Wailea resort either. The hotel exceeded our expectations in every respect: the room was large, clean and modern and the location was just a few minutes drive to Wailea. My wife was so pleased that she even took photos of the room. It was like we were staying in a 4-star hotel at a 3-star price. Service was friendly but, after all, it was to be expected since we were in Hawaii. The hotel has a laundry room, which came in handy. We were running around the island so much, that we didn't have a chance to dine at the hotel. But with all of the choices on offer on the island, for us there was no reason to eat at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good deal in Maui”
Reviews.Author: hardinmj
Reviews.Content: We got a vacation package direct from the hotel website that include the room, rental car, and daily breakfast. It was a pretty good deal, considering Maui is a more expensive island to stay on. We would have liked a room with a king size bed since we were there for our anniversary but all that was left was double beds. The view from most of the rooms is unimpressive! The staff was just okay. They forgot to give me my breakfast vouchers so I had to ask and it was as if they didnt want to give them to me. The hotel and pool were very nice. We had a nice waitress at the poolside bar. Short walk to a great Kihei beach. Hands down the best sunsets I've ever seen happen on Maui! I'd stay there again because the property was nice..but I might look elsewhere for more charming staff.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: ryan120
Reviews.Content: We were only going to be in Kihei for a few days and didn't want to bother with a condo, so we looked for a hotel. This really exceeded our expectations. Great location, very good value, comfortable and contemporary rooms. We arrived early, way before check in time started, but called to see if a room was available for early check in and it was. We got to the hotel and instantly noticed the nice landscaping and well-maintained grounds. Parking was easy - anywhere you like! Front desk reception was instant and we were off to our room. The room felt nice and recently updated. There was a nice big flat screen TV, wifi, super comfortable bed, mini fridge, and microwave. The only minor downside to our room was that the bathroom was a little small and made for getting ready at the same time not possible. The pool area is nice and there is a little bar there for our mai tai fix. The hotel is in a very convenient location across from Kamaole I beach. PLUS, there's an ABC Store just across the street! We never ate at the onsite restaurant, Spices, because there are so many great local restaurants in Kihei.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice hotel for the budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: FlipperGirl
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for two nights on a business related trip. I also stayed here about 4 years ago or so. "Budget traveller" conjures up images of people who will forgo many ammenities and ignore the negatives b/c they know they are getting a good deal for thie money. However, it's almost unfair to use the word "budget" in the title of this review because for a nice and NON-chain resort hotel, they do it pretty well! Perhaps on the "negative" -- It's not ON a beach (across from Kamaole Beach I), the parking lot is pretty darn tight, the bathroom is pretty tight, the closet is small....but if you're the kind of traveller that isn't looking to stay in your hotel room (which its not bad, just maybe smallish) and you will be out exploring the Island all day and need to save money, consider this place. The staff were all very friendly, check-in always goes smoothly. The main entrance is even set up with an open-air style Hawaiian hotel lobby. Furnishings and flooring make you feel like you are in one of the pricier Wailea resorts as you first arrive. They even have laundry facilities on site. The pool is decent, nice people at the bar attached, too. They have bands for happy hour. You are not a long walk to other shopping, restaurants, etc. in the tourist-y Kihei area (but I still like it here for deals). Bottom-line: I would recommend for 5 nights or less. Anything more, I would get cramped sharing hotel room with someone or kids. That's when I prefer condos on Maui to a hotel stay (more than 5 nights) as to me that becomes a better deal but it's hard to beat the deal you can have here and not feel cheated. But that's me, plenty of people stay here longer and enjoy it, considering what you're getting for the price (AND not getting nickeled and dimed like other resort hotels). Other notes: -I'm "bed picky" -- had a King and it was awesome -- very comfortable place to put your head every night (great, soft bed, nice pillows, clean bedding) - small fridge, small microwave, coffee pot, desk, little couch and coffee table, dresser, small closet, very small bathroom with the one i had -No real views to get excited about -- view of parking lot on North side, view of greener grounds on the other (backside of other condos) -Clean and looks updated (decent carpet, clean, updated furniture) -UPdated flat panel TV -Quiet enough

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but Kihei itself is trashy”
Reviews.Author: MikeSF
Reviews.Content: As a hotel, it's pretty good. The rooms are nice, with comfy beds, big HD TV, and nice bathrooms. The parking is easy and the resort fee ($15) is pretty reasonable. The gym is really nice, free business center/internet access, the pool is only OK (it's kind of small and it's essentially in the parking lot). The only problem is the location. It's not on the beach and Kihei itself is like a trashy Southern California beach town complete with overpriced chain restaurants and strip malls. If that's your thing, it's a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LVuitton09
Reviews.Content: The rooms look just like the pictures on the website.and are spacious and clean. The bathroom was large with a lot of counter space. The microwave and mini fridge came in very handy and was a welcome surprise. The staff was friendly and I would stay here again. I live on Oahu and this hotel far exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel - 100% satisfied!!”
Reviews.Author: Connie010
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very convenient - right across from a beautiful beach and not too crowded. It's somewhat centered on the island so going to/from the airport, Wailea Beach is super easy. There are also lots of food options around the hotel from cheap eats to pricey fine dine options. From the hotel to West Maui (Lahaina, Kapalua, Kaanapali) is also not bad as it's located in the center of the island. The hotel is super clean and rooms/hallways have new decor. There is a $15 charge per night on top of package price but it's worth it - you can get unlimited towels for the beach, free parking, bikes (very nice neighborhood to ride in) and maid service. Alot of condos/hotels on the island does not have maid service everyday. There is also a microwave and fridge in the room, which was helpful whenever we had leftovers. The staff were really helpful - we asked for extras like plastic utensils, plates, cream. The bed was very comfy. Again, cleaniness was my top priority requirements and I was 100% satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Coast Hotel a mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: bduby
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Maui Coast Hotel was a mixed bag. Our suite was quite nice and I was pleasantly surprised. Unfortunately, since my spouse is handicapped, the bathroom was a disappointment. The supposedly ADA compliant bathroom was not. Everytime we took a shower the floor would flood. The shower curtain was placed too high and did not meet the floor and could not be adjusted, therefore a flood. I was told that most hotels are like that in their experience. I guess they haven't had the opportunity to go around the corner to Wailea and check out the Fairmont Hotel's handicapped bathrooms - wonderful. Not to mention any Embassy Suite properties which do a great job. I could list several other hotels that get it right. Customer Service was great at times and then really bad sometimes. Although I would not discourage anyone else from staying there, we will not return. The $15.00 resort fee would be OK if this really was a resort type hotel with those type of amenities. We never used the internet (have the iPhone), plus the internet stations were for those who could stand, again not ADA compliant. Also, our room was on the 3rd floor - hello??? What would you do if the elevator broke down or could not be used during a fire. Also, we were told that if we used the sofa bed they only push it back in when you check out. I had to request it be pushed back in when we used it. On a positive note, we did receive an early check in and late check out as our flight was delayed, though I had to get to get pushy for the late check out with the manager no less!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value......”
Reviews.Author: pawp11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 10 days and 10 nights. We had booked thru Expedia, an excellent deal. Worked out to about 130 bucks a night for a Junior Suite. Can't beat that. The room was sufficiently large. King size bed, sofa, tv, desk, large closet, small in-room safe. Lanai was small but adequate for two people. View from the lanai was decent, one direction partial ocean over the buildings and the mountain in the other direction. Wonderful! Bathroom was pretty large. Tub was extremely tall, not for anyone with leg issues. DH had a difficult time getting in and out. Staff was extremely helpful. Room was always clean. They always obeyed the Do Not Disturb sign. Pool area was small but we thoroughly enjoyed the hottub when there weren't a bunch of kids out there. :) Tradewinds is the bar. Drinks were good. Happy hour was a decent deal. Service was hit and miss. Ariel was extremely pleasant. Heather was a bit excitable. Avoid the food if you can. It was lousy. Live entertainment, same thing, some times fabulous, some nights just okay. Very enjoyable though. My only complaint about the hotel is the parking. We were in the back of the hotel, so we used the side entrance the most. As previously mentioned hubby has mobility issues, all the handicap spots were at the front of the building. None at the side entrance. Some evenings, he would have to get out and I would go park and then walk back by myself. The hotel golf cart was even parked in one of the spaces each night. I thought that was a bit annoying. Two handicap spots near the side entrance would make this a perfect hotel for us. We were celebrating an anniversary, the hotel gave us a decent bottle of champagne. Nice surprise! As others have mentioned, there is a mandatory $15 a day resort fee, not included in the booking price. Allows for bicycle use, beach towels, etc. But the bicycles are 20" bikes, way too tall for most normal people. Tennis court seems a waste of space but who knows. Some women I overheard were going to use it as a place to lay out in the sun without the wind bothering them. 3 computers in the lobby for free use, wifi available at an additional cost. I would stay here again. Gladly. Can I go tomorrow? :D

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for the price”
Reviews.Author: nuggetboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and i had a 5 night stay at the MC at the end of April. Due to flight delays we got in very late (11:15 PM) but were greeted with a warm welcome at the desk. They gave us our room key and we headed out to the room -335, We pulled our car around the side and brought our luggage in on the second floor. We got off the third floor and found our room to be the first room off the elevator. Given that the wife and I are light sleepers we didn't even bother to go into the room. We left our luggage by the elevator and I headed down to the desk. The changed our room very quickly to one further down the hall (I should have said something when i checked in). That was the only problem we had during our stay. the room was very clean, though the bathroom was small. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. To access the beach you had to go across the street and about 50 yards down. Not a problem. The beach was nice but we used the hotel more as a central area for our travels (Big beach,Central and Western Maui). The pool area was small but very well maintained. The pool was part of a bar area. They had a great happy hour every afternoon and entertainment each night., The entertainment varied, sometimes great sometimes only fair. We did enjoy it though. As I said the staff was very accommodating. They offered many great suggestions regarding restaurants and tours. They also rented out umbrellas and beach chairs for use . The beach chairs were only $2.50 per day. They came in handy on our trips to Napili Bay and Big Beach. They also gave guests free use of a number of bicycles during tehri stay. We never used them but they would be handy if you did not have a rental car. One thing I really liked about the hotel was the business center. They had three computers just off the lobby for free usage. They were placed in areas that you had to stand at to use, thus no kids playing video games or facebook addicts. I had no trouble getting on line to check weather or tours. We found it to be an excellent off beach property and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great price great value”
Reviews.Author: mem1962
Reviews.Content: What a gorgeous place to stay .Looks new bed was comfortable everything was a class operation.Many thanks to them we stayed there 5 days awesomw

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste time looking for another hotel, this is THE place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: chillicothe
Reviews.Content: Found this place on the internet and trusted a couple of reviews, having never been to Kihei, Hi. This hotel is in a great location, very clean, quiet, has a great pool, restaurant and bar, amazingly comfortable beds, great shower, free shuttle and the nicest staff you can imagine. We felt like we hit the jackpot! STAY HERE, you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jkdk214
Reviews.Content: This was my husband and my first time to Maui. The hotel was very clean with friendly staff. the Gym was very good, but after a work out its daunting to walk across the parking lot to get to our room all sweaty. the restaurant "spices" had good food once it got to you. one night i was very cold and they wouldn't let us sit inside the said it was closed, but as more people can for dinner they were seating people indoors. so lets just say service was not great but if you can tolerate that the food was very good the both times we ate there. i think the location was wonderful! if was so close to the beach with out being on the beach. Kolmoli 1 beach is one of the nicest, which was just across the street. The room was clean although they seem to get less attended to, the longer we stayed. we were there for 16 nights. And we are the type that tip every day for the maid. my husband and i are really tidy. but there was 7 days that we left a pile of sand that had fallen off my beach to see how long it would take for them to vac it up. after 7 days i just brushed it off from being tired of looking at it. the bathroom was always spotless after cleaning which was wonderful. the resort fee is really a joke. we did use the towels but $15 for the use of bikes, tennis courts and laundry if you don;t use them is really a farss. it should be optional or just increase the flat rate. overall i would stay hear again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Resort ~ Resort Fee Charges”
Reviews.Author: MKtravelers19
Reviews.Content: We booked a room about 6 months prior to our stay. Got a great AARP rate. The room was nicely decorated/updated. Bath really small....old motel style. And the lani was such a disappointment. Yikes....nothing like going to Maui and can't sit on the deck. They implemented the $15 resort fee after we booked so the front desk woman said it didn't apply to us. Ok, Great. But when we went to check out the guy tried to stick it to us. We didn't budge and he didn't charge us. I hate resort fees. I thought they were a thing of the past. We never stay at one if they have one. Just raise the room fee. Really....you are going to charge us for a towel at the pool. So much for the Aloha Spirit!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Krobminneapolis
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a queen suite and it was absolutely perfect for us! The rooms were clean and spacious. The staff was very friendly. We rented mopeds and had a blast. We spent $40/couple for 3 hours and drove them to some of the local beaches. It was very scenic and we got lots of great pictures. I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone. It is reasonable and across the street from some nice beaches. We ate at the hotel and it was a little pricey, but the food was really good. The desserts were some of the best I have ever tasted. The happy hour by the pool was also a good deal. The only negative thing I can say is some random people who had been surfing came and jumped into the hot tub. It would be nice if it were a little more secure, but the people who jumped in were nice and shared with us their tips for the road to Hana so it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Coast - An Updated Gem”
Reviews.Author: Wavie_Davie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Coast for 6 nights based on reviews from this site. Great location for Kihei. Right on the 'border' of Wailea. That's good to know since Kihei is long - North Kihei is 10 minutes away. Hotel is across from the beach (there are many public beaches). Anyway, the reviews are accurate. Nice place. The hotel was recently refurbished and you can tell. Everything looks and feels new. We stayed in a two queen room. The beds were fantastic, new flatscreen TVs, updated granite bathrooms and lots of sitting area. Our room was a long way from the lobby, but that wasn't much of a concern. The parking (free) was at least close. Pool was not large, but adequate space. Great sun in the morning until 2. The 2 hot tubs give you some privacy options. Open air bar is right next to the pool, with full food service, happy hour and nightly bands until 9pm. Gym is brand new with 6-7 aerobic machines. It is tucked away and somewhat isolated - I of course felt safe, but it was one of the things my wife mentioned - she would not feel safe in there alone. There is a restaurant on site, but we didn't partake. Hotel front desk staff were great and friendly (especially Edwin), but the cleaning and pool bar staff were more just about getting the job done. Great value, but I don't think it will stay that way for long. Nicest place in Kihei really. There is a $15 daily 'resort fee' that you won't find out about until you check out. I had heard about it on here though. ABC store on the corner for all your supplies. Hit the Safeway shopping area off the highway if you need lots of items or are quite cost conscious. The Kihei Cafe down the road is stellar for breakfast. Cuatro is probably the best restaurant in town and you can eat higher end, well presented food for around $100 a couple. The Wailea Shops have great eating places too. Tommy Bahamas was a pleasant surprise. All in all, we loved our stay at the Maui Coast.

Reviews.Title: “Almost...Maui Coast”
Reviews.Author: NatureCat
Reviews.Content: We chose the Maui Coast Hotel to be close to Kalama Park for the Whale Festival. It served its purpose for our trip. The hotel is very clean and the room was fresh and decorated nicely. We reserved a Garden View, but received a room on the ground level in the back with a tiny lanai and a view of a 6 foot untrimmed hedge. Kind of a disappointment compared to other Garden View rooms on Maui. The rate was comparable to a popular resort we frequent in the Kaâ€™anapali area, but the quality of the hotel, amenities and service was less at the Maui Coast. When we reserved the room, the hotel had not implemented the $15 resort fee. We specifically asked when we called to make the reservation whether there was a resort fee. But when the fee showed up on the bill, I questioned why and the answer was, â€œWe just started implementing the resort fee.â€� They should have waived the fee because of the timing of the reservation. But no such luck. The pool is small and you have to walk through the main entrance of the hotel and across the covered driveway to access it. The parking spaces are small too. We had to back the car out of the space to open the door most of the time. However, we were pleased that we could come & go without worrying about tipping a valet each time. The hotel restaurant and fitness center is detached from the main building and past the pool area. Kind of a strange design, but might have been pieced together after the fact, due to limited space. Kihei is a very bustling area that reminded us of Southern California. It did not have the Hawaiian feel as much as West and East Maui do. To access the beaches from the hotel, you have to walk across South Kihei Road, which can be very busy. However, I should note that Kalama Beach is a good area to watch whales during the season. Although our experience was average, we might choose to stay here again if the Maui Coast offered an exceptional rate. But the price we paid was not equivalent to the quality or location when compared to other resorts on Maui. However, if you need to stay in South Maui, this is probably one of the more updated, yet economical options.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Stormin10
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay, employees are amazing they would do anything for you. Not happy about there 15 dollar extra charge over the room charge. Spices restaurant on the premises should be shut down. Not very good at all. There are many great places to eat around the Coast. Beaches are beautiful. Loved the location quit centered for the area. We would have loved to have a room with a view of the ocean, but I don't think any of there rooms have a view of much. Ours looked over the parking lot. Over all it was clean, friendly and we felt very safe. Thank you to all employee's at the Maui Coast for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Watch it. . .”
Reviews.Author: Darnoc
Reviews.Content: I hate surprises. Especially when they are sneaky charges. We checked in to the Maui Coast on a rate of $161 only to find tucked into the welcome package a note indicating a "mandatory" $15 per night resort fee to cover a long list including pool towels, parking, etc, etc. All these are things I would expect from a mid-range hotel. In my opinion, it is just a way to increase the rate without advertising it. We checked out next day, on principle. By the way, no WiFi in the rooms, slow sink and a noisy AC unit completed the picture. On the positive side it was a nice, clean spacious room, great grounds, lovely lobby friendly check-in. I'd not recommend it simply because of the duplicitous charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PEA214
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location is great, beach is just across the street, free beach towel. close to shopping center and restaurants; comfortable bed ; great swimming pool and hot tub; free parking, however, the parking spot is a little small Cons: we had a breakfast in the restaurant. It took more than half an hours to get what we wanted. The waitress was not very patient. That's the only thing I don't like this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: kimtravelsSC
Reviews.Content: My mother & I spent two weeks at the Maui Coast & I would reccomend this hotel to anyone! We just loved it! It is certainly a nice place but the staff is what makes it so special. Take time to say hello & get to know them.They will go out of their way to help you & make sure you have everything you want or need. I can't say enough good things about them! The hotel is very nice,centrally located & a great price. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “3 star or better hotel....two star price”
Reviews.Author: 1969usmc1988
Reviews.Content: The wife and I picked this hotel becuase we figured it was out of the way from most of the touristy spots and were were mostly correct. Anywhere you go on any island pretty much you are still going to bump into them so one just has to accept it. We rented a Harley for the two days and there seemed to be no bad attitude toward "scooter trash" even after rollin in and out like thunder morning and night. The restaurant had reasonably good food and was surprisingly low priced for the quality. The Pool deck had a fairly decent local style night scene that we enjoyable. The band wasn't headline material for sure but everyone was having a great time. The hotel staff assisted us with all transportation requirements and the local shuttle they offered (Kihei area only) was very help full. No charge required for that but we of course tipped nicely. The hotel is not that close to shopping areas but if your in for a brisk walk up Khiei Rd you can get there. There would be a view of the beach except for the housing across the road. That wasn't a big downer for us being that we basically live on the beach on Oahu but it might be a turn off for some.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Service, Four Star Rooms, Three Star Prices”
Reviews.Author: travelmikeVancouver
Reviews.Content: Let's get the negatives out of the way first. It's not on the beach. It's not in the loveliest part of Maui (Kihei in general is looking pretty old). The restaurant needs a complete overhaul. So, why stay here at all? Because you will not receive finer service anywhere. The staff, from front desk to housekeeping to the shuttle drivers, are all simply wonderful. Your room will be short on luxury but very long on comfort. Our one bedroom suite had a fabulous king bed as well as a sofabed in the living room area, and had 2 plasma TV's. I believe most rooms come with a mini fridge, microwave and coffeemaker. The room was kept spotless by our kind and lovely housekeeper, who always asked what time she should service the room. I locked myself out of the room one day with no ID etc. One of the desk clerks actually delivered a new room key to me where I was sitting by the pool. Now that is service!!! We liked the complimentary shuttle, which will take you 3 miles in either direction. To the north you'll find plenty of strip malls with grocery stores and casual eateries. To the south you can get a ride to Wailea, full of gorgeous resorts, restaurants and a shopping mall. Also complimentary are bikes and use of 3 computers in the lobby. The pool is okay, nothing fancy but attractive enough and we could usually find a vacant chaise. We did not care for the adjoining bar or the restaurant. Breakfast is fine, but we were served a couple of inedible lunches and decided to skip it for the remainder of our 2 week stay. We also liked that we could walk to a great beach in about 5 minutes, and 2 more great beaches were beyond that. There re plenty of small sandwich joints across from all the beaches, so having a picnic on the beach is no problem. We'd highly recommend this place overall. If you are coming to Kihei for any length of time, you may want to consider renting a beachfront condo with a kitchen. If you're going for business, or for a short stay to check out this side of Maui, you couldn't do any better. MAHALO to all staff who went out of their way to make our stay pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ronald100
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very centrally located in Maui, esp. if you want to drive up Haleakala volcano for hiking or do the Road to Hana round trip (which is possible again, even with a non 4wd) or want to be near Big and Little Beach and if you have already seen the Lahaina area. We were upgraded to a nice 2 room suite when we arrived. Room had great facilities, 2 flatscreens (?) and a nice lanai. Reception at check in was very friendly. Right in the middle of Kihei, so plenty of restaurants nearby. Would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but beware of extra charges”
Reviews.Author: Kielyjw
Reviews.Content: Like many people, we decided on this hotel based on location and reviews from Tripadvisor. The place looks great and staff were okay. Upon check in we were advised there was an extra $15 payable per day - for hotel facilities - pool towels, internet etc. We weren't aware of this charge prior to checking in. The internet we were 'paying' for wasn't working all the time. Those are really the only negatives. We were given a room on the top floor and it was absolutely fabulous - newly renovated with a bathroom you could throw a party in. I know when on holidays, you really only use your room to sleep, but at the end of a fabulously tirig day exploring, it's lovely to come back to a beautiful room with quality bed & linens. Kiehi is a nice, quiet, central location and we would recommend staying here. Drive a short distance to Makena - gorgeous beaches nicer than that in front of the hotel, and worth spending time at. If you do have a car, select your hotel car park wisely, as many are incredibly narrow.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in a Quiet Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Crimson667
Reviews.Content: The town of Kihei on the island of Maui doesn't boast a bustling nightlife, world-class shopping, or 5-star restaurants. For those features, the towns of Lahaina, Ka'anapali, or Wailea may be more appropriate. What Kihei DOES offer is a dose of the easy, relaxed, local atmosphere. Amid a string of vacation properties and timeshares, the Maui Coast Hotel bridges the gap between mainland amenities and island basics. Concierge service provides travelers with information and reservations for most popular sightseeing activities. The on-site gift store provides some basic amenities such as snacks and drinks, as well as souvenirs and Hawai'ian apparel (what trip to Hawai'i is complete without your own aloha shirt or dress?). The hotel offers shuttle service to nearby attractions. The property has an on-site restaurant, Spices, serving breakfast, lunch, dinner, and late-night munchies. At the outdoor pool is the Tradewinds bar, also serving from the same menu as Spices. Alongside the pool is a one-foot-deep kiddie pool, as well as two heated jacuzzis. The fitness centers are on the second level of the restaurant building. One smaller room is located immediately at the stairway and consists of some basic cardio machines, a resistance machine, and a rack of free weights. Next to it, behind the double-frosted-glass doors, is a much larger and extensive fitness center that rivals many commercial gyms. The larger room boasts a wide range of cardio and resistance machines, as well as a larger rack of free weights. Three computers reside in this room in addition to the three in the main lobby by the elevators. Beaches and other restaurants are within walking distance of the hotel. Maui Coast Hotel provides all of the amenities that mainlanders may be accustomed to, within the more relaxed confines and back-to-basics lifestyle of Kihei.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: robbiek777
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the reviews provided on trip advisor as well as their website. Website stated that every room was completely renovate. This was not the case, our bathroom was old and had black mold. The staff, though friendly were not helpful and not interested in solving problems (like the broken airconditioner). The list goes on. Basically it's way overpriced for a 3.5 start hotel and I should have cared more about the hotel rating than the reviews on trip advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: mrdrinkle
Reviews.Content: I got a good deal to stay at the Maui Coast and based on the reviews this place wasn't too bad. When we got there the room of our hotel was a little damp. One phone call to the front desk and upgraded us to a larger room for free. That made moving all the bags to another place more bearable. The location wasn't perfect, but if you rented a car it should be no problem. Front desk was very friendly, and there is complementary towel rentals when you go out to the beaches. GREAT! The rooms are clean and neat and I didn't have any noise issues. Don't eat at the restaurant... it's no good, but down the road cafe o' lei serves really tasty foods

Reviews.Title: “Better than advertised”
Reviews.Author: tietack
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 3 days in one of their 1br suites - cheaper than the lowest rate for an interior room at any of the chichi resorts. They said that their suites no longer had ocean views, because of neighboring construction. Well, they were too modest - I'd call the view out of our suite a 75% ocean view room. The beds were amazing! Well, they actually felt better than our temperpedic. The location was convenient - a short walk to Kam 2 beach, where we saw some marvelous sunsets - and whales in the distance. It was just as close to good inexpensive food options such as "Da Kitchen" and 808 Deli. The pool was comfortable, the two hot tubs provided options. They're next to a cool outdoor bar with decent food. We sat in the hot tub in the evenings and listened to their live music (every night). (Hopefully) when we return to Maui, this hotel will retain its price advantage over other resorts. If they do, we might just book our whole stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: TravelJunkyGirl88
Reviews.Content: The hotel looked very nice, had an outdoor pool and bar area with a separate outdoor restaurant. There were 3 computers in the lobby with free internet, if you wanted wireless in your room it was at a charge...I believe through AT&T. The rooms were clean with modern furniture. The hotel restaurant was great for lunch, they had specials and a nice atmosphere. We went once for dinner and had an awful experience, very pricey and slow service, so it seems like it is hit or miss. The location was a little out of the way of most destinations. We drove at least 30 minutes to get to any of our activities. There was a decent beach across the street though which was nice for something close. I recommend this hotel for anyone who is looking for a nice place to stay for a cheap cost that doesn't mind driving a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds, close to beach”
Reviews.Author: chidlebyte
Reviews.Content: I had a stomach flu for a couple of days when I arrived in Maui, and was grateful for how comfortable the room was. Service was good and one room service meal was prompt and tasty, However, I do have one negative comment, the room had a very odd smell - I think it was to do with the air conditioner leaking water as the carpet was almost always wet below it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and clean”
Reviews.Author: AAAAAnna
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location, the room was clean the staff helpful. We got this hotel from trip advisor and we were very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: TexansOnTheGo17
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this hotel. It was quiet, clean and the staff was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: lipoahawaii
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Maui Coast at Kihei and found the hotel to be more than adequate. I think they just renovated the place, and the standard rooms were spacious, and comes with microwave and ref. Staff were friendly. I don't recommend eating at the cafe by the pool. For wireless internet inside the room you need to pay $9/day but there are 3 terminals outside by the lobby that you can surf the internet for free. However, if you need to print something you need to pay a minimal fee per page.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: arualpalm
Reviews.Content: Wonderful value - we have paid 2-3 times as much at higher-end resorts and walked away (drastically) less satisfied. Rooms were quiet, clean, and modern; our room was outside of the elevator, and we never heard a peep. We appreciated the fridge/microwave but never had the chance to use it; did not use restaurants/room service/fitness area either. Front desk was genuinely friendly and helpful. We stayed Christmas week, and even though they were booked, they permitted us to have a bit of a late check-out. Pool water was a bit cool/crisp, but it would be a waste to have a pool heater due to Maui's warm temperatures. Pool and hot tubs were very clean. Enjoyed the music in the pool areas in the evenings. Liked the hotel's proximity to the beaches and the rest of the island. Definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “the suite was lovely”
Reviews.Author: tripmyworld
Reviews.Content: We found Maui Coast Hotel a very modern, spacious, clean and comfortable hotel. Our friends booked the deluxe room and we booked the suite (as we needed a big room for us and the kids). both the deluxe room and the suite were lovely. We booked them through Easy click web site and indeed it was easy and quick :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: mauionmymind08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two short nights to meet with our wedding planner and check out wedding venues the year before our wedding. For any airline employees, they offer a fantastic airline discount! The rooms were very nice, and we had one with a large oceanview lanai. The pool was great, the restaurant in front of the hotel was very good with great prices. It's just a short walk to the beach and to restaurants and shopping in Kihei. We prefer to stay on the beach, but for a quick, last minute trip, it's a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Gnarly Dude”
Reviews.Author: KenVicLee
Reviews.Content: I had read the positive reviews about this property before we arrived but I was still plesantly surprised with how nice a facility this was for the price. In fairness I don't know the price because we won a Maui trip in a charity auction and this hotel was one of two hotels that were part of the package. But I am guessing that given the time of year the price would have been in the $150/night range. A great value at that price. A great value because we had a fifth floor suite with partial ocean, partial mountain views, a deck overlooking those views, a nice pool area adjacent to a small restaurant and clean grounds. The only thing I could find fault with was the parking. The slots were too narrow and the spots available in short supply. We were anonymously dinged in the back fender and no one reported it. That was a little frustrating. The location, however, was fantastic if you want to try a less expensive way to enjoy Maui. The Maui Coast sits across the street from the beach. Within walking distance is everything from an ABC store for basic supplies to a number of eateries (The Sports Page, Fred's Mexican, Moose McGillycuddys, Cafe O'Lei). On-site is Spices which provides breakfast, lunch, dinner and nightly entertainment at the pool. The staff was efficient and attentive. The housekeeping staff was exceptional. The rooms spacious with flat screen TV's. Overall a better experience than I could have expected.

Reviews.Title: “Small-scaled luxury in a laid-back way”
Reviews.Author: tifa2276
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Coast hotel in Kihei for a few nights before ending our trip in West Maui. We wanted to stay in Kihei because it was more convenient to attractions such as Haleakala crater, and driving the Road to Hana. We found a good deal through expedia for the Maui Coast. It was a recently remodeled hotel, and we like the laid-back vibe it gave off. Upon arrival, we were surprised at how spacious the lobby is. Check in was quick, and we were surprised to learn that the hotel is at 100% capacity. The front desk guy told us they were fully booked for 4 months. Not bad for a terrible economiy. I think the fact that they recently remodeled and had great rates definitely helped. Kihei is a town mainly consisting of condos and rentals so it's hard to find a nice newish 3.5 star hotel. You'd probably have to head south to posh Wailea for that. Our room was on the ground floor, and although the front desk person apologized as that was the only room they had left, we didn't mind at all. Save us from take the stairs/elevators anyways. It was convenient to walk to the room right from the lobby so we took our luggage ourselves. The room is a standard king room, small but nicely appointed bathroom, flat screen tv, microwave, fridge, coffeemaker and sofa. The bed is super comfy too! Loved it! Everything was renovated, and looked clean and new. The lobby area has a gift/sundries store and 3 internet machines which was great. The hotel also offers free washer/dryers for laundry! They are located on every other floor i.e. floors 2, 4, 6. They were small, only about 1-2 machines each floor, and you have to pay for detergent etc. but it was extremely convenient! Although we didn't spend much time at the hotel, we really enjoyed our stay there. We did the Road to Hana one day, and Haleakala Crater/Upcountry another, so we were out most of the time, but we did find it nice to come back to the comfy bed and cool a/c. The pool area is small, but it was relaxing to spend time there after getting gritty at the beaches. Kihei is a great place to visit. Loved the surfer vibe, and the restaurants in the area are delicious and inexpensive. It's convenient to supermarkets, abc stores, drug stores, etc. I highly recommened the Maui Coast hotel if you plan on staying in Kihei and don't want a condo. It is just a short drive to some of the nicest beaches on the island, and if you want to feel more upscale, just drive to the Shops at Wailea which is a high-end mall near the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value”
Reviews.Author: mikrodon
Reviews.Content: Hotel is spotlessly clean. Staff is warm and genuinely friendly. No plastic people here. Renovation has turned this place into 5 star quality, with a 3 star price. Bed is VERY comfortable. Furnishings are quietly sophisticated and top quality. Beach is across the street, downtown Kihei is about a mile north. Excellent choice for our 22nd anniversary, as we wanted comfort and relaxation in our hotel, as opposed to glitz, glamour, and noise. Best of all, this hotel has never been smoked in!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, we wanted to take it with us!”
Reviews.Author: MLKen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in October (24-31), and we hated to leave. The hotel was much larger than we expected and loved everything about it. We had no problems what-so-ever.
