I had to ask for help with the in-room safe, as apparently I'd not used the code I thought and immediately someone came to clear it so we could use it again. The renovations that I understand happened recently were well done. I particularly liked the faucet in the bathroom sink (crazy, but I stuggled with some others as we continued along on our trip.) The pool area was just lovely. We ended up sitting there more then orignally anticipated and it was well used. They had a wonder grill/drink area and everything was excellent that was served. The location across the street from the Kam I beach....okay, so it was a very short walk to the light to cross over to the beach area......it just was perfect. They had three computers for guests to use which I found to be great to make some reservations and check flights. Our next hotel had one computer and charged by the minute. We missed this hotel when we went to our next two islands and only wished the Maui Coast could have come along with us!

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the rough!”
Reviews.Author: traveler11161
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an incredible value for what you get. The pool was beautiful, the restaurant had great food, the service was attentive and everything was meticulously clean. I would go back in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean hotel, close to the beach”
Reviews.Author: marjonijntje
Reviews.Content: Frontdesk: very friendly. We arrived early and could go to our room straight away.Very helpfull staff. Free parking. Rooms: spacious, decor has outdated color (beige). There is a fridge and microwafe in the room. Spacious bathroom. Big balcony. When your room is close to the ac unit it's not possible to sit outside, very noisy! TV is oppposite the couch, so you cannot watch tv very well from your bed. Romm has both an ac and a fan above the bed. There are 3 computers near the lobby you can use free of charge. You cannot sit using the computer, you have to stand. Inroom wifi costs 10 dollar p/n. Shops and restaurants are nearby, we didn't dine at the Spices restaurant that is part of the hotel. The swimmingpool isn't bad but chairs and tables by the poolbar are outdated. Poolbar closes at 10PM. Beach is nearby, beachtowels are provided by the hotel, free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Centrally Located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LovesActivities
Reviews.Content: Great hotel located centrally on the island of Maui. We spent most of our time exploring the island, so the hotel was perfect. Clean and comfortable with everything we needed. If you are looking for a more resort-style hotel with lots of shopping and restaurants, etc within walking distance I would recommend you look at hotels in the Lahaina area.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!!”
Reviews.Author: rainbowcr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui coast for 14 days and would definately go back. Very clean, amazing beds, free shuttle, free parking, uber helpful and friendly staff, excellent price, awesome beach is just feet away. It is really close to lots of shopping, nightly life, restaurants and everything you could ever want. I didn't go with children, but it is a great family friendly place as well as a cozy and romantic hotel. There is an Expedia rep in the lobby which makes planning your adventures super easy. We travel a lot and this by far is one of the best hotels we've been to. the pool is small and not really a place to hang if your trying to read or catch some rays, but there is always a party. Hotel restuarant was really bad, unfortunately, it is not attatched to the hotel thank God because there were lots of ants in the restaurant. The rooms were pest free!!

Reviews.Title: “Liked it”
Reviews.Author: SwissTraveller13
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in this hotel. We have booked a junior suite, but were upgraded in a one bedroom suite. The room was very clean and had a good size. The staff is friendly. Parking is free. There are 3 free internet stations near to the reception desk. It seems to be an airline crew hotel since we have seen many flight attendants and pilots. The hotel is near some beaches and to many restaurants/shops. It has a nice pool area with comfortable sunbeds. There are two jaccuzzis with hot water. We have tried Spices restaurant only once. It was so so... There are better and cheaper restaurants close to the hotel. The hotel is worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: powerocker
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel , although its not on the beach the beach is right across the street. Very clean rooms, Best bed I have ever slept in at a hotel. Can't say anything negative about this hotel. Would definately stay again

Reviews.Title: “Maui Coast Hotel was everything & more I expected.”
Reviews.Author: parasols2
Reviews.Content: I am surprised this was given 3 stars. It was a very nice hotel, and that the price was extremely reasonable was a bonus. It was clean, modern, and close to the beach. The pool was really nice too. I cannot think of a bad thing to say about this hotel. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beachgirl555
Reviews.Content: We just returned from one week at the Maui Coast Hotel. It has just been refurbished and couldn't be nicer. We were automatically upgraded from a King Room to a One Bedroom King Suite. This hotel is not on the ocean but is across the street from a park located right on the beach, just a short walk. I negotiated a great price two weeks before our stay for a hotel-breakfast-car package which worked out to be very reasonable. The whole staff was very accomodating and friendly which really enhanced our stay. They have live music around the pool in the evening which is nice if there are not a lot of kids. We arrived just before the Labor Day weekend so only had to deal with it for a couple of days, then things were quiet. The beds are new and great, and the cleaning staff does an excellent job. We asked for an easy access room as I have arthritis and were given a room close to the elevators, just a short stroll to the pool. I'd skip the restaurant 'Spices' except for breakfast which was passable. There are lots of places to eat nearby, Cafe O'lei, Fred's & Sensi were all great. I'd stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Deal - Wow”
Reviews.Author: pcsanity
Reviews.Content: It is not often that I give a hotel 5 bubbles on ALL aspects of the stay. The Maui Coast Hotel lived up to this ranking and then some! We chose Kihei because we were going to be leaving on dive charters at 6 in the morning and did not want to drive all the way in from Lahaina. Wailea is nice but we were not looking for the big over priced resort experience. We were on Maui to do things not just hang out at a resort. All the recent reviews of the Maui Coast were great so we decided to go with the hotel. The hotel was running a stay 4 nights get the 5th night free promotion. Upon pulling up to the hotel, the open air lobby was beautiful and had a very welcoming feeling. We were early and our room was not yet available. They offered to hold our luggage for the hour or so till the room was ready, but we just left it in out trunk and went grocery shopping. We figured having some drinks, muffins, and munchies was a benefit since we were on Maui for 7 days. (We had already spent 4 nights on the big island) The halls in this hotel are very long but there is a mid hotel elevator so you can park on the area near your room without having to walk the distance of the hotel. There are three computers in the lobby for free guest use. In room internet has a charge, but we had our Verizon card so did not need to access their in room internet. There are guest laundry rooms on every other floor which was very nice as we needed to do mid trip laundry. Also we were able to wash clothes after diving and sightseeing. Washers and Dryers are free, just either bring your own detergent, or buy theirs. The pool area while not a resort pool is very nice. It is framed by palm trees, tiki torches at night, two hot tubs, a free form pool, and poolside bar / grill. We never had a problem finding somewhere to lounge. During the earlier part of the day the pool area can be hot without much breeze, but during the afternoons when the trade winds pick up it is wonderful. We felt hanging out at the beach in the morning when the winds were low and at the pool in the afternoon when the winds were higher were perfect. (When we were not out doing all the things that Maui has to offer.) We did not eat at the restaurant but did have a round of drinks poolside. There was live music poolside in the evening. We thought we would stop in and listen, but reality is by nightfall we were pretty tired since we were active early each day. Though the hotel does not have a direct water view (though it appears some of the higher level rooms at the front of the hotel might.) it is right across from King Kamole II Beach and just a two minute drive from King Kamole III / Kihei Boat Ramp. (Dive and fishing charters) The hotel offers free shuttle service within Kihei and Wailea, but we did not need to use it. The few nights we went out for cocktails we were able to walk easily to several restaurants. There were many good dining options for reasonable prices available in Kihei. (You can see my other reviews.) Free parking is available though many of the spots are very small but there was plenty of parking available. The front desk staff was wonderful. You check your pool towels out from them, and after a couple of visits, they get to know you. I have rave reviews for Edwin, who was working during the day each day. I lost my room key several times and also requested pool towels each day. After the first couple of visits to the front desk he knew our room number and names. He also had a wonderful bubbly personality that really added a glow to the hotel. As for the room it was great. We booked a standard king room, but were upgraded to a Junior Suite as this was an anniversary trip. The standard rooms also seemed very nice. The larger room adds a sitting area, and bigger bathroom, about 150 SF. The descriptions of the rooms online are spot on, no exaggerations. Nice balcony with two chairs. We were on the 4th floor, and though our balcony faced the parking lot the trees and vegetation made it a pleasant view. Never any noise from the parking lot. The hotel had one of the most comfortable beds of any hotel I have stayed in. The refrigerator, wet bar, and microwave were great to have. The bathroom was well designed, spacious, had a large soaking tub / shower combo. Also a neat feature that I had not seen before, there was some kind of defogging heater in the mirror that kept the back lit and center portions of the mirror heated so they did not fog. Too Cool! Bathroom was well stocked with toiletries and blow dryer. Room had a nice iron, plenty of plugs, and a nice work desk and plenty of closet and drawer space. The only thing that would be nice to see in the room â€“ a swivel on the TV â€“ it was a bit hard to watch from the bed, but easy to watch from the couch. (Also you could not watch TV and work at the desk.) This is a very minor nit picky itemâ€¦..nothing major! The curtains do an excellent job of blocking out all the light. The AC worked well and had the ability to keep the blower motor on for white noise. There was a ceiling fan over the bed. Rooms were quiet. Housekeeping did a wonderful job of keeping the rooms clean. It seemed that no matter what time of day you walked the halls there were always housekeepers around. Any time you called and asked for the staff to clean your room at a certain time, it seemed to be promptly taken care of. A+ Maui Coast Hotel â€“ We will be back someday! Thanks Edwin for a great job. The hotel had the feel of a small resort and though the grounds were not at lush as our stay at the Sheraton on Kaanapali, the room and facilities had it all over the Sheraton for alot less money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect gem!”
Reviews.Author: misscarioca
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week for 3 days. I really loved this hotel. First, the rooms were newly redone. Second, it was really clean and quiet. THE BED was the best bed I've ever slept on - seriously! Even though in Hawaii you'd love an ocean view (which I got at another hotel later), the mountain view room was just fine with me! It was close to everything, a 2 min drive to Wailea beaches, and laundry on floors 2,4, and 6 were great! We actually really missed this hotel when we got to the Sheraton. We loved the Sheraton too but they have totally different vibes and this was really low-key and not bombarded by other guests. Do yourself a favor, save a lot of money and stay here!

Reviews.Title: “How I got free Internet”
Reviews.Author: CentralCalifornia09
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great but I was amazed they charged $10 per day for Internet. I asked at the front desk and they said I could find a better rate through Wayport, and he gave me the card to call. I promptly signed up for their $19.99 plan, agreeding to a cancelation fee of $20 when I terminated the contract early. The day after I had a brain lightbulb...the Wayport Company goes though AT&T, which is my DSL provider at home. I called Wayport, got all my money back and they helped me log on in my room, for free.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Bed”
Reviews.Author: GuamGal671
Reviews.Content: It was my first time going to the island of Maui and I was meeting up with my Fiance who was in Maui for business. However, the hotel that he was staying in had a lot of bad reviews (the Seaside Hotel). So, I came across the Maui Coast Hotel and there were tons of awesome reviews. I booked a room for three days and it was a decision that I didn't regret. Their rooms were attractive, clean, and comfortable. Our king sized bed was extremely comfortable, we didn't ever want to get out of it. The choice of bed sheets and comforter was extremly high quality. Plus, there were plenty of pillows on the bed, which made us feel like we were royalty. A good nights sleep is really important to me, since I have a hard time falling asleep. I would definitely give their beds an A+. The bathroom was really nice. The television was a fairly large flat screen and it swivels, too. On future trips to Maui, I will definitely choose this hotel, again! Also, I will recommend this hotel to all of my friends and family that wish to visit Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: rbnetus
Reviews.Content: It may not have been in the trendy Ka'anapali or Wailea areas, but I Kihei worked for me. The hotel was great. Nice big room on the 5th floor (could see a sliver of the ocean). The room was clean and was very relaxing. Hotel had the added benefit of laundry services (on every other floor), so we were able to get our clothes clean instead of coming back to a bunch of laundry work. Hotel had live music every night near the pool, but I couldn't take advantage of it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice non-resort hotel exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Curlywillow
Reviews.Content: ABOUT ME AND MY SITUATION My wife and I are childless professionals in our early 30s. We have taken week-long vacations at moderate to luxurious accomodations each year for about the past five years. Our stay at the Maui Coast Hotel was a replacement for a return trip to the Fiestamericana in Puerto Vallarta that got cancelled because of Swine Flu hysteria. The Fiestamericana has a private beach, each room has a view of the ocean, and there is a moderately priced restaurant serving delicious food on the premises. The Maui Coast Hotel has none of these amenities, yet I was not disappointed during my 9 night stay there. Here is why: LOCATION: Kihei is maybe not the nicest part of Maui, but it does have a lot going on. You can't swing a dead cat without hitting 3 souvenier shops, 2 surf/snorkel rental places, and an activity booking outfit. It's crowded, but this makes it easy to find things to do. You could probably walk to most of these places, but it's hot enough (in the summer) that you won't want to. Kamaole Beach I is a 5 minute walk from the hotel. It's better for swimming and sunbathing than snorkeling or surfing, but it's pretty nice and it has the shower/foot wash station. During my stay, I discovered this made a trip to the beach a lot more enjoyable. PROPERTY The hotel is situated on a long, narrow lot. Even though it's on a busy street, the hotel is on the furthest part from it, so road noise was not an issue. It was hard to tell what it was between. I guessed condos, but the important thing was that it didn't bother us. Parking is free and plentiful. I don't know if this is the case at most hotels in Maui, but I appreciated the savings. $15-$20 a night x 9 nights would have really added up. We stayed on the "garden side" (facing south) of the property. I was disappointed to get a room on the first floor, but hey, no waiting for elevators. The north side faces the parking lot, and that would have been a lot less attractive, especially on the first two floors where headlights would shine in your room. I advise inquiring about this when booking the room. We met a couple who were on the seventh floor, and they said they couldn't really see the ocean from there, either. Every morning, the cooing of masses of pigeons is noticable at sunrise, but it's likely that you'll be waking up early anyway if you're coming from the mainland. Also, turning on the fan in the room drowns out this noise. That was the noisiest thing I noticed during my stay. ROOM My wife described the room as spacious. I wouldn't go quite that far, but aside from the bathroom, it felt more than adequate. Like probably everything in Kihei in July, it got muggy in a hurry, but the air conditioner cooled it down quickly. It was nice to not have to leave it running while I was gone (even if it wasn't my power bill.) Our king bed was very comfortable. The 37" flatscreen was nice. We liked the seating area and the table. The balcony was kind of small, but we only used it for drying wet things. I made the mistake of eating a pastry on it and half a dozen chicken-like birds immediately came from out of nowhere and pecked up all the crumbs, then returned every morning expecting more. I appreciated the mini-fridge (sort of big, as those things go). We didn't use the microwave, but it was nice knowing we could have. The only thing I would have wanted to be different was the size of the bathroom. It was too small for two people to stand in front of the mirror, and the door would catch the bathmat or the cord to the hairdrier. Also, it didn't have a fan, but the bathroom is a very minor complaint. Finally, it was hard to tell if the hotel was not very full or just really quiet, but we rarely heard people in any other rooms (doors, pipes, etc.) POOL Upon seeing it, my first thought was, "This is it?" It was comparable to a pool in a large apartment complex. However, the pool ended up being my favorite thing about the hotel. It certainly didn't take much effort to swim across it, and there wasn't very much shade from about 10:00 AM to 3:00 PM, but we were always able to find a lounge chair. It is surrounded by palms and other tropical landscaping, so you really feel like you are on vacation. All kinds of people went to the pool (couples, singles, foreigners, people on business, families, teens, and unattended kids - more on that later) so there is something for everyone and no one group dominates. There was a jacuzzi adjacent to the pool and another one in a more secluded area. There was a bar that was part of the Spices restaurant that would sell you drinks, but the service to come around and bring it to you was infrequent and slow. The best part of the pool was at night when live music would perform from 6-9 and the tiki torches were lit. They were well-rehearsed lounge acts, and it was pleasant to float in the pool and listen to it. I got the sense that people from nearby accomodations came to this hotel for the pool scene (it was easy just to walk up to.) I didn't always want to leave at 10PM when it closed down and I certainly didn't appreciate parents dumping their kids there while they went and drank at the bar, but this was in infrequent occurrence. RESTAURANTS The Spices restaurant occupies the "frontage" of the property near the road. It is separate from the hotel, as they will tell you when you ask to charge something to your room and they have to call the hotel. I only had a few drinks from the bar (expensive outside of the 4-6 happy hour) and breakfast there once. The food was good, but entrees for dinner seemed to be in the $20-$30 range. This is probably because there are numerous less expensive (though hardly inexpensive) options nearby, so Spices is where you go if you want nice ambience. As far as other restaurants go, my personal favorite was Maui Taco, about a mile south of the hotel. It combined the best of Mexican and Hawaiian cuisine into an unlikely but delicious combination. I initially avoided the Moose McGillicuddy's / Fred's restaurant (also to the south) because it seemed a little too "TGI Friday's packed with tourists" and to a certain extent that was true. I doubt locals eat there, but I'm not sure why that matters, actually. The food was good and reasonably priced (even more so with BOGO coupons) and if you sit upstairs you have a good view of the beach. OTHER The staff was friendly and seemed to like their jobs. Edwin, the desk clerk, was adorable and reminded me of "Mango," the Chris Kattan character from SNL. We didn't really require anything from them so there wasn't much opportunity to review them further. My wife described the housekeeping as "inconsistent." Sometimes our room was cleaned by 9:00 AM, other times, it still wasn't when we came back at 11:30 AM. Soap and Q-tips (important if you swim in the breakers where it's sandy) were not always replenished as quickly as we would have liked, and they gave up on placing the accent blanket on the bed after the second day, but the important things were always clean. The hotel had tennis courts, which we intended to use, but 88 degrees of humid weather made us change our mind. There were two free computers in the lobby that were occupied 90% of the time, but it looked as if they were installing 4 more stations while we were there. It looked as if there were Trek mountain bikes for rent, too. I cycle 80-100 miles a week at home and was eager to try this on Maui, but after reading about the biking scene there, I talked myself out of it and don't regret it. It's a shame, because Kihei and the South Maui coast is flat and everything is close together, so a bike would be ideal, but the roads are filled with gawking tourists driving unfamilar rental cars, and motor scooters use the bike lanes that didn't seem to be quite as continuous as one would have liked. Biking would have been a hot, dangerous experience. Besides, they were pretty cheap Treks (as would be expected.) I would definitely stay here again, and hope to do so in the winter months when it isn't quite so hot and I'm not missing the best weather of the year back home.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever stayed at!!!!”
Reviews.Author: loansmaxjuan
Reviews.Content: First let me start by saying that i did not experience any of the negative things that other reviews mentioned. This hotel was just renovated. i called in advance to let them know i would be staying there for my honeymoon and without telling me they upgraded me from a Jr suite to a suite and had a bottle of champagne in the room waiting for us. the room was so clean 2 flat screen TV's. Although they do not advertise having ocean views. the room we got had a beautiful partial ocean view. my first morning waking up i was amazed to see the ocean without even having to get out of my bed. (we were on the 6th floor) We stayed for 6 nights and enjoyed every one. the day we checked out we had a late flight out .. so they offered to let me stay an extra 2 hours for no extra cost..and they even offered to have the bellman take my wife and i to the shops a few miles away. This was money well spent.. the only negative thngs i could think of is one no one helped us with our bags when we arrived...and two the pool is a little small...but who needs a pool when you have a beach less than 5 minute walk from the hotel. well worth the money i spent..i would definetely stay here again..and would reccomend it to everyone..if youre thinking of staying there i say just go for it....you wont regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: leelow13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Coast Hotel from June 29th to July 4th and we're very pleased with our stay. We got an awesome rate at $115 a night with AAA. The hotel has been recently remodeled and the front desk staff was very helpful. Make sure you go to the gift shop in the lobby and rent beach chairs! We unfortunately only found this the last day. We personally loved Kihel...its more of a local's place and a lot less touristy and resorty. The hotel was great for what we needed which was a place to sleep and a pool. I loved the wadding pool because I could lay in the pool and read. I think I liked least was the bar at the pool and the bar staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel depending on what you are looking for...”
Reviews.Author: Bwinn
Reviews.Content: Great price, great service, wonderful rooms. Free internet service station in lobby, free washer driers on each floor. Recently remodeled, so everything was new and tastefull. We were allowed to check in several hours early. Check in took about one minute. Drawbacks are location and exterior. Make sure that Kihei is where you want to stay when going to Maui, as this area is probably one of the least resort like parts of Maui. Lots of bars and lower end shopping with nice parks, but few beaches. Exterior of the hotel is well groomed, and has tennis courts, a decent pool, kiddie pool, and hot tub. That being said the exterior pales in comparison to most of the resorts along the main beach portions of the island. The drinks and food at the outiside bar were so/so, the singer the night we went to the poolside bar was so bad it was amusing. Several of the prior reviews complained about the rooms being noisy, however, our stay was peacefully quiet. Basically, if you have a few extra days to explore the more remote parts of the island, this hotel makes a great base to come back to in the evening. If you are looking for a beach resort to relax for a week or two, this isn't it.

Reviews.Title: “A huge disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: Paul_&_Sanderella
Reviews.Content: The reception we got from Rudy the front desk supervisor was awfull. He made us wait for a long time, because they had a double reservation. We were given a room where you could not sit on the balcony because of the noise from their laundrette. The pool area is tiny and offers no shade. No hospitality room to take a shower when you have a late flight: you may use the cold shower at the pool and carry your wet clothes with you or pay US$ 120 when you want to stay in your room a couple of hours longer than checkout time. We found this hotel definitely not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms - great value!”
Reviews.Author: mat3333
Reviews.Content: Only Complain: The beds were very soft. The rest was just perfect. We booked the cheapest rate and got a huge room with a big and modern bath room and a nice balcony. On request we got a room with two queen beds. In the lobby there are two Internet computers to use free of charge. Staff is very friendly. Kihei was the perfect town and the Maui Coast Hotel the best place for us during our short (three day) trip to Maui without a very big budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: tarah22
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great to stay at! The rooms are so much nicer now and the staff was very friendly! Its within walking distances of many places to eat and a market place. The beach is right across the street. We would definitely stay here again! No complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jubileeendeavour
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a friend for 7 days at the end of May - can't speak highly enough of this hotel - staff friendly and helpful - rooms large and comfortable - beds super comfortable once you managed to get in them hee hee - being only little could have done with a step ladder (smile) . This hotel is central to all of Maui we were carless but didn't have a problem getting round the island - the lady in the little shop and the lady on the activity desk were both very helpful and friendly . This was my second visit to this hotel and I would not hesitate to stay here again or to recommend friends to stay. The pool area was being renovated while we were there but we had the use of the pool next door which was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “A centrally-located, clean and quiet hotel for the budget-minded traveler.”
Reviews.Author: doublerose
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights in one of their newly renovated rooms. We booked a standard room and thought it was quite roomy. The room had a comfortable king size bed (along with a sofa with pull-out bed which we didn't use) and large flat screen TV and a lanai. The design of the room was not Hawaiian-style but we didn't mind. The bathroom was small. The pool was a good size since it was not busy at all. The hot tub could be a little bigger. Even though the hotel was being renovated, the noise level was minimal. This hotel is within walking distance to shopping, food and beaches. Parking was plentiful and best of all, FREE (unlike many hotels/resorts in Maui). The main thing I would have to complain about is housekeeping. Housekeeping was either slow at their jobs or understaffed as there were times when we were out of our room until 4-5 in the afternoon but our room had not been cleaned yet. One time, we had our "Do Not Disturb" sign out and housekeeping tried to get in anyways. Another time, housekeeping wanted to clean the room and we told her we were getting ready to leave in the next hour and she said " Can you guys leave in 30 minutes?" I haven't had any problems like this with other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Maui Coast Hotel....newly renovated rooms are fantastic”
Reviews.Author: DAVIDJORGE
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights and have nothing but good things to say about the hotel. First off, the staff are all very friendly and accommodating. We had room 631 which had been totally renovated. The room was spotless and the decor was modern and tranquil, kind of spa like. The bathroom was huge and the wetbar with fridge was great for keeping our drinks cold. The lanai had a view of the ocean as well as the mountain. Loved listening to the birds singing every morning before heading down for a sunrise swim at the beach. Kamaole Beach I is conveniently located across the street and down about a block. Great for swimming and sunset watching. Tons of restaurants and stores around. Location of hotel is ideal. Did not eat at the restaurant, so I will not be able to comment on it. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone who wants a very nice hotel at a reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great for off-seaon”
Reviews.Author: susykat
Reviews.Content: Was here in October and got a room as a walk-in for $119. I was very pleased with the rate and the hotel. Didn't eat there, but did have a few drinks at the pool bar during happy hour. No complaints there. I did notice that there seemed to be a few locals hanging out at the pool bar, but it wasn't something that bothered me, just something I noticed after reading the tripadvisor reviews. We splashed about in the pool, hung out in the jacuzzi and crashed (we just came back from 3 nights of camping). I liked the area of Kihei better than Kaanapali, which we also stayed in, because it seemd more of a neighborhood than just a tourist block. Not sure I would want to spend a couple of hundred dollars on the room we had, but for the price we got it for, it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Tale of Two Hotels”
Reviews.Author: belltownonthemove
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I checked late on a friday night and were assigned room 238 this room should be avoided at all costs it is right next a large HVHC unit that runs loudly from 7am to 8pm therefore we needed to keep the deck door closed to use the room in quiet. When I raised this concern the desk personal knew about the problem and two days later we were moved to a room 539 on the otherside of the building this was much better. The Maui Coast Hotel is in great location righ across the street from a great beach with good swimming and snorkeling. Also if you need a quick lunch check out the 808 Deil down the street they make great food. I would avoid the hotel restaurant Spices it's young staff just threw my breakfast plate in front me like there were feeding a dog they did not like. The Hotel has a great pool and hot tub we used most days of our trip. Overall it a good but not a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Renovations Continue but New Rooms Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: jjb415
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Maui Coast Hotel was very nice. The large airy lobby and friendly staff made me feel very welcome. 2 free internet computers near the elevators are available 24 hours a day and are always busy. Renovations are in progress and there is some construction noise during the daytime hours. Unfortunately, I didn't use Room Service or the hotel restaurant. There is a small gym available over the restaurant that offers a few cardio machines and weights. I was lucky enough to be assigned a renovated room, 544, on my recent visit to the Maui Coast Hotel, however the room was located quite far down a long hallway. The decor, although not Hawaiin oriented, is very nice and problems previously mentioned with sheets not fitting the matress have been solved. Bathrooms have been completey remodeled. My room had 2 flat screen televisions, lots of new towels, and comfortable new matresses with plenty of pillows that are a bit too large and hard. Wi-fi was available for a $10 fee per day. When the renovations are complete the Maui Coast should be even nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, Bad Restaurant, Local Rental For Drunken Parties”
Reviews.Author: tabithaj
Reviews.Content: The hotel lived up to most of the photos that were posted on Tripadvisor. It is an average 3-star hotel with an impressive open-air lobby and clean room. The bed is rock hard and the maids don't use fitted sheets, so your feet rub up against the bare mattress where the flat sheet doesn't wrap around. The restaurant that provides room service and on-site dining, Spices, is overpriced and the food is not very good. The service is also incredibly slow; my boyfriend and I waited 45 minutes for a simple meal when we were the only customers on the floor. Overall, this Coast property is on the lower end of their aggregate properties. Many of their hotels in Seattle and Portland, Oregon are much nicer and classier. Our worst Maui Coast experience was on the last night when we actually needed to get a lot of sleep for our morning flight home. It was Valentine's Day and the room next door to us had been rented out by young locals for a party. The group was very loud. After an hour of intermittent noise, a couple began arguing outside our door about drug use and was audibly intoxicated. At this point, I called the front desk and complained. Within 30 minutes, the noise died down - likely when security arrived. This was a quick trip to Maui and I got a decent deal on the room through Travelocity. I knew what I was getting into and assumed it would be a disappointment, as I usually stay in nicer areas on the Northwest coast. I guess you get what you pay for. To their credit, the hotel and restaurant staff are very nice and the room was clean. If you choose to stay here for cost cutting, I would suggest eating elsewhere and bringing earplugs and money for a few massages to get the kinks out of your back.

Reviews.Title: “..would easily stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: Jeff3
Reviews.Content: ...All the previous reviews were spot on. Clean, friendly, relatively reasonably priced, good happy hour (3-6pm). Currently the upper floors are undergoing renovation so you may have a tough time getting a reservation for the next few weeks. If you don't mind not being right on the beach, this could be for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice price but toilets in the hall”
Reviews.Author: lostbluebeans
Reviews.Content: The hotel was close to the beach. walking distance to " da kitchen" an excellent local eatery. great moco loco! our room on the second floor was alright except for the one day we went to the beach for the day and came back late in the afternoon and found the that we had no clean towels. actually no roomservice at all that day. we were told the staff went home at 4:30. sorry. part of our family had rooms on the 5th floor and they had toilets yep, toilets in the hall and all around the elevator. there was plastic over all the doors on this floor and down the scarry hall. this was the same on the 4th and 6th too . we assumed they were remodeling because on monday morning we were all shocked to hear the sounds of hammering and such at around 8am . if we choose this hotel again we will definatly call to see if the remodel is done first. it just reminds me that you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value!”
Reviews.Author: Bluestjuice
Reviews.Content: The Maui Coast is easy to get to and roomy, with a large lobby and nice, good-sized rooms. They were comfortable and clean. This is not a resort, but definitely well-appointed. The pool deck seemed appealing, though we went snorkeling during our brief stay so didn't have the energy to take advantage of it. The location is good too, in Kihei only a few minutes' drive from all manner of shopping, dining, etc. They did have a notice that they were remodeling and there might be some noise between 11 and 3 during the day, but as we had plans and were out of the building, it didn't detract any from our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Bang For Your Buck”
Reviews.Author: BigdawgChicago
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days while looking at some places to rent when I bring my family back in December. I wanted something inexpensive in Wailea-Kihei area. The cheapest resort hotel was the Wailea Marriott for $290 a nite. I stayed at Maui Coast for about $130 a nite-AAA rate. It is an excellent value for the money. I did not encounter any of the negatives other reviewers noted. The room was clean, housekeeping did a good job every day and of great importance, the hotel was very quiet. The wall separating the rooms are concrete or cinder block, not plasterboard, so you cannot hear anything from the adjoining room. I did not even hear the usual door slamming common in all hotels. Parking free and plenty of it. Work-out room was clean, looked fresh, equipment was relatively new and was nicer than most hotel with higher rates. Although the furniture was average island decor and a bit worn, it was not that bad and no reason not to stay here. I stayed regularly at the Renaissance Wailea until it closed and loved it there. The rates there were about $300 a nite. The furniture there was equivalent to Maui Coast so it was good enough to get two and a half times what Maui Coast charges. Decent size small refrigerator in the room. Front desk personnel always greeted me coming and going and check-in and check-out was quick and accurate. United and American put their flight crews up here and although the airlines need to save money, the flight crews would not put up with staying in a dive. Looking not to spend a left lung for a room in Maui in this economy-stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: FarminRaeRae
Reviews.Content: This was my husband's and my first stop on our Hawaiian honeymoon. After looking at pictures I wasn't all that impressed, but we got it through AAA and it was a good price. These rooms are HUGE! We got a standard room, and it had a king size bed, a huge shower w/ jet's in the tub, double sinks, PLUS a wet bar with a sink, coffee pot, and mini-fridge. There was also a couch with the TV, a very private lanai and a FREE safe in our closed for our use. (I say free b/c at our hotel in Oahu - you had to swipe your credit card to use it - $3.25 per day!) The staff was friendly and our favorite part was that we had an Expedia Concierge right in the lobby! We went to her to book everything we did while there. She was friendly, helpful and we were on a first name basisi by the time we left. There is also a giftshop which is kind of pricey, but it was good since we forgot our toothpaste. The pool is nice and clean and they have a happy hour every day, as well as a pool bar and grill. You can charge things to your room which is nice. They also had live entertainment every night, so if we didn't feel like going out one night, we'd just sit down there. The restaurant - Spices - pretty pricey for what you get. And the service was awful. Just s l o w. But it was convienant for breakfast's. I would DEFINITELY stay here again! You were within walking distance to the beach and tons of shops, food, stores, etc. We loved it and were very sad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for locals, nice place, would stay here anytime!”
Reviews.Author: nawahine21
Reviews.Content: I live on another island in the state of Hawaii and wanted to visit Maui. The Maui Coast Hotel was a great choice to stay over in the town of Kihei. I prefered to stay at a hotel versus a condo, or B&B, so this was the nicest place to stay in Kihei. It was very easy to find and we had a wonderful stay there. We stayed over for a weekend. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. The price was definitely worth it. I paid to have the alcove suite upgrade and when we arrived the staff offered to have it upgraded (at no charge) to a one bedroom suite. When we were first placed in a room, it was the one right at the end, therefore did not have 2 sinks in the bathroom as promised, I notified the front desk and they switched us to another room with ease. The one bedroom suite is beautiful and the bathroom was very large and had a whirlpool style bathtub. (In case you were wondering, a good bathroom to shower/get ready in is an important factor to me....) When we asked for opinions where to dine in the area, the staff was very friendly and we did trust their judgement. Some minor points.... if you want a hotel with a nice beach nearby, don't stay here. Kihei doesn't really have a lot of nice beaches...that would be a little down the road in Wailea. The pool is rather small also. I was also told that a lot of people from the airlines stay here, and yes, it it true. I did notice a lot of flight attendants there. They also have free internet access in the lobby area for 5 minutes. Everytime I did board or get off the elevator it alway seemed to be occupied. There is no valet, you park the vehicle yourself but the parking is right next to the hotel so it was pretty convenient. Would definitely recommend to locals and visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Good Price - Hard Bed”
Reviews.Author: Girly_Golfer
Reviews.Content: We were encouraged as we read the reviews about the Maui Coast Hotel. On some sites, the Maui Coast was the only hotel that had a consistent 5 Star Rating, it even had better reviews than the fancy smancy Resorts! We already knew not to expect a "resort", but to expect a nice hotel, in probably the best location in Maui. It was perfectly located. We loved being in Kihei. It was located super close to all the best snorkeling spots (we snorkeled every morning!) and great shopping. If you wanted to go to Wailea, it's literally 10 minutes south, if you wanted to go up to Ka'anapali it's 45 minutes north! The best taco shop is about a 10 minute walk (Maui Tacos) away, I highly suggest visiting! Maui Coast is one of the better hotels in Kihei, but we did have a few complaints. Our bed was rock hard. Our pillows were horrible. Two of them were feather pillows, when you would lay your head on them, it would flatten down to nothing, and the other pillow was so lumpy we just tossed it off the bed. We were initially excited about our balcony, but unfortunately it was located above the air conditioners (we were on the second floor) so we didn't even venture out there, it would have been too loud to even hear each other speak. They also knew we were on our honeymoon, and still placed us in that location; We were a little disappointed but we quickly got over it, we were like a dime a dozen in Hawaii! Also, we ended up not being in our room much, other to sleep or change clothes from activity to activity. But the good things about the hotel out number the complaints. The hotel staff was extremely nice, the parking was wonderful (always spots in the front, i don't think there was ever a bad spot to park), the Expedia travel lady, Penny, was amazing, she booked most of our adventures. We didn't have to worry about being sold or hassled about timeshares, she just booked what we wanted, and also suggested activities we were not aware of! The restaurant, Spices, was great if you didn't want to travel off the property to get a bite to eat! If you want to come to Maui, if you want to stay at the best location, and if you don't want to break your wallet, I suggest staying at the Maui Coast (even though it is still pricey to get to Maui these days). Just bring a pillow and some ear plugs (the A/C unit is loud)!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: trailblazer_uk2000
Reviews.Content: The Maui Coast is well positioned in Kihei for all local shopping & restaurants. The roomwas well furnished and the balcony a nice places to relax after a long day sightseeing and enjoying this beautiful Island. We enjoyed the breakfast in Spices Restaurant, although didn't eat here for dinner. The pool looked lovely, although we never got a chance to use it. Parking was easy, and it was nice having a side access dor, to walk straight to our room (235) literally yards from the carpark. Kihei is not absolutely central, but suited our needs, and with a car no where is too far away, although the main highway is still under construction.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location - room needs updating”
Reviews.Author: happywanderer856
Reviews.Content: When we first checked into our room at the Maui Coast Hotel, we were a little disappointed. Our room looked like it hadnâ€™t been updated since the 1980â€™s â€“ old wallpaper, and the sink countertop in the bathroom had cigarette burns on it. The tub seemed newer. The room was clean and spacious. Our room (315) was on the 3rd floor, so there wasn't much of a view. The common areas of the hotel are nice â€“ the lobby is attractive, the pool area looked nice, and the bar (next to the pool) looked like fun. I never made it there for happy hour because I was always out sightseeing. The elevators were always readily available. There were 2 computers available for free use just off the lobby. We enjoyed eating breakfast in the restaurant (Spices). The food was good, and they had a variety of $5 breakfasts on the menu. As we got over our disappointment in the room, we warmed up to the hotel. It is in a good central location near shops, restaurants and the beach, and there is plenty of free parking. I would recommend this hotel, especially if you are doing a lot of sightseeing and the room itself isnâ€™t key to your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: vacationer57
Reviews.Content: Maui Coast is one of the few places to stay in Kihei that is not a condo. We didn't plan on doing any cooking and didn't want to pay condo prices. Got a great deal. Room was clean, spacious, dual bathroom sinks, jacuzzi tub and king sized bed. Hotel staff excellent. Lots of free parking. Only drawback, view from lanai looks into ajoining timeshare property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: budget_bound
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night at this hotel as a last minute getaway from Waikiki. We had a total of 4 adults and I found the room to be very accomodating for all of us. The beds were comfortable and the airconditioning was refreshing. I only wish I could have had more time to enjoy the pool. I have no complaints about anything at this hotel, parking was easy to find and the staff were very hospitable. I was not sure where to eat for dinner and the front desk fellow suggested a sushi spot a couple blocks down that offered 50% off sushi after 10:00PM (I was craving Poke). He advised us to get there early as a line usually starts to get in. We took thier advise and it was SOOO worth it. I ate Poke as I was craving and lots of awesome sushi for half the price. I came back to the hotel stuffed and a bit tipsy but felt I should not forget to thank the kind men at the front for the great recommendation. So I wrote them a thank you note and was sure to say only good things on the hotel review upon check out. Another plus about this location was the proximity to some nice beaches, I went walking in the morning and they did not seem busy or crowded at all. There were also a few places to dine within walking distance and ABC stores were never too far for those last minute neccesities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Good Price”
Reviews.Author: frosty412
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I came here for our honeymoon, it was a great price and we were pleasantly surprised! We had been in Kuai for the previous week staying at a 5 star resort - while the Maui Coast Hotel was not a comparison, it was a great hotel for the price we paid! The location was ideal - great beaches and surfing within walking distance. The pool was smaller but never crowded. The bar had great music at night and good drink specials. We stayed in a one room suite - balcony off of the family room, small fridge, sink, and a bottle of champagne waiting for us upon arrival! The staff was very friendly. We would come back and stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LoriAnn78
Reviews.Content: Prior to getting in engaged my husband and I decided to plan a trip to Hawaii. After much deliberation we decided on visiting Maui. We were trying to stay within a budget, which was really tight, especially for a trip to Hawaii. Our budget -$2,000.00. I enlisted the help of a travel agent that we used at work. She came back with a three night stay at $3,000.00. That just wasn't going to work!! So I tried several different websites and found the perfect trip on Travelocity. 6 nights, 5 days in Maui (including roundtrip airfare) for $1,800.00. I looked at several different packages but went with the package including a hotel stay at Maui Coast Hotel after searching various websites (i.e. AAA) for more information on the hotels. Definitely a great choice. More value for your dollar. The hotel certainly lives up to its description. It is a very nice hotel and exceeded my expectations. The front desk/conceirge are wonderful. They were knowledgeable and more than willing to help. The pool/hot tub area are clean. There is an outdoor bar located right near the pool. The restaurant offers a nice breakfast at a reasonable price. Three months prior to our trip my husband proposed and we decided that we would get married while visiting Maui. I contacted the hotel to ask for some help in planning our wedding and asking if they offered such services. Unfortunately, they were not able to help with our wedding services, but they did point me in the right direction. My husband and I are planning on returning to Maui and we will definitely be staying at the Maui Coast Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: reis08
Reviews.Content: A good tourist hotel with good parking area and close to the beach. Rooms were nice, not to big, but good. There was a little refrigerator and a safetybox. Also iron/ironboard. The balcony we didn't sit on. There is a nice pool. We didn't make use of the restaurant or breakfast. The hotel is located near the shops, the beaches and it's really easy to drive around and to drive to wailea. Kihei is a perfect place to explore the whole island since it's very central.

Reviews.Title: “Business Travelers stay away”
Reviews.Author: BizTravelLady
Reviews.Content: Not business traveler friendly. Rooms need major upgrades from the carpet to beds to the drapes...etc. My room was on the second floor and faced the side parking lot. People getting out of their cars could totally see in my room as I'm resting on my bed unless I close the drapes! There was a dingy smell but I think the hotel is just old and dirty. I would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: rsSk
Reviews.Content: We just recently returned from our trip to Hawaii. We stayed in Waikiki for a week and then moved on to Maui. I would definitely stay in the Kihei area again. You need a rental car in Maui, but it's a quick trip to Kahului to shop at larger stores such as Costco, Walmart, etc. or to go walk & browse the many shops and restaurants on Front Street in Lahaina. South Kihei seems like a new & clean area. The beach across the street from the hotel is nice, although when we visited - windy. We liked to visit Big Beach - but be warned of the large waves, kids & adults were knocked over by them. The hotel was nicely situated. The staff seemed friendly. Parking was free (which I've heard isn't always the case at other hotels). They have two computer terminals in the lobby for internet use. The rooms were pretty much average. They were clean and quiet but nothing very fancy. (You don't spend too much time in your hotel anyway.) Stay above the first level, though, because the balconies on the first seemed almost "basement-like" - sort of below the parking lot with a view of a retaining wall. The pillows are very flat - so maybe ask for extras. We had the continental breakfast package on the on-site restaurant. It was fine - choice of toast, bagel or muffin, coffee, juice. Otherwise, the prices seemed pretty expensive. Overall, nothing to complain about, but pretty much average.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bstans
Reviews.Content: The Maui Coast Hotel was not my family's first pick, but it ended up being suprisingly great! Driving by all the hotels on the island, the Maui Coast was definetly the one with the nicest exterior. Upon arrival we were greeted with a smile and friendly welcome. The lobby was gorgeous and very open. We stayed in a one bedroom suite. The room was a nice size with two balconies. The bedroom had a closet with safe and a huge, comfortable bed. The rest consisted of a pull out sofa bed, bathroom and the basic hotel neccessities. The pool was nice and secluded, and there were many hot tubes scattered/seculded throughout the hotel premises. By the pool there was a bar where you could sit, relax and order drinks. At night there was music and lights adorning the pool. It was such a great atmosphere I could have spent all day there. Also there was a restaurant on the premises, it was alright, I would suggest one of the restaurants closer by that are within walking distance. The hotel staff was outstanding in my perspective. Every day when I would come down through the lobby they would greeet me and ask how my previous day had been and what I was going to be doing today. They seemed genuinely interested and always had suggestions if needed. Across from the hotel is a great little beach in Kihei, good for laying in the sun and relaxing. Furthermore many great restaurants within walking distance and many great shopping venues. Overall my trip was a wonderful experience and I will be staying at the maui coast hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nddhmj
Reviews.Content: The Maui Coast Hotel was really nice and clean. The staff, I would say, were about average. The pool and secluded hot tub were also nice. The only complaint we had was when the Expedia fun desk person in the lobby referred us to a condo sales pitch in Lahaina for a free $100.00 activity voucher. All you had to do was go to Lahaina and listen to a presentaion over the Fairmont resort condos. She kept telling us how great it was and how it wouldn't be a high pressured sales pitch, just go listen, eat free lunch, and leave. She was so wrong. It was very high pressured. They ran our credit without telling us and were just complete jerks. We got up and left in the middle of it. Do not get suckered into this! I would not do it again even for $1,000. Anyway, The hotel could not have been in a better location. This was our first trip to Maui so we didn't really know where to stay. Everyone kept telling us to stay up North in Kaanapali at one of the big resorts but I'm so glad we didn't. All the great sites and beaches on the west part of Maui are down south, not in Kaanapali like everyone tells you. We traveled to Kaanapali a few times and realized how far away it was from all the great stuff. All they had were big hotels with nice pools and bad beaches. If that's what you're looking for, go to some random beach resort in the US. Tips: Make sure and visit Makena Beach down South, aka Big Beach and Little Beach. Big Beach is beautiful! Use caution though, Little Beach is a nude beach. If you are looking for all the beautiful and amazing women of Maui, go to the windsurfing beach Paia any day of the week! To go swimming with dolphins, go to La Perouse Bay down South right at sunrise. They will be there feeding with their babies....amazing!!! Also, Lahaina is where the cruise ships dump all the tourists. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as I hoped”
Reviews.Author: JCAC11
Reviews.Content: The Maui Coast hotel was Ok, I don't think it was worth the $193.00 a night at all. We got a Jr. alcove suite, i guess its one of the larger rooms. The location was ok, I love Kihei. The room was old, the bed was not comfy, and we found one little black beatle a day crawling on the floor. The room description said "garden terrace view", well they didn't mention that the "garden" had a parking lot running down the middle of it. We never used our Lanai because it was just too noisy outside. Inside our room with our glass door shut it was quite. We never used there pool but it looked nice and they had a poolside bar and grill that was great. The Spices restaurant was good too. We won't be staying at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Coast was very nice!”
Reviews.Author: puma123
Reviews.Content: We really liked the Maui Coast. We could not find a condo to save our lives during the time we wanted to stay in Kihei, so the Maui Coast was our higher-priced alternative. It was almost worth having no kitchen and paying extra for impeccable housekeeping, not having to worry about cooking, and enjoying the luxury of a hotel vs. a "do it all yourself" condo. Although the hotel might be slightly overpriced, it was worth it. It was clean, staff was friendly, and it is in a great location - especially for our main activity (diving, leaving at 5:45 am every day from Kihei boat ramp). We loved it. No complaints at all. Loved the internet in the lobby... pool bar was nice, with the cat "Spicy" to greet us at happy hour every night. Go stay there and you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: bigsourgrape
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with Maui Coast. It's just across from a great beach and surrounded (within walking distance) by a variety of restaurants, bars and shopping. We had a huge room that was very clean. They also provided beach towels (which may be standard, I don't know) which was very convenient. We had a great time there and would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Personal driver?? Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: langurl
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Maui and I'm glad we stayed in Kihei. The Maui Coast Hotel was a nice hotel with clean, spacious rooms. Admittedly, we don't usually spend much time in the hotel but I did get food poisoning and spent a day in the semi-private jacuzzi next to the pool. The staff was very friendly and when I plugged up the sink, someone from the front desk was up to the room w/i minutes (beware of Maui Taco's salad bar). We mainly go Hawaii to snorkel and lay on the beach and this hotel was w/i walking distance to some nice beaches. A major bonus was the free shuttle service the hotel offers (w/i 5 miles or so) and since most people didn't use this service, we felt as if we had our very own driver. Not only were we taken to some wonderful beaches in the area, our driver recommended some hot local restaurants (1/2 price sushi at midnight!). We just gave him a ring on his cell when we were ready to head back to the hotel and were picked up about 10 minutes later. We'll definitely go back to the Maui Coast Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great - Stay Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: ted0314
Reviews.Content: We read the mixed reviews; and decided to chance it. Bad idea. We, too, found pubic hairs in our bed when we checked in. When we informed the guy at the Front Desk, he called maid service; but when we came back at the end of the day, no bed changes. We checked out the next day, again informing the Front Desk for the reason why. They apologized, but made no other efforts. Spend the extra money and upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Edwin is the Best!!!”
Reviews.Author: LoveMaui2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Coast Hotel during Christmas 2007. It is a very nice hotel with everything we needed except for 1000 island dressing in their restaurant (we like this on our burgers) and a microwave oven in our room. The staff was very professional, knowledgable, accommodating and polite. Edwin (at the front desk) is a very friendly and sweet young man. They even had free internet access in the lobby area, via two different computer terminals, which made it very convenient to keep updated with important personal matters. The only thing that would have made our stay better would have been for the pool man (at the towel kiosk) to rub suntan lotion on our shoulders and backs ... oh, and the 1000 island dressing and microwave. This hotel was a little pricey for our budget ($250/day) ... but you have to expect anything on Maui to be pricey. We had a wonderful time and would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Eyeluv2Travel
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. Clean, yet the rooms are quite a distance from the street and the lobby, as they are built back from the street (not up). There is free internet in the lobby at standing kiosks, which are limited to time, unless no one is waiting. The pool area is awesome, and there are individual hot tubs surrounding, which make for a nice night! The hotel is not in the "main" area of Maui, however the location is good for a nice break from the hustle and bustle, and has good restaraunts within walking distance. The restaraunt was good, and the staff were very accomodating. Good place, clean, good service.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Coast - great stay!”
Reviews.Author: acraftydiva
Reviews.Content: They say it is "location, location, location" and Maui Coast has the best!! Located directly across from a beach that is never busy, many restaurants within walking distance and a great $4.95 breakfast at Spices- the hotel restaurant- what more could you ask for!! I will stay at this hotel whenever I am in Maui. It is centrally located, 30 minutes from the Hana road in one direction and 30 minutes from Lahaina in the other direction- great for day trips! We stayed in a 1 bedroom that had views of the ocean and the mountains-- a balcony, refrigerator and many more amenities and FREE parking (a hard thing to find at hotels in Maui!!) This hotel is small, the rooms were immaculate, the service impecable - always a greeting from the front desk and the concierge was above and beyond helpful. They have a gym, tennis courts and bike rentals right on site. If you want a great hotel at a reasonable price, I highly recommend Maui Coast!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel close to the beach and ammenities”
Reviews.Author: dive-girl77
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Maui Coast Hotel for the Thanksgiving long weekend. Upon checking in very late at night the desk agent assigned a room on the first floor but advised me to check back the next morning to get a room higher up in the hotel. After checking back the next morning I was given a room on the third floor (reservation was for an ocean view room and I never got one but since I was only paying $150 per night I couldn't really complain). TIP: odd numbered rooms or rooms on the top three floors have ocean views... no ocean view from the first or third floor on the even numbered side of the hotel. The grounds of the hotel were clean and attractive. I never swam in the pool but it appeared to be a nice set up. The rooms were a bit dated and the air conditioning was loud. The bathroom was clean but very very small... and it had the most annoying shower curtain that was short and would blow into the shower while showering... when I tried to correct this I ended up flooding the floor... no winning with that! I found the hotel to be quite quiet given the fact that it was booked solid. Free internet in the lobby and free parking were a nice bonus as was the mini refrigerator in the room. The hotel is situated across from the beach in busy Kihei but since it is set back from the road it was quite quiet. I ate breakfast one morning in the hotel restaurant and it was okay, service was friendly but slow. Would I recommend this hotel to a friend, probably not as I would recommend a condo instead (a condo is a must if you are traveling with children). However, if you needed a place to stay for one or two nights then this is an okay choice.

Reviews.Title: “Not wonderful. Don't use the restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: PF123456
Reviews.Content: Not a wonderful experience. My room smelt like it hadn't been used for a couple of weeks and the air conditioning didn't work to start with, but that did get sorted. Do not use the restaurant on the site. Service was slow, they made mistakes with my order and the food was poor. I paid $135 + tax which seemed like a fair price, but no doubt there are better options.

Reviews.Title: “A little pricey but nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mauigirlLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Maui Coast has a great location in Kihei. It is clean and the overall accomodations of a hotel are met. (We stayed here because we could not find other accomodations for one night. We wanted to stay a little bit on the west, east, and south part of Maui.) They are centrally located within walking distance to nice beaches and restaurants. The pool is pretty good but not spectacular. We paid around $200/night and I thought this was a lot compared to our fully equipped condo $130/night just down the street. They did have a bar near the pool and a little music (which our condo did not have). But otherwise, the quality was nearly the same.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BCBigBoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights in Alcove Jr Suite on the top floor (7th). We had some ocean view from our room, as on 7th floor you can see over the adjacent lower property. The room was quite large; the bathroom had dual sinks and a big whirlpool tub. The king bed was good, slept very well. I would give the hotel 5 stars if the carpet and furniture were fresher. The carpet and couch had some stains and definitely need refreshment. But the bathroom was very clean. There is a good beach across the street, 5 minutes walk. The hotel also has a pool and a hot tub, with cafe, where you can order drinks and some food. The pool area was never too busy. You can sign out beach towels to take to the beach or use at the pool. There is a Spices restaurant on the property, but we only had breakfast there which was good and service was fast. There are other places to eat within 10 minute walk, or you can drive 10 minutes to Wailea. There is an ABC store close to the hotel which is open to 11pm. We had a good time in this hotel and definitely will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Island”
Reviews.Author: Ugurd
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights at this excellent hotel resort and had a large suite with jacuzzi in the bathroom as the most extraordinary feature. Hotel is in very good shape with a beautiful reception area. The pool is somewhat small, but it's just a short walk to the beach which has a sunset and is very nice. The hotel has a restaurant which is one of the better in the area with reasonable prices and good service although it can be a bit crowded at breakfast. Altogether a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Good time would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: TrAvEl_ChIcK016
Reviews.Content: My Family of 4 traveled to Maui the week of Aug 9-14th 2007. When we arrived at the Maui Coast we were welcomed by a friendly Front Desk staff. We had made our reservation through expedia and had requested an Alcove suite with 2 queen beds. Unfortunately at the time of our check-in we were told that they have a first come first serve basis and at the time we had gotten there (which was about 3pm (check-in time)) they had all their suites with 2 beds out. I asked if it would be possible to get a new room as soon as it came available and they told me that they would let me know if any guests left early since they were booked till the 15th. Well That was that.. so we got ended up getting a one bedroom suite (on the 5th floor) which had 1 king sized bed and 1 sofa bed. It also had a mini fridge, a coffee maker, a separate counter and sink for food prep, TV, big closet, complimentary safe, iron and iron board, hair dryer and a balcony. The room was clean. I did not see anything wrong with it. I am really picky when it comes to hotel bathrooms. This bathroom passed my test. The tub was clean, the non-slip mat was free of mold, the shower curtain looked new, the toilet did not have a yellow ring and the sinks were really clean. The housekeeping staff provided fresh towels everyday as well as mouthwash, shampoo, body lotion, cotton balls and q-tips. We had a balcony that had the view of a building thatâ€™s beside the hotel. If you walked out on to the balcony you could enjoy the view of the ocean. The one thing that I did not like of the room was the sofa bed. You could feel the bed springs on your ribs. However the king sized bed was really comfortable to sleep in. I slept like a baby in that bed. The pool area is really small. The pool is only 5 feet deep and small in size and it has one toddler pool and 2 hot tubs. But who needs a bigger pool area when in Hawaii. The beach is only across the street and the hotel provides towels that you can check out to take to the pool/beach. The poolside cafÃ© is great for drinks and appetizers. Try the Mai-Tais they were good. The location of the hotel is at walking distance of a strip mall that has almost shop for almost anything you might need. They have a concierge onsite that books all the attractions from the hotel. She was really helpful and we booked quite a few activities with her. The price for the Maui Coast is very reasonable. I would definitely come back and stay here for my next visit. Remember you are visiting Hawaii so you probably wonâ€™t spend much of your time in your hotel room. Thatâ€™s why I recommend the Maui Coast. Itâ€™s affordable, walking distance from the shops and the beach

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ceevee830
Reviews.Content: We had a GREAT time at Maui Coast Hotel. As a family of four, we felt very comfortable the entire week. I really enjoyed the LIVE music by the pool in the evenings. Our room was clean. If Maui Coast Hotel was actually ON the beach, we could probably go back. Hot Tub water was way too hot, the view of dead grass was unpleasant, and the service at Spices restaurant was questionable. But overall, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Neil&Sue
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Coast for 5 days towards the end of a lengthy trip to the States and Hawaiian Islands celebrating a significant anniversary (which we had spent at the Princeville on Kauai). The booking for our hotels (6 in all) had essentially been left to the booking agent in the UK. (We didn't know about Tripadvisor then). In terms of grading, this was the lowest, but we both enjoyed it the best (and we loved all the others except New York where it was cold and wet). Whilst we tended to dine out, we were allocated a fabulous room to the front of the hotel where you could look out to sea and the sunset. We had booked a suite and were offered a choice, and choose the smaller room (still plenty big enough) with the better view. We found the staff wonderful and extremely helpful. The pool and spa pool were most welcome in the mid-late evening. Kihei is ideally situated for touring the island. Had we wanted to be static, I suspect we would have preferred Ka'nnapoli, but this was just ideal and I imagine really good value. Our trip was some time ago now, but as we were looking at Hawaii for next year, our thoughts immediately went back to the Maui Coast. I thought some of the more recent reviews were slightly harsh, certainly compared with our experiences. Oh 'the Road to Hana' it was a pity we didn't meet Bob Hope, Bing Crosby and Dorothy Lamour, that truly would have been the icing on a wonderful cake.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: loobyloo7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for part of our honeymoon and really enjoyed ourselves. On arrival the staff were friendly and I think we were given a room on the 5th floor wich was very spacious and clean with a jacuzzi bath which was nice. Only a 5 min walk to a lovely beach and walking a few mintues right or left out of the hotel takes you to small shops an restaurants. The free shuttle service is really useful for getting Wailea and the drivers were always very friendly and helpful. I would definitly advise hiring a car to explore Maui, Kihei is not that big and apparently public transport is not that great. I was slightly worried after reading some comments on the forums about crime in Kihei but did not experience anything and felt safe at all times. We visited Lahaina and Ka'anappali which were lovely for the day but glad we picked Kihei to stay in as it was not as built up and felt more relaxed. Overall we found the Maui Coast to be in a good location - our room was very quiet indeed. The pool was small and located next to the car park but they have planted lots of trees etc which helps.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: LindaAtlanta
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Very quiet. Comfortable bed. Close to beaches, restaurants, shopping.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a little while - Great Price”
Reviews.Author: drydenh
Reviews.Content: We moved to the Maui Coast Hotel after staying at the Grand Wailea Resort for a business conference. We chose the Maui Coast because it was the cheapest hotel that I felt comfortable staying at without seeing it for myself beforehand. I decided this based on the reviews on this website. If you are looking for cheap, clean, & comfortable, this is your hotel. If you are looking for new, spotless, good beach views/access this is not the hotel for you. If you are wanting to walk everywhere from your hotel, Kihei is not the town for you. I would suggest Lahina or Kaanapali. The Maui Coast is located across the street and down a little from Kamaâ€˜ole Beach Parks I, II and III (which didn't look like they were the best of beaches). There may be a few hotel rooms where you can see the beach from your room, but don't even hope for this at the Maui Coast. We could see a small piece of the ocean if we leaned way out of the balcony, but there are residences with walls and lots of trees on the beachside of the street directly in front of the hotel. Normally I would want to stay at a hotel that was directly on the beach so that I could walk out to it at any time, but we stayed here for only 2 nights after 7 nights at the Grand Wailea and we were planning on driving to the perfect location each day anyway. Unless you are staying at a resort and are planning to spend your entire time there, you need to rent a car no matter where you stay. Our room: We reserved a standard room at the AAA price of around $165 plus tax. When we arrived we were upgraded to an Alcove Jr. Suite (supposed to be about $30 more according to the website). The suite had almost 200 more sq feet and a wet bar, so this was nice. The furniture in the room is very outdated beach type furniture/decor. (You know, white iron/wood furniture with a pink and light blue decor. A little 80s.) It does look like the pictures on the website, but a little dingier. The cushions on the love seat were definately dingy from use, but nothing was really gross. The bed was nice and comfortable with down pillows (but they were small - the king room came with 3 pillows). Our bathroom was spacious with double sinks, but the standard room looks like it would have been a tight squeeze. There was a large refrigerator in the room (which was nice after having to pay $25 for a small one at the Grand Wailea even though it is a mega dollar resort!). The hotel: This hotel has restaurant(s) and a pool, but we didn't use them. They have towels that you can check out to use at the pool or take to the beach - just make sure you bring them back. There are multiple laundry rooms in the hotel. Usage is free, there is only a charge if you need to buy single use detergent or dryer sheets from the vending machine. Nice if you need to dry a couple of bathing suits before you pack up to go home! Remember this hotel is not located on the beach so there are no cabanas, umbrellas, or chairs to use at the beach. If you want to pay a fee you can use tennis courts and bicycles provided by the hotel. Check out is at 11:00, but they let us stay until 12:00 when we asked even though they were sold out. Overall, I would recommed this hotel for short stays, tight budgets, or if you plan on traveling all over Maui and don't care about having a beach on your front lawn. I would stay here again if for a short stay, but would try to find something on the beach up near Kaanapali/Lahina if I were staying for a long time. Other Info: We ate at: 1. Lahina Fish Company in Lahina (Moderate to Slightly High, approx. $18 - 39/entree), good food, O.K. service, great view - it sits out over Lahina Harbor). 2. Paia Fish Market in Paia (Inexpensive, approx $10-13/entree), great fried food, counter service only, a few bench style tables that you sit with other people at, no view). 3. Buzz's Warf at Maalea Harbor (Slightly High, approx. $23-45/entree & drinks are club service - no refills), FANTASTIC shrimp - read up about it - O.K. other food, O.K. service, O.K. view of Maalea Harbor, but not directly on the water, so you'd have to sit at the window and look over the parking lot. 4. Canoes in Lahina (Moderate to Slightly High, approx. $18-39/entree) O.K. food - I didn't really care for my Mahi, good service, good view of the ocean if you sit at the windows near the north end of the restaurant. We shopped at: 1. The Shops at Wailea - really only good for high-end shopping, not much entertainment. Only a couple of restaruants.2.
