Front Street in Lahina - nice to stroll & do some Hawaiian market shopping along with a few clothing stores, nice jewelry stores, and art galleries. Lots of restaurants. Stop and check out the huge Banyan tree. 3. Whaler's Village in Kanapali - similar to the shops at Wailea, but on certain nights they offer free entertainment. 4. Hagusegawa (sp?) General Store in Hana - junky place to pick up a t-shirt or a snack or some motor oil after traversing the road to Hana. 5. ABC store - the ultimate Hawaiian convience store. Good for cheap souveniers, snacks, etc. We surfed at "The Cove" in Kihei. Good, long breaking 1 foot swells for beginners. It is where a lot of surf classes take place, but you can keep away from them by surfing in the actual cove where commercial activity is forbidden. We rented our board from Maui Waveriders which has a shop out of a truck between the Marketplace and the 76 Gas station near the Cove in Kihei and somewhere in Lahina. They were great. Provided you with booties - the sand can be dangerous from rocks - a rash guard - and of course the board. A soft top is $15/day and a hard top is $30/day. *The Cove is right up the road from the Maui Coast. You could walk, but if you're carring a surf board, you wouldn't want to. We traveled the Road to Hana. If you like seeing a lot of different areas/beaches and waterfalls, you should do this, ONCE. But it is a loooong winding road. There are lots of places to stop to swim, body board, and see waterfalls. You can even swim in some waterfalls, but it's not always advised depending on the conditions. We went to Big Beach in Makena - this is more like the beaches you'd be used to in the US. Most beaches in Hawaii are small, but this golden sand beach is long and wide. The shore break is right on the beach, so bodyboarding and body surfing are fun, but dangerous. The waves have some major crashing force here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Maui, eventually LIKED the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Average_Jo_and_Jane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Coast hotel in June 2006 as part of our honeymoon. Despite what some people have written, we had no problems at all with the location of the hotel. It was set back off the main road through Kihei and a maximum of 5 minute walk from the beaches and 10 minutes from a small shopping area in Kihei. We did not notice any noise from traffic, and no loud music or rowdy guests/locals. It was a very quiet and relaxing hotel and area. Always plenty of free parking at the hotel, and we did indeed hire a car, which was well worth it as there is so much to explore in Maui. The hotel looks pretty and the pool area (though it is a small pool) is pretty, clean and has plenty of sun loungers. The hotel has lovely greenery and clean, pretty public areas. The beaches in Ki'hei were beautiful, as they were all over the island, and Maui itself was exactly as we had pictured it. Wonderful scenery, very friendly people. Tropical paradise with the comfort of an American holiday (written from the POV of Brits you understand!!). There are convenience stores and food such as pizza hut in Ki'hei but little else. The nearby town of Wailea (about a 10 min drive away) is fantastic for shopping, with lots of designer stores such as Gucci, Louis Vuitton, Guess, etc, as well as lots of souvenirs and standard shops. The hotel itself was very disappointing for us when we first arrived. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful, our first room was on the ground floor, was very small and smelt very badly of damp, which was only made worse by the airconditioning unit. There were cigarette burns and stains all over the carpets, chairs and sofas, and there were hairs in the bed sheets!! The bathroom suite was discoloured and it smelt of sewage. I CANNOT EMPHASIZE ENOUGH HOW BAD THIS ROOM WAS!! I cried and we both wanted to leave. Plus we did not get the champage we were promised as honeymooners! This realy upset my husband who had planned the holiday as a surprise and it did not live up to expectations. Having said that, when we complained, the hotel manager was very hepful and let us have our pick of 3 other rooms, two of which were junior suites on higher floors, and (eventually) agreed to no extra charge for this. The third was a room similar to ours on the ground floor, which had all the exact same problems. I was told this hotel has been refurbished recently, and I firmly believe that is a lie, otherwise not all the rooms have been done yet. We refused this room also, but both the suites on the higher floors were much larger and did not smell of damp. There were still some stains but no where near as many. We couldnt move hotels as it was too expensive, so we picked one of these rooms and stuck with it. We decided to hire a car for a couple of days to get us out and about, which was a fantastic idea and we got to see so many wonderful places. Ultimately, we really enjoyed the holiday and started to appreciate the hotel more once we were in better room. The junior suite was much nicer, cleaner and more comfortable, and we really enjoyed the holiday! Plus they gave us 2 bottles of champagne to say sorry! The restaurant served good value, local and American cuisine. We never once had a bad meal there, although tended only to eat breakfast at the hotel. Good sized portions too, and very attentive, friendly staff. Overall, the hotel itself is very pretty, nicely located, and has very friendly and helpful staff. It is NOT an exclusive hotel, so do not go expecting facilities at that standard. It was a bit like Russian Roulette for us in terms of room quality, but we got there in the end!! Started off as a nightmare, and ended up as a really enjoyable, relatively cheap holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Helpfull staff but badly situated”
Reviews.Author: Marisse
Reviews.Content: Me and my family were supposed to stay at the Maui Coast Hotel for 8 nights but we only stayed one. Being four adult women crammed together in a double bed and a sleeping couch is not my idea of a vacation! Even though the staff tried their best we chose to move after the first night. Coming all the way from Europe I expect more from a hotel in Maui. It was poorly situated between buildings with no sight of anything green (except of course for Haleakala in the background) and you had to cross a road to get to the beach. I know of other much nicer and better hotels in the same pricerange placed on the beach near Lahaina, where the view is a whole lot better!

Reviews.Title: “Just an Okay Hotel - Definitely not impressive”
Reviews.Author: E4388
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 weeks, first week of April 2007. Across the street and down a little to get to the beach, and the beach here isn't that great. A sketchy crowd hangs out in the parking lot. The room was just so-so and they even upgraded us to a junior suite. It was nice to stay in the area to hit some different spots because the rest of the trip we stayed in Lahaina. Rooms are just outdated and don't seem so clean. If you do decide to stay here, have the mac-nut pancakes with coconut syrup. The restaurant on site wasn't that bad, though don't go if you are in a rush...one day our waiter must have been on some serious drugs, the other day we went service was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Coast Hotel was worth it”
Reviews.Author: rhysdavids
Reviews.Content: I chose Maui Coast because of the high ratings from TripAdvisor. Most of the reviews were on track. It has 7 stories. Ask for the 7th floor facing the ocean for best view. Ask for extra complimentary hotel towels before heading to beach. Use towels in rental cars to keep them clean of sand because you will be charged if they feel they have to vacuum too much. Live entertainment poolside was easy-going/leisurely. Liquor at poolside was strong-moderately priced. The Spices Restaurant affliated with hotel actually was recommended to us by a tour guide so we tried it and were surprised with the quality of service and food. Again price was moderate. Big Beach in Makena is best beach nearby.

Reviews.Title: “great deal and super clean”
Reviews.Author: redsbaskets
Reviews.Content: We stayed @ the Maui Coast Hotel after checking out of the Kamahole Sands condo's, because our room was so bad. We had family already staying @ this hotel. After seeing there room and what they got for their money, we checked in @ Maui Coast also. We had a really great time and feel like we got what we paid for. The rooms were really clean and the staff was very accomadating. I recommend this hotel to everyone and would definately stay here again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: mandylee4christ
Reviews.Content: We spent a good chunk of our trip to Maui at the Maui Coast Hotel. I was expecting a lavish, pampered experience for the price we paid a night ($230/night for just a standard room!). It was nothing more then a Holiday Inn or any other plain, run-of-the-mill hotel. Everything was just "ok". It is NOT worth the amount of money they charge! If you are looking for a really nice place to stay in Maui for a good price check out the Maui Guest House in Lahaina. They offered plasma tv's and hot tubs in every room, laundry services, internet, and free long distance calling. And they only charged $130. The Maui Coast was a dismall disappointment!

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn? is that you?”
Reviews.Author: rainy4264
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Coast on a gift certif my boyfriend won for a golf tournament. Our room was a one-bedroom and not only a couch but it had a little sink and mini-bar with small dorm fridge. Since we were staying for free, we didn't have any expectations or pickiness. Pros: - Friendly staff. When we checked in, we found that the front-desk person knew someone in the city we are from, and we had a mutual acquaintance! =) - Clean, if spare, rooms. The dorm fridge was great for leftovers for rich restaurant leftovers. - Lots of nice beaches in Kihei area. - Shopping, restaurants, are nearby and easy to find, the area is easy to navigate. - Affordable! We were on a gift certif, but checked out the rates before going (so we knew how much the certif was worth, ha) - Lobby internet and concierge. - Beach towels to check-out and go to other beaches. Cons: - Beach is across a rather busy road. - Pool is small (but who goes to HAWAII to sit at a pool?). - Boring. The rooms are nice, but as other reviewers have mentioned, its very similiar to a Holiday Inn or Hampton Inn. This isn't really a "con" but it might influence other travellers. We liked this hotel for its non-resort atmosphere. I don't even know if they offered room service? It really is similiar to a Holiday Inn. I'd guess that a lot of Hawaii residents would stay at this hotel when they travel, or airline staff members. The staff is very nice and accomodating, but it is definitely not a full-service hotel. Fine by us!

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 * Hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: cdn-family-of-three
Reviews.Content: Our family of three (myself, husband andn six yr old daughter) stayed at the Coast from Dec 24- Jan 4 and had a wonderful time. We found the staff to be very courteous and helpful, while giving off a very laid back vibe. Our one bdrm suite was very nice, and we found the mini fridge, sink and cupboard area to be very convenient. Our first day there we filled up on a few groceries which made mornings easier- we did eat at the hotel restaurant the second day there, but found the food to be very average and the servers, mostly very attractive Argentinians who tried very hard, were mostly confused and harried. We also oredered several snacks and lunched from the poolside cafe and found those to be very good, although we had to wait quite awhile for it to come. The pool is smaller than I had hoped, but really was very adequate- there were several families with children but the pool was never crowded. We never had any trouble getting a lounge chair and the towel guy was always when we needed fresh towels. The beach (Kamaole 1) is right across the street- great sandy beach with warm water and gentle to mediul sized waves, depending on the time of day. All in all I would recommend this hotel for its' convenience and location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in a central location”
Reviews.Author: ohmboy
Reviews.Content: If you want the full resort experience then look elsewhere. If you want a very nice place to stay while you explore the wonderful island of Maui then this is it. The only complaint we had was that despite booking 4 1/2 months ahead we were given a 1st floor room with a patio actually looking UP at the parking lot. After requesting a change we were given a much better 3rd floor room. This greatly enhanced the 7 nights we stayed in November. This room was always clean and smelled fresh after we returned from a day of exploring. There are plenty of local style eateries within walking distance, but you can also drive to many more. I would suggest Kihei Caffe, Da Kithcen, and Maui Thai. Speaking of driving, Maui has to be one of the easier places for a stranger to get around in. The streets are well marked and the other drivers are polite. Since it's an island I suppose it would be really hard to get lost. Yes, the beach is across the street and requires a short walk. Once you get there you'll find a very nice, sandy, life guard protected beach. Just go in the morning because the trade-winds kick up the sand in the afternoons. Don't restrict yourself to this one beach though. Beautiful beaches are everywhere! The hotel will let you check out beach towels so that's one less thing to pack. Rent a car. Relax. Don't stay in your room. Explore. Have a little fun! I heard the hotel has a nice pool. I didn't fly 4200 miles to sit by the pool although the heated spa is nice after a long day! I suggest that anyone considering a visit to Maui to research, research, research. Skip the day one orientation/breakfast. This will enable you to see the sunrise on Haleakala while you body clock is still on mainland time instead of listening to a sales pitch and eating small muffins. If you decide like we did that you would like a nice hotel that is central to all the island has to offer then this just may be the place for you. We did and probably will again.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable old reliable”
Reviews.Author: goldenboy
Reviews.Content: Just a short return en route to The Gig Island. It is still relaxing with a large pool and 2 hot tubs. The evening entertainment needs revitalizing.

Reviews.Title: “OK for One Night”
Reviews.Author: Amberly
Reviews.Content: This hotel was far from the beachside condo we stayed in the at the begining of our trip on kaanapali beach and we paid almost exactly the same price. For the area I hear it is a good deal, however it is a kind of long walk across the street to the beach. Our room was on the bottom floor in a dark corner and the lanai was unusable beacuse of a large air conidtioning unit and foliage that grew over it. The room seemed a little dirty and smelled smoky as well. The bathroom floor was obviously not washed recently. Granted we booked this hotel at the last minute so we may have been in one of the worst rooms (at least I hope it was the worst). The pool was nice and the open air bar was fun with live music at night time. The TV was very bad, tiny and bad reception. I would compare the room quality to that of a roadside Holiday Inn. Overall I would probably not stay here again and would not reccommend it to a friend for anything longer than one night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: JTres67
Reviews.Content: Maui Coast Hotel was a Great Stay - It's location makes it convient to much of the island and also much of Kihei's shopping and dining. The hotel is very nice in the common areas. However, the rooms I'd equate with a very clean Hampton Inn (Just a regular old hotel room) The rooms are in much need of updating. With that said - they were exceptionally clean. It was also very nice to have a mini fridge and small bar sink. The pool was small but nice and very well maintained. It is about 2 blocks from the beach (one over and one down) you can see the beach from the hotel if you are up high enough. Many airline employees stay here. I'd guess because they give good deals and the rooms are clean as well as the staff being very helpful and nice. I'd stay here again - it is an affordable nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: brownie
Reviews.Content: We booked our entire vacation thru Pleasant Holidays 6 months prior to leaving. Can't say enough about the Maui Coast Hotel. It's very centrally located for all the great exciting places to visit in Maui. Stayed for 2 weeks at this hotel and never had one single complaint. We did our laundry for free, which was located on 3 different floors. Very clean and the pool was great and open til 10pm everynight which was a treat. Sept. is one of the slowest months in Maui, but this hotel was always busy which is a good sign. We would recommend this place to every type of traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel, Just Eat else where”
Reviews.Author: starhealer
Reviews.Content: The dinning room food is very good, That is where it stops. All the wait staff but one male waiter who was very friendly, and prompt with our order ( he server our first breakfast ) were terrible. The female bartender was nice, and even corrected our drink order, after over hearing what we told the waiter we wanted but when he repeated our order to her he mixed it up. One waitress actuallty huffed when she came to our table and was abrupt with us. When I asked her are you ok she said we are short staffed AGAIN and we have been busy all morning. Poor girl never did smile.( she had 4 tables ) But the hotel was nice, and the pool bar area is beautiful with live music that is soothing, not loud or rowdy. Nice place to stay, just eat else where. Our stay was fron Aug. 24-26. Then we stayed else where till Sept. 3.

Reviews.Title: “August 22-23 Maui Coast Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FromPacifica
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Maui Coat Hotel from August 22-23 and, after coming from the Westin Villas, we realized we should have started low and ended high on the trip. This hotel is comparable to a Best Western or Howard Johnson's. Nothing spectacular but good clean rooms. Furniture and furnishings are outdated and our room on the 2nd floor was quite musty and could have used the benefits of a dehumidifier (the pictures in the July 7, 2006 posting are accurate). We paid $175/night which is more than I'm normally willing to pay...but this is Maui. Check-in was easy and welcoming and the pool and spa were nice. Overall, it's a good clean, inexpensive (Maui cost) alternative to most of the overpriced hotels and is a good place to rest your head.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at the Maui Coast”
Reviews.Author: farmerjohn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Coast Hotel for 5 nights in August of 2006. This hotel is in the quite Kihei area of Maui. If you are looking for glitzy resorts, you may be happier in the Wailea or Kaanapali area. The Maui Coast Hotel is located about a block from a very nice and spacious beach. The hotel grounds were well maintained and landscaped. The pool area was nice although I thought it was a little small. However, we never had any trouble finding loungers regardless of what time we went to the pool. The loungers were in nice condition and plenty of towels were provided for pool use. The pool and pool area were kept clean. There is also a bar/grill area by the pool to get food and drinks. We ordered lunch from the grill one day and thought the food was good. Our room was what they refer to as an Alcove Suite. This meant it was larger than a standard room and had a jetted tub and a fridge. The room was plenty large and had a separate seating area. I thought the bedding was old and needed to be updated. We were somewhat surprised on day three to see a semi unloading soft goods in the parking lot and we then found a new bedspread in our room. Although the new bedspread was very nice, they left the old blankets. The furniture in the rooms is also somewhat outdated and needs to be changed. The room was clean and we had timely maid service every day. The hallways and public areas in the hotel were also clean and well maintained. All of the staff that we interacted with were friendly and helpful. Overall we had a very pleasant stay and received exactly what we paid forâ€”nothing more, nothing less.

Reviews.Title: “This is where I will stay next time”
Reviews.Author: radiology_woman
Reviews.Content: We were unhappy with our other accomodations and booked this place at the last minute at an amazing rate. It was awesome. It is rated as 3 stars but it felt like 5 stars. Lots of parking. The room was large with a balcony. Pool and hottub were great. Free internet. We were going to go out for dinner, but the local musician playing at the pool bar encouraged us to eat there. The food was great because you can order from the main restaurant and listen to the music by the pool. It was the best meal we had in Maui. The only disadvantage is that it is not on the beach, but one of the best beaches in Maui is a block away. We will definitely stay here next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Relatively inexpensive in Kihei Town”
Reviews.Author: suzyav8trix
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 1 night here over the 4th of July holiday. We booked a room at the last minute through one of the travel sights (Travelocity) and got a rate of $215 for a standard room. I had to do a double take because only 1 sight was offering this rate, all others started at $240 or $245, unless you were a triple A member. Also, some sights showed no availability -- so we made sure we had all the phone numbers and customer service numbers before leaving home, just in case. Check-in was swift and friendly and without a hitch. The whole hotel is non-smoking (yea!) The open air lobby was large, but not cave-like and nicely decorated. We opened the door to our room and we had been up-graded to a 1-bedroom suite -- one of their best rooms! The bathroom appeared to be equipped for handicapped persons; however, this was on the 5th floor about as far away from the elevator as possilble. This made for a very, very quiet stay for us, but if one of us were truly handicapped, you'd think the room would be closer to the elevator and/or on a lower floor. The king size bed had it's own bedroom with a Juliett balcony and TV and closet. The bed was ok (I love Marriott, Westin, & Sofitel beds -- so I'm spoiled). No feather pillows (and me, leaving my favorite down travel pillow in a hotel room last year...I guess I should order myself a new one...) There were 5 pillows for the 2 of us, which was nice for reading in bad and planning the next day's activities. The separate living area had a sofa-sleeper, which we had no use for, a table and 2 chairs and a TV. There was probably more to this suite, but we didn't spend a lot of time in our room and when we were there, we were on the lanai, or the bedroom, or the bathroom. The lanai was large with 2 chairs and a small table. The view was OK. The Maui Coast Hotel only has "garden" views. Our lanai faced a condo complex and some nicely land-scaped grounds. The view to the left was up the mountain that leads to Hale'akala crater and was quite pretty, especially as the sun came up in the morning. And if you looked to your right, you could see a bit of the ocean through the trees. I'm a very picky person. I do not stand for dirty or smelly hotel rooms. If there's mold in the bath or hairs on the sink or anything else that could be cleaned up easily, I figure that if the maids cannot clean the easy stuff, then what is lurking that I can't see? Happily, this hotel room was clean. No mold. No hairs. No dusty corners. My only negative comment would be that the carpet was very light color with a raised pattern and could use a deep-shampoo, or replacement, even. The raised areas definitely showed the dirt. In-room coffee, hair dryer, refrigerator -- we had everything we needed. I thought the coffee we made in the made tasted horrible -- like cleaning chemicals -- my husband thought it was fine and drank the whole pot. Maybe it was "just me". I sent him to the lobby to see if he could get me some different coffee and he came back with 2 cups and it was slightly macademia nut flavored and wonderfully strong, too! Overall, our room was fine for 1 night for us. We knew we had not booked a resort, or even an ocean view. We had a last minute opportunity to go to Maui and our hotel choices were limited. That said, I'm glad we stayed here. Kihei town was lovely -- gotta go to Kihei Cafe for breakfast -- and a great "base" for us, with an ABC store a very short walk away and a beach across the street. We could've spent a lot more money and not have been any more satisfied. We did drive by the 2 hotels in Kahului, near the airport, where the rooms were less expensive. I'm so glad we didn't stay there -- not a good location for us and the town itself left a lot to be desired. In fact, surprisingly, we couldn't find an ABC store in Kahului to pick up some last minute souvenirs. And turned to Longs Drugs, instead -- just not the same! Once again, the Maui Coast was a clean, comfortable hotel in a good location at a reasonble price. Thanks fellow trip-advisors who had written informative reviews that helped us to make this choice. No, it is not a resort. If you want a resort, chances are, you'll have to pay significantly more for those amenities. This was perfect for us -- a younger, middle-aged couple with no kids who wanted a place to stay to use as a "base" for exploring and dining out. Aloha. Oh, I almost forgot -- the Maui Coast does not charge for parking!

Reviews.Title: “The Maui Coast Grows on You”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June this year. The room was large enough with a fridge, TV and table but rather gloomy with little daylight and a very small lanai which we never bothered to use. However on the upside the lack of sunshine entering the room meant that it stayed cool and we hardly needed to use the air conditioning. Our room was on the ground floor and the hotel guide in the room suggested using the spy holes on the door to check if anyone was outside before leaving the room and locking it when in the room. This made me a little apprehensive. The bathroom was fine - a half bath with shower over the bath. They were a little stingy with the soap, body lotion and shampoo - not replacing these as they were used. We loved the pool and hot tubs and especially enjoyed swimming when the pool was floodlit. Awesome lying on your back looking up at the stars. During the day there were free towels for use at the pool which was a good service. Plenty of sun loungers and a nice shady area to escape to if you'd had enough sun. The food at the poolside bar was very good - particularly enjoyed mahi mahi and chips washed down with mai tais. Different singers each night who were good. A big plus point was the free use of the internet - good for keeping in touch with family and friends. Staff had a low key approach but were helpful if you needed to ask them anything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for hotel in South Maui”
Reviews.Author: gaa
Reviews.Content: We had two one-bedroom adjoining suites at a great rate we got by calling the hotel directly. The rooms were spotless and spacious. My husband did not think the king bed was comfortable, but I slept fine. The bedroom is separated from the living area by a door you can close, and there is also a sleeper sofa, refrigerator, wet bar, and large bathroom and jacuzzi tub. There is also a good sized patio with a table and two chairs. The pool is small, but you are across the street from one of the better beaches in Kihei, Kam I (although we prefer Wailea/Makea beaches, which are a drive). There is free internet access in the lobby, with a 15 minute limit if someone is waiting. The staff at the front desk was wonderful. There is a complementary shuttle (the hotel van) which will take you as far as the Grand Wailea, although we never used it. Stay away from the "orientation" with "complementary continental breakfast." It is by the pool, and does not even merit being called a continental breakfast with bad coffee and not enough fruit and mini-muffins to serve the small gathering. It is staffed by someone from the activities division of Expedia, who is obviously on commission and is not very interested in answering your questions or helping you---she is not a concierge and only wants to sell you her tours. She has a canned, fast paced speech and did not want to be interrupted. She quickly went back to her desk to sell tours. She was quite a contrast to the very helpful people at the desk, who will give you maps and recommendations. Within walking distance are some good places to eat (DaKitchen, Bada Bings) and some fun inexpensive shops/open air markets for browsing. A great place to stay if you are not looking for luxury. The airlines use this hotel, and they seem to have many repeat guests.

Reviews.Title: “We are very picky-AND we really loved this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Fritzandlacy
Reviews.Content: We are very picky-AND we really loved this hotel!! Immaculate hotel with friendly staff and very inexpensive for such a great location. The rooms were modern and had high speed Internet. The pool is small compared to others, but very clean with drink/food service. FREE LAUNDRY!! We could not have asked for a better hotel. We researched many hotels and had trouble finding a hotel with good reviews and that fit our budget. Maui Coast was perfect. Front desk was so friendly, upgraded us, helped us with dinner reservations, directions... We would stay here again in a heart- beat!

Reviews.Title: “Really Really Bad”
Reviews.Author: lightsleeper1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 255. We had planned on staying the whole weekend, but we checked out first thing the next morning. The hotel looks nice on the outside, but room 255 was very old and shoddy, worse than a Motel6. I would use the word "fleabag." Bedsheets were soiled, blankets had cigarette burnholes. I am not exaggerating. Beds were hard and uncomfortable. The A/C unit was weak and made the room smell. Furnishings were outdated and creepy. A marble endtable? A 14" TV? Bathroom showerhead was one of those flowsavers, very disappointing. The room we had was way in the back; it was quiet, but it had a view of a dirty unlandscaped courtyard. We also found ants and flying bugs in the room. We couldn't sleep it was so disgusting. The front desk personnel were pleasant enough; they actually tried to move us to a different room when we checked in, I guess they knew the horror we were in for. We checked out the next day, and will never go back. Maybe your room will be better, but I wouldn't risk it. Stay at a nice hotel chain, like the Hilton or Hyatt or Renaissance. The worst thing is to visit a beautiful place like Maui and wreck it with a dumpy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just finished up a week at Maui Coast Hotel. If the 5*'s will break your budget and you want to save a few dollars to splurge on the nice meals at the five stars, this is the hotel for you. Located in Kihei, great central location !!!!, it's just north of the fancy resorts. The room prices are reasonable... we have an alcove suite, which was over 500sf with a jacuzzi tub, nice touch! The pool has a pool bar and restaurant (drinks and food reasonable priced...in Wailea resort a drink will cost you over $10), and evening live music... inexpensive breakfast as well. (tip, order off the $4.95 section for lighter appetites...otherwise your breakfast will be huge HUGE huge) I could not find one negative thing to say about Maui Coast.... loved that we had use of free washer and dryer, just need to provide own detergent. Great great hotel... I would definately recommend and go back, the money we saved was used to dine at some of the finer restaurant resorts... Thumbs up to Maui Coast! PS ask for a higher floor, we could see ocean from our lanai...

Reviews.Title: “A local's secret”
Reviews.Author: Hokuokalani
Reviews.Content: This local's secret has been a favorite of mine, even when I lived on Maui. It is set back from the road, so it is quiet and the price is better than the larger/noisy resorts in Wailea. There is a shopping center that is only a couple of blocks away. Lots of shopd and resturants that don't stretch the budget out of shape. The free nightly entertainment at the pool bar is a great way to relax after a day at the beach (just across the street) or after one of many adventures through out the island. Locals stop by to listen to their favorite entertainers. The rooms are clean and roomy. The closet in our room was too tiny, especially for 2 ladies! Another great feature is the welcome breakfast to aquaint travelers to the island with the many activities available on Maui. Lots of self parking, so you are not at the mercy of valets. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Free computers in the lobby to check email or check-in online for your flight. If you are looking for a nice place to call home while you are out exploring Maui, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I just returned from Hawaii. We traveled to Maui, then on to Kona on the big island. This was my first time to Maui! I love this hotel. My experience was great from the time I spoke with Penny on the phone to make the reservation, until the day my family and I had to leave! The next time we go to Hawaii, we'll stay on Maui longer and we will most definately stay at the Maui Coast Hotel! I can't say enough about this hotel and the staff! The live hawaiian music around the pool was such a perfect touch! I RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL and can hardly wait to return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: SHS77JJ
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel rooms on the upper floors are much nicer than the ones on the ground level floors (1 and 2). There can be slight problems with the toilets and ants on the first two floors, so request a room on the upper level. I would give this hotel a harsher review, however, ants seem to be the order of the day at most of the lodgings in Kihei on the ground levels. The room decor is very nice and the suites are extremely spacious. The hotel lobby, pool and jacuzzi area and on-site restaurant are very nice. The hotel is centrally located to the beaches, shopping and dining which were a major plus, not to mention there's free internet access if you must stay connected. Call the hotel directly and negotiate a rate which is what we did and I couldn't have asked for a better place to stay (upper floors :-) for the bargin price I got...

Reviews.Title: “Maui secret location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got back from Maui yesterday. We stayed at the Maui Coast Hotel for a week. The location is great for people on budget vacation. This hotel was a very clean hotel. The staff was very nice and very helpfull. Maui Coast Hotel is across a beautiful sandy beach. There is a plenty of good resonable hawaii style food within walking distance. Our favorite was DA Kicthen Restuarant. You get lot of food for two people under $20.00. The only negative thing about the hotel was the small pool. But in my opinnion if you go to Maui you should be on the beach. We had the one bedroom suite. The room was big and the whirlpool was nice to have especially after a 7 hour flight. The refrigerator was nice to have especially if you traveling with small children so you can fill it up with milk, juice and water. The Hotel would be perfect if it had a microwave in it. If you have a rental car I recommend to drive up the street to Waliea. A very richie area. I felt like I was in Bevery Hill, CA. Maybe in the furture we will save for a 4/5 star hotel. Another thing about this hotel location is it about 50% local and 50% tourist. To me that was a plus. We check out Kannapili area. To me it felt like I was in Florida beach location. To many people and they are all tourist plus you are force to pay high $$ for food. You really felt like you were a local at the Maui Coast Hotel location. In fact I think the Maui coast hotel was the only hotel in the area. It was surrounded by fancy homes and condos value over $400,000. Like I said eairlier there are lots of stores, bars, restaurants, (Dennys, LULU, DA Kitchen, Maui Tacos, and Freds Restaurants). When we return will for sure stay at Maui Coast Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in Maui, won't break your wallet”
Reviews.Author: Matthew Y
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a small little hotel. I'm from the East Coast, I've never heard of the Coast brand Hotels. Apparently it's a small chain in the West Coast and Pacific. About a 15 min drive from the airport. We checked in at around 3 but the room was not ready, was told it'll be ready in 15 mins. Waited for 10 mins in the lobby and the staff informed me our room is ready. We received a garden view in the 2nd floor. Nice size room, bathroom was nice also. Beds were comfortable, empty fridge inside the room, wireless internet access was available for $15/day? (don't remember exactly) but you can get free internet in the lobby b/c they have 2 computers for their guests to use. There's a 15min rule and most ppl followed it. We saw alot of airline personell checking in, must be a favorite with the airlines. My major griped is that they don't have central A/C, each room is equipped with a seperate A/C unit. It can get quiet cold if you leave the A/C on before going to bed b/c their A/C unit don't have a power saver option. If you don't turn the A/C on, it can get hot and stuffy. Self-parking is free, they have ample spaces available. A nice/uncrowded beach is across the street. We didn't try the pool or Spices restaurant, but they looked nice. Overall, this was a nice place to stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “good deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: swbrad
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Maui Coast and we were again satisfied customers. Good price, especially with AAA discount. Big room with a decent sized refridgerator. Nice pool area with bar gives you the feeling of being at one of the big expensive resorts with out the crowds, although the pool was a little on the cold side. Good happy hour drink prices and entertainment in the evenings. Only complaints were the vent in the bathroom was worthless, so every time you take a shower it steams up the whole room. Also they put us down the hall from an area where the were renovating, so we had to walk thru a construction zone to get to our room from the lobby. The 2 computers off the lobby for internet access is a nice touch but you always had to wait in line to get on them.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good deal overall”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days in early September as the first part of our honeymoon. We had reserved a studio room but they upgraded us to a suite which was nice. Rooms were plain & clean but there was a very slight dusty smell on the first day. Overall we were really happy with the hotel. It's in an area full of timeshares that perhaps isn't as scenic as some of the other more expensive hotel strips. We didn't spend a lot of our time in Kihei - mostly just for sleeping. Kihei was convenient for driving to the beaches and most of the Maui attractions. The hotel is very reasonably priced especially if you are a AAA or CAA member. There is a grocery store a 2min drive away - though there isn't a kitchenette in any of their rooms. Highly recommend eating at San Sei - over in the Foodland plaza. We've eaten a lot of Japanese before and the food here was amazing. We got the two person set dinner. After drinks, taxes, tip it can be a bit pricey, but it was definitely worth it. It was packed on the night we went, so probably a good idea to make reservations. The breakfast at hotel restaurant Spices was not that great. Also lunch at SeaWatch restaurant in Wailea's Golf Course was yummy with great views of the water.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic deal for your money!!!”
Reviews.Author: bigbart66
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great deal for your money. The official photos you see don't really do it justice. The rooms are really quite large, especially for the price you are paying - we had a regular room with double beds, and you could easily fit a small family in the room with no problems. They give you an EMPTY(!!!) fridge, which most hotels charge $50 for emptying, and on each floor there is a FREE washer and dryer - just bring your soap!! The pool is great - it is not too deep with steps leading down into the water, so it is easy to get in and out off ... there is a small baby pool at one end and a hot tub at the other end. There is no pool service as such, but the bar area is at the pool area, so it is pretty convenient. There is lots of parking, most times near your hotel room; there are large supermarkets very close by, so it is easy to shop for water, sodas etc. Kihei is really central to everywhere; you are 15 minutes from Big Beach, and 35 minutes away from Lahaina and Kaanapali in the other direction. The beach is across the main road from the hotel, but you can walk to it, or take your car with you, and park in the parking spots across the road. Pretty easy all round. The hotel is buzzing on a Saturday night with local musicians, singers etc ... and because it is a residential area, things have to go quiet around 10ish! The happy hour is from 4-7pm with $3 mai tais, and $2.50 beers! Brent, the concierge, was FANTASTIC!!! He helped us arrange our whole week, and got us great seats at shows, preferential treatment etc., and his prices were better than most of the independent activity wholesalers in the area. I would highly recommend this hotel. The staff there could not do enough to help us; there are two free internet computers in the lobby, and eveyone is respectful of the time they are on it if others are waiting; all in all a great deal for your money!!

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a suite. It needed maintenance work but was "OK". We are not complainers so we just stayed in that room; we probably should have requested a move to a different room. But the flight is so long, and we were so glad to be there we went out to explore! When we did sit on the lanai, there were smokers under us, and their smoke drifted up to our lanai.(this is a smoke-free hotel so smokers have to smoke outside) Our room was also near the air conditioners so the noise from them was loud. Good things: Pleasant personnel at front desk, very helpful. Great sunset view from the front elevator!! Pool facilities good. Restaurant: we went over one morning and although there were several empty tables, we were told (by the very bored appearing hostess) it would be a 'wait of 20-30 minutes' (we didn't bother to wait). We did eat there the last night; it was so noisy between the music and the street noises...and then my husband must have had a bout of food poisoning as he was up all night.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and convenient place to stay on Maui”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for four nights and was very pleased. Got a good rate as a AAA member, but suspect better rates may have been available. Room on the first floor was good sized and comfortanble and well maintained. Positives: Helpful staff Nice pool Useful location. Not in a fancy area, but 1/2 block from a very good beach. Very convenient in the center of the island for driving to the things most want to see (Road to Hana, Haleakala park, Lahaina, Maui Oceen Center). Found quite a few excellent restaurants within a ten minute drive. Negatives: Parking lot seemed to fill up early, so had to park some nights at the far end of the walk, but some extra walking is probably good for us. Other: Wireless internet (not sure of cost) in lobby and in some rooms, but did not reach ours. Two internet terminals with 15 minute limit that always seemed to have one or two people waiting. Can't really walk to much of interest except for the beach nearby. Ordinary shopping (groceries, drug store) a bit too far to walk, but you are probably going to have a car when visitying Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: U2fan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Maui Coast Hotel for three nights at the end of our tour of Hawaii. It's a nice hotel - the rooms were spacious and the extra king sized bed was so comfy! The staff were really friendly. The pool side bar was lively and it had entertainment laid on every night. The hotel offers a complimentary shuttle minibus to anywhere in the local vicinity, which was useful as we didn't have a car. We used it to get to the shops at Wailea and also to Mulligans on the Blue (don't forget to tip the driver). There's also free internet access in the Reception area. Kihei was a bit too spread out for our liking - there's no real centre to it. If we return, we'd probably stay in Wailea or north of Lahania.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend..”
Reviews.Author: generx
Reviews.Content: Stayed just last weekend for a couple of nights on the last leg of a 2 week island hopping trip since it's only ~15-20 minutes to the airport from this hotel. I've stayed at other Coast Hotel properties on the West Coast before and the service/rooms were comparable. Got an alcove suite on the 5th floor, not much of a view anywhere since the hotel is not really close to the ocean but had no complaints, room was quiet and comfortable and price was fair. Happy hour and Hawaiian music poolside are also a nice feature. Although I didn't use them, the 2 free computers in the lobby were a big plus for those who just can't unplug. For those that compain that the pool was tiny, get off your duff and go to the beach. You can lounge poolside anywhere. Also, please tip well (especially the housekeeping staff who works the hardest) you'll get treated better.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Maui Coast Hotel for our honeymoon in February. For $260 a night, we received the Ku'uipo (Sweetheart) Package and we were very pleased. Not only did we have a very large one bedroom suite with a living room area and small refrigerator, but that price also included our Chrysler Sebring convertible rental car and our breakfast that was delivered to our room every morning! What a good deal! Our room was more than acceptable and the bathroom was HUGE! Everything was very clean and the cleaning crew always kept new sheets, towels, soaps, etc. in our room. The lanai was large enough for us to sit out there and eat our breakfast, drink our coffee, and listen to all the wonderful sounds of Maui! We woke up every morning at 6:30 just to enjoy and take everything in about this beautiful island. Room service every morning was fast. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. They offered us great tips about how to see the island...such as leaving for the drive to Hana before 7am to beat most of the traffic. The computers in the lobby were always accessible and proved to be very helpful. I loved this hotel and immediately liked the openness of the lobby when we first drove up. Although, we never ate at the restaurant Spices and the drinks at the Tradewinds Poolside Cafe weren't that great. Overall, it was more than we ever imagined it would be and we will definitely be staying there again! Kihei is the place to stay if you want to get away from all the "touristy" places. This is where the locals live and there are many small shops and fast food places to stop for something quick and cheap. We're so glad we chose Kihei instead of Ka'anapali...too many people to really relax and enjoy your honeymoon. It's also not far from Wailea which has some gorgeous hotels...I suggest driving through and daydreaming about where you might stay the next time you have a little more money to burn. I suggest heading over to Activity Warehouse and sheduling all your Maui adventures. They are so nice and eager to know all about you and what brought you to Maui. They can get you in on things that are already booked and they love honeymooners! We signed up for the Maui Dinner Cruise on the Maui Princess and it was so romantic! My husband was a little sick, but the food was unbelievable and all the drinks were FREE! Don't forget the Dramamine! February was part of their whale season so we saw plenty of whales breech with the colorful, breathtaking sunset as their backdrop. Speaking of the whales, we were on a whale watching tour the next day (scheduled by Activity Warehouse) and took pictures of the amazing creatures. There's nothing like it! Through Activity Warehouse, we made plans to take surfing lessons with Hawaiian Ultimate Adventures. MAKE SURE YOU GET THE RIGHT DIRECTIONS! We got lost and we were 20 minutes late for our lesson. They had already started and we thought we were out of luck...BUT to our surprise, the instructor, "Surfer Mike", called me later that day and scheduled another lesson because he didn't want to ruin our honeymoon! He was awesome! We probably have some of our best memories of Maui because of "Surfer Mike"! Don't forget your underwater camera so someone can catch the moment you actually ride a wave! As far as gifts go, there are several stores in the Lahaina area but can be very expensive. If you're just looking for something cheap and reasonable for family back home, just head into an ABC Store and pick up some things...it will keep souvenir costs down! Make sure you get some real Hawaiian Shave Ice while you're there! Visit the Banyan Tree that shades almost a whole block and we were lucky because there was an art show there one day and we bought a few reproductions to enjoy at home. If you're there with a significant other and you want a romantic dinner, check out Plantation House Restaurant in Kapalua! It's well worth the drive (about 40 minutes in evening traffic) and the views are magnificent! My husband's parents gave this to us as a gift and we immediately made reservations when we arrived at our hotel. Make sure that you time your dinner so that you're sitting and watching the sunset over the island of Molokai. The restaurant is located on the Plantation Gulf Course and seems so far from everything. Entree prices range from about $19-$30. It's an island cuisine with a "splash" of Mediterranean. Get the Bananas Foster for two for a sweet ending to a romantic experience. As for the Road to Hana tour, do it once in your life! There are so many beautiful things in nature that you'll miss if you skip something like this! Yes, there are many tight curves and bridges and it takes at least 7 hours roundtrip if you are stopping to look. Like I mentioned earlier, start before 7am and go to the Shell gas station by the airport and pick up the "Road to Hana" guided tour tape/cd. It tells you where to stop and what different things are along the way. You might get confused if you don't make sure that you're on HANA HIGHWAY first...makes a big difference! Anyway, I hope all of this helped and my husband and I can't wait until we get back to Maui and will definitely be staying at the Maui Coast Hotel again if we're on a tight budget!

Reviews.Title: “Great start!”
Reviews.Author: ScandiPeacock
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel we stayed at during our island hopping Hawaii holiday. Great hotel in a (for us) perfect location. Walking distance to the market etc but not in the middle of it all. Beach over the road and a good pool area. We walked to Kihei Cafe every morning for a great breakfast. We did try the room service food - but only once.... Big bonus for this hotel for me was that they provided 2 computers with internet access in the lobby - free of charge (they asked you to limit your time to 15 minutes if others where waiting) so it was easy to pop down and keep in contact.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied - Great Value in Maui”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very clean rooms in a great location. Staff was average but the rooms were nice, clean, and large.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FrancesTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Maui Coast Hotel for four nights in late May and early June. I was very impressed with the beauty and cleanliness of the hotel. The landscaping and general feel of the hotel is very Hawaiian and comfortable. We decided to stay in Kihei since we planned on doing a lot of driving and sight seeing on the island rather than staying solely at a resort. For our decision, the Maui Coast hotel was wonderful. Very clean, friendly staff with a hotel activity planner in the lobby sponsored by Expedia. This made it very easy to plan dinner cruises, snorkeling trips, etc. The pool was very well maintained and the Spices restaurant was great for breakfast. The beach right across the street from the hotel was very nice, but not quite as nice as the beaches further south on S. Kihei Road. It is an easy drive down there towards the larger resorts and more manicured beaches. Kihei is a more developed area (tons of gas stations, shops and restaurants in strip malls) than the rest of the island. It is definitely a good idea to drive up towards the Kaanapali area to experience the more secluded resort-style Maui. We would definitely stay at the Maui Coast Hotel again when in Kihei!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice laid-back vacation”
Reviews.Author: T85
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our first long vacation on Maui and were very satisfied with the Maui Coast Hotel. We had stayed in the Waikiki area before and made a day trip to Maui and had to go back for more. We stayed in an alcove suite on the fourth floor which was very nice, actually larger than our room on Oahu. The room was clean with plenty of room for clothes and luggage as well as a large, clean bathroom. The hotel is just across the street from a very nice beach. There are some shops and restaurants within walking distance, but most require a car. Since seeing the sights on Maui requires a car anyway, this is not a problem. We had breakfast at Spices only one morning. It was good, but more than we wanted to eat before going to the beach each morning. We usually ate something light in the room, went to the beach early, then had all afternoon to explore the rest of the island, shop, and eat at different places. We drove around the entire island during our stay, went to Haleakala twice: once for the sunrise and once to hike a little, drove to Lahaina a few times, went to the Iao Needle, and went past Makena to the lava flow area. All in all, whenever we get a chance to come back to Maui we would definitely be willing to stay at the Maui Coast Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Coast Hotel for our honeymoon. The hotel had a relaxed feel and the service was wonderful. Though not right on the beach the hotel is in the perfect spot, set back from the road, and right across from the best beach in Kihei. Kihei is a little beach town great for those that want easy access to everything. Tips: Definitely check out Big Beach, the black sand beach on the road to Hana and snorkel at Molokini. Take some Dramamine for the road to Hana!!! and eat fresh pineapple - there's nothing like it.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Fulfilled”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My stay at Maui Coast in Kihei, Maui was spectacular. However, there is one problem regarding the customer service at the Tradewinds pool bar. I wanted to ask for service at the jacuzzi area, however, the waitress mentioned that she is too busy to entertain my friend and I. After exercising at the hotel workout site, I approached the bar again for drink orders and the waitress had the worst look as I asked her for drinks. I would understand that she is busy, remember, customer service is most important. Calmness and self-control is the utmost important component in dealing with customers. I was told by other customers that she had been acting like that all night. I will be traveling to Maui in June and I will be staying at the Maui Coast again, I am hopeful that this can be corrected. Please reply should you have dealt with this problem. Email me at www.frank.d.calvo@us.army.mil Thank you for your patience.

Reviews.Title: “definitely would go back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband were at the Maui coast hotel in April 2005. This is a great place to stay for the price. The hotel is very clean, the service is very efficient & friendly. A car is definitley required because everything is too far to walk. There is an ABC store ( general store) for essentials. The beach is across the street. It is not very impressive but if you have a car you can drive down the coast to a different beach everyday. The drive to Lahaina is worth it. There are lots of shops along the coast for souvenirs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Maui”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from eight days in Maui, staying at the Maui Coast Hotel. My wife and I decided to stay here over a condo due mainly in part to the opinions of others on this site. We were not disappointed. The rooms were always clean and comfortable and the free internet access let us keep in touch with friends and family back home without expensive long distance calls. The staff was very polite and easy to deal with. And we found no bugs in our room (which seems to be a rarity in Maui hotel rooms). The Kihei location was near shopping, beaches, and easy access to the major highway to other parts of Maui. We really enjoyed the Tradewinds Pool Bar-the gentleman singing and playing the guitar added a nice touch to the evenings. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ziggy1960
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at the Maui Coast Hotel and it was excellent! Located across the street from the beach, walking distance to lots of shops and restaurants. Great pool, with poolside restaurant and bar. Good Happy Hour drinks and prices! Live poolside entertainment nightly 6-9 pm. I hope I get to stay there again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: snickerseg
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our Maui vacation 2/14/05 - 2/24/05. The two things I liked best about this hotel were the location and the pool. The Kihei location was GREAT. We visited Lahina twice and then tried to stay away from it because there is only one way in and out of there and the road is always backed up, especially going into Lahina at dinnertime. The Kihei location has two access roads, S. Kihei along the ocean and 31 which is inland a bit. So, if one is busy, you can try the other and usually get where you want to go pretty quickly. Having a car (or motorcycle) on Maui is essential if you want to sightsee. Though, I noticed that the hotel had a lot of bicycles out front, I wondered if they rent them but I didn't ask. The pool was wonderful, offering lots of chairs, shaded and unshaded. It was always hoppin' but there always seemed to be just enough chairs for everyone. There is a separate hot tub in an alcove behind the pool that has lots of shaded chairs and is a bit quieter if the pool is quite active. One thing I didn't like is that people could smoke by the pool but we were able to avoid sitting by those folks and ran into the same problem at the beach and many of the restaurants so really, this has nothing to do with the pool. Just something to keep an eye out for before you choose your chair. As for the room itself, well, it wasn't as good as I had hoped but I still thought it was good for the price (compared to brand name hotels and resorts that wanted upwards of $380 per night). We got the upgraded "Alcove Suite". The room layout was good and I liked having a fridge in the room to keep bottled water cold. We were able to put all of our electronics (laptop included) inside the in-room safe which was a nice feature. I LOVED the tub which was very clean. No matter how much sand I brought into that tub, the next day it sparkled... despite it being a bit "outdated". I also liked having free laundry on-site (yes, I actually did some laundry on my vacation). The sixth floor washers and dryers were brand new and required no coins to operate. Because of the free laundry we were able to travel a little lighter (I'm sure my husband doubts that after carrying my suitcase). And, like many have said before, I saw no bugs inside the hotel, which, I understand is terrific for a tropical place. My husband used the free internet access downstairs a couple of times but it was always very busy. This hotel could improve by 1) replacing the carpet in the rooms 2) cleaning the couch upholstry 3) getting bigger sheets for the king beds 4) getting a second concierge and 5) adding more internet access stations and/or adding a wireless internet option which would probably take some of the burden off of the two free stations in the lobby. Our room had a cigarette burn on the carpet in one area and a mystery stain (the size of a half dollar) in another area. Thankfully, the carpet was otherwise okay, not smelly or sticky or anything, just a couple of burns/stains that were an eyesore. On our last day, we saw some contractors measuring the carpet in the hallway presumably for a quote. Hopefully they do the rooms as well because they are more in need of carpet than the hallway! The couch upholstry was dirty, but we didn't really use the couch except to put our suitcases on so it wasn't a big deal, it just would be nice to see this change as it, like the carpet, is a real eyesore. As for the sheets, we had a king bed and for some reason, the bottom sheet was not large enough to stay tucked around the mattress properly. It was as if they were using flat queen sheets on a king bed. As for the concierge, we tried to work with them to get some activities and dinner reservations set up but they were always busy when we visited so we ended up setting stuff up ourselves. Maybe they need two concierges if they plan to book the hotel solid which is what happened when we were there. As noted by other folks, don't expect a view, except from the front elevator! The beach is across the street but you need to walk a block or so left to access it. I highly recommend renting a beach umbrella, both Boss Frog's and Snorkel Bob's are down the street and they rent umbrellas, chairs, and more. Makena beach is the best beach (way down past Wailea) but we had some good afternoons at Kamaole too. Despite the many reviews of great food at the pool, we never ate there, though I had a couple smoothies while sunbathing which were great. We did try Spices on the last two days for breakfast and it was very good, though, the options for $4.95 breakfast as advertised on the sign out front were very limited. The service was a little slow on the day we ate around 9am but when we ate late (around 10:45a) it was fine. The KKO(?) is also within walking distance and serves breakfast with an ocean view. Denny's is down the street too and we heard tons of complaints about that. Our favorite breakfast place was the Big Wave which was in one of the shopping centers north of the hotel, maybe Azuka marketplace? Anyway, I thought this hotel was a good value. Maybe a little outdated but clean in the places that count, and a good location. We'd consider staying here again. Sorry to write such a lengthy review. I used these reviews when I booked my trip and found that the ones with the most details were the most helpful. Have a great time in Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: FrozenNorth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Coast from February 5 - 16/05. The staff was really friendly and there were no bugs! The room was ok but is starting to look very tired. Although we were in a no smoking room there were cigarete burns in the carpet and coffee and side tables. The bathrooms are very plain and need to be upgraded. The Maui Coast needs to be refurbished or it is really going to be a dump in the next 10 yrs. Dont bother eating at the Hotels restaurant.. service is bad and food is worse. There are some really good places to eat but you will have to walk about 8 blocks to get a great breakfast. The best place is the Kihei Caffe. What I mostly found disappointing was the location. I had not been to Maui in 20 yrs so was very disappointed at the uncontolled building on every square inch of land available! The hotel is not in the best of areas and I found it upsetting to have to walk past the drunks and druggies on the way to the beach. The area is noisy, the traffic is brutal and we did not feel safe at all walking at night. There are very few street lamps and a lot of dark and creepy areas that if I was a woman alone would never venture out alone. The beaches and the ocean of course are lovely and its easy to forget what you are paying everynight for accomodations. I think the best bet in Maui is to find a private rental condo with the best features you can afford. My recommendation is to stay out of Kihea and if you can find a deal try Wailea. You will probably get a lot more bang for your buck. You will probably have to pay more however Kihei and Wailea are worlds apart in the kind of people that hang out in each area.The minute you leave Kihei and enter Wailea you know why you came to Maui! Maui's housing and development growth is out of control and it is so sad to see this beautiful place starting to become another Honolulu.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Really nice grounds, I had a standard room, bottem of the barrel, and even that was really nice. The pool was awesome, the help in the hotel was great. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. Great location. I will definatly go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Coast in Kihei in mid-December 2004. We chose this hotel after reading consistently positive reviews on this website. We were not disappointed and would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a 3 to 4 star hotel. THE HOTEL The hotel is nice and is very clean. No bugs. While the hotel cannot be classified as a 'luxury' hotel, it is far more attractive than a Holiday Inn and as nice as some Marriott hotels. Unless you are a person who needs a Hilton, Four Seasons, etc., you should be quite happy there. The pool area is nice, clean, and gets lots of sunlight throughout the day. Lots of free beach towels which you can borrow for the day even if you're going off-premises to the beach. There is a pool-side bar/restaurant which is good. We did not try the main restaurant, as neither the menu nor the atmosphere appealed to us. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Parking is free and convenient, as is the internet access. We received a free upgrade to a suite that was quite nice - it had a fridge, safe, balcony, double sink, hairdryer and jacuzzi tub (but the tub was far too powerful to use comfortably, believe it or not). If possible, ask for a room facing the mountains (i.e. not overlooking the hotel's parking lot). From our balcony we had a view of beautiful mountains and the ocean. You will be hard pressed to find a hotel in Kiehei built right on the beach - you'll have to go to Wailea for that and pay a lot more $. In our view it's just not worth the extra expense, as all of the beaches are nearby, accessible to the public, and none were crowded. LOCATION & NEARBY ATTRACTIONS The hotel location is great for a number of reasons: (1) you are across the road from a park and beach and only a few minutes' drive to several other great beaches; (2) it is close to several good restaurants (definitely try Stella Blues (great fish and dessert), Five Palms Beach Grille Kihei (delicious international cuisine with a beautiful and romantic sunset view outdoors), and Sansei Kihei (fantastic and creative sushi in a fun & relaxed atmosphere), but we did not enjoy Roy's Kihei at all); (3) it is very close to virtually anything you may need - i.e. groceries, restaurants, bars, gas, rentals of snorkelling/diving/boogieboarding/beach gear; (4) it is a few minutes' drive from Wailea and you have access to a great beach in Wailea just behind a couple of the fancy hotels there - all the fun and beauty at half the price!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: mitchmurr
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Good location, right across from the beach and about a 12 minute walk to lot's of restaurants and bars. Free laundry on site too!!! Poolside bar closes by 9:30PM, only drawback but only a small thing. Very nice overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: loveamerica
Reviews.Content: We've been meaning to write this review for ages. We've stayed at the Maui Coast twice and each time we've been given a complimentary upgrade to a suite with a jacuzzi bath. This is a great hotel and it represents excellent value for money as well. Although it isn't directly on the beach, the beach is just across the road. All the staff we met were friendly and efficient. Hi Ellie on reception if you are reading this. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Cliean”
Reviews.Author: lizzygirl
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the MCH during Memorial Day week (off season), so we got a great deal. I was very nice & convenient to nice & uncrowded beaches. It is across the street from the beach & set back, so it is very quiet. There are no ocean veiws anywhere, however. The staff was supernice with great advice about Haleakala trip (leave at 3am & take the extra blankets with you!!). I never saw a single bug & they have the bigger sq ft mini fridges! We had a ground floor basic room that was on the same level as the garden & it was very nice. There were little birds everywhere & lots of plumeria trees, so it smelled wonderful. The bathrooms were clean and large, but the bed was a little hard. the small sofa also folds out. They charge $1 per phone call, but have free parking. I would stay there again in low season, but high season prices are too much.

Reviews.Title: “very nice!”
Reviews.Author: MrsO99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Maui Coast Hotel over Christmas (Dec.22-29) and had a lovely time. Kihei has great beaches and lots of little shops and restaurants to keep you in budget. Check out the delicious salad bar at the natural food store, sorry forget the name but only one on the strip. The hotel lobby had a beautiful Christmas tree and very friendly staff. The housekeepers deserve to be noted for their courteous and accomodating manner.The rooms are a bit plain, but clean, and who cares, you're out all the time. We brought a toaster and kettle so we could stay out of the restaurants for breakfast and stay in our pjs. The room has a good size fridge,a sink and coffe maker. The pool is great and service from the poolside cafe is very good. Did not try out the restaurant(Tradewinds) so no review to give. Computers to keep in touch with everyone at home a great feature. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place was great. We stayed there for 3 days before moving to a condo. It was reasonably priced so we didn't expect much so we were surprised that the service was so excellent. They were always friendly, smiling and welcoming us. The rooms were very clean and I would compare them to a Holiday Inn. The pool area is great and the pool bartenders were especially pleasant. You are a short walk to the beach and shops and restaurants. There was a slight problem (caused by our travel agent) with the way our rooms were set up but the desk clerk fixed it right away. If you are looking for a clean, reasonably priced hotel that gives deluxe service this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from visit to Maui 11/22-11/24. Hotel staff was very courteous. Room was clean & comfortable didn't experience any trouble with bugs. There isn't a good clear view of ocean from the room but a 3-4 minute walk to the beach is quick enough to get to see the sunset. It is in a good central location to get to the sights of the island. Would highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a good, clean hotel. Anyway, you would be crazy to spend too much time in your room when you are on this beautiful island! Get out & enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy, but clean.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from two weeks at this hotel and I would stay there again. The staff is very friendly and because my husband I and were meeting there for his R&R during his year in Iraq, they upgraded us to a suite at no charge. They also sent us a rose in a bud vase and a large bag full of packaged snacks, suntan lotion and other essentials. The rooms were clean. I would say that the carpets and furniture are showing slight wear, but if you are looking for a clean place to sleep, this hotel is a great value. I would say the kindness of the staff made this hotel a nice place. The things I did not like about this place was the restaurant and the pool bar. "Spices" is the name of the restaurant and I thought the servers were all pretty rude. They do the bate and switch on the prices by advertising a $9.95 dinner...only to find out that's just a salad and there really is no $9.95 dinner. Also, I was turned off by the fact that there is a $7 minimum if you eat there for lunch and a number of items that were $6.99. This meant that when I tried to order a burger by myself one day they told me I needed to buy more. I was really turned off about this since I was staying there for two weeks. Also, don't order a drink at the pool. They are also rude and the drinks are just not good.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Coast Hotel - 2 thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Maui and stayed at the Maui Coast (Alcove Suite) from Oct 15-20th. We enjoyed our stay! Free internet access and laundry facilities (on every other floor) were nice features. Staff were helpful and friendly. Rooms were clean, TV in both bedroom and living room. Double sink and large bathroom was a huge plus. Very soundproof. Rooms beginning to show a little wear but overall excellent value for the $. Narrow parking spaces. Hotel definitely Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Maui Coast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Maui Coast for 3 nights. It was excellent value. Our room was clean and comfortable with a fridge and a small balcony. The use of the free internet was a great feature, although the two computers were constantly in use and we usually had to wait to use them.We also appreciated the free laundry facility. Our only complaint would be the standard of the food in the restaurant and the staff who were unfriendly unlike the staff in the hotel itself who were very obliging. This is not a major problem because there are lots of nearby restaurants. We will be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Coast is Great!”
Reviews.Author: alvinb2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Maui Coast Hotel for 8 nights, Sept 15 through the 23. Nice and very clean room. No bugs to report at all. We were upgraded to the one bedroom suite 432 at no extra charge; we didnâ€™t even have to ask. Staff was very nice and helpful. Large bathroom is nice to have on a vacation. Bathroom shower is also very strong, unlike the ones in the mainland hotels. The bedroom has a large king size bed and TV. Living room is large with a TV, sofabed, small fridge, and a wet-bar. Thereâ€™s supposed to be an internet wi-fi in the room, but this room was in a dead-spot and no-way to connect to the internet, except dial-up. Do not connect by dial-up; you will be charge a whole lot of bucks! Just use the free internet access at the lobby. There is free laundry and dryer in each floor too. The beach across the street is nice, but Black Rock at the Sheraton is the best for snorkeling; lots of turtles and fish. We were lucky to see dolphins on our last day of our vacation at Black Rock. Maui Coast Hotel is a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Positive Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although not on the beach it was a great place to stay. The staff could not have been more friendlier or helpful. We were always given a warm greeting when we walked through the lobby. The spacious room was kept impeccably clean. The towels smelled good. The large jakuzzi tub and generous shower head were a luxury I appreciated. Our housekeeper gave us unexpected good service with extra attention to little details. The hotel is in a good and central location for reaching any part of the island. There are numerous shops, restaurants, and services within walking distance. There was fine Hawaiian entertainment each night as well as food and drinks available at the beautiful pool. Parking is free and close-no long walks to get to your car. No valet service is provided but it is not needed. It is a luxury room for an economy price. The economy comes because you are not paying for a lot of wasted lobby space and facilities the average family will never use but must be included in the price of the room. From Maui we went to the Big Island and stayed in an expensive "luxury hotel". The room was much smaller, the room was not kept clean, housekeeping was sloppy, the staff was surly, and we were a very long walk from our car. I will never stay there again, but the Maui Coast Hotel WILL see us again. We were given the royal treatment there. OH YES. At the Maui Coast Hotel computers were available in the lobby for guests use for no charge. At the expensive "luxury" hotel they charged $5 for 15 minutes on their antiquated computers. You will be pleased with your accomodations at the Maui Coast Hotel. Oh yes, the road to Hana is not as bad as they say. Just drive slow and take the curves easy. It's worth the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Beauty”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely little condo, with all the comforts of home. It is just across the street from a great beach, with safe swimming. This area isn't nearly as crowded as some of the other destinations, but it is easy to reach anything- except Hana! (which isn't easy to reach from anywhere!) The owner of our condo was great, and everything was as described. We are already booked for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok........”
Reviews.Author: Lyonsden77
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 nights at this hotel, it was ok for the price of $167 a night, but we had "crawling bugs" in our room. Parking was free, but very difficult to find a spot if you returned in the evening. A/C was very noisy, it was quieter if you left the door open for the night. Check out Life's a Beach and Kahale's for some local flair.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive Luxury”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights at the Maui Coast in November and found it to be one of the real gems of Kihei. Very clean and very affordable hotel. Most of Kihei is Condo and the only other hotels are old or expensive. The restaurant on site was not part of the hotel proper, and a bit expensive so we preferred to dine locally. A nice clean beach is only a short walk away, and unless you must have the oceanfront views, this is a great choice. Our room was a standard with King bed and also had a small living area.(Divan, chairs and tables etc). The staff were friendly and helpful. Located in South Kihei in a quieter part of town we found it was easy to relax when we wanted. The location was also central enough to allow us to explore the rest of Maui easily. We would love to stay there again on our next visit.

HotelInfo.Name: Maui Coast Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 2259 South Kihei Road, 1 block from Kamaole Beach Park I, Kihei, Maui, HI 96753
